Reviews.Title: “Stay away on weekends!”
Reviews.Author: Marty93
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed last night with friends and they were woken up in the middle of the night by partying guest in rooms close to them. They went downstairs to let know the staff. Security was up there in a few minutes but, were intimidated by the people and backed off. Nobody called the police. The noise went from 4am to 7am. When she went downstairs to get a refund on her room they just gave her a free breakfast. This is unacceptable for the Sheraton brand. On the otherhand, we stayed there before and didn't have any problem. The location is perfect. They should really get there security together and take care of these problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: chasingmellow
Reviews.Content: We visited Montreal back in the fall of 2011. We chose to stay at the Sheraton because CAA gave us a good deal. We stayed 2 nights. We were not disappointed. The location is very convenient and the service was excellent. The room is a bit smaller than some hotels we've stayed in but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had everything we needed plus there's lots of storage for clothes, toiletries, etc. The hotel is close to shopping, restaurants (Queue de Cheval next door is a must), metro, etc. Parking your car is pricey but I'm sure all hotels are like that. I'm sure you can park your car in a lot but why bother when there's valet service at the Sheraton. We signed up for the Starwood Preferred Guest program and we occassionally get emails hotel discounts. We recently received an email about a few Sheraton hotels in North America offering a huge discount for this spring/summer. We booked a room at the Sheraton in Montreal for $109/night! We are going back in May.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Jenyc_native
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this Sheraton and got a good deal on Priceline. You can tell the room was renovated, the popcorn ceiling that continued partway down the wall wasn't the most aesthetically pleasing, but otherwise the room and bathroom were very clean and nice. The king-bed was extremely comfortable. The room itself wasn't huge, but enough space for two people. There was no fridge, so keep that in mind if you need one, I'm guessing you could request one? Generally we order room service, but the menu seemed over-priced, so we refrained. There was complimentary Starbucks coffee and tea that you could make. Decent channels on the TV, but not all of them clear. They have free internet via ethernet cable, bummer, I only had wifi devices, it costs about $14-15 for 24hrs of wifi. It's a good location, near a metro, though we walked to most places. It is super convenient to their Central Station for Amtrak if you're coming from NY. I would definitely recommend this hotel and actually will be staying again this weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, good Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Mozza47
Reviews.Content: W stayed two nights in Montreal at the Le Centre Sheraton, and as expected the service was good - the location was good, everything about this hotel is good. Why can't the Sheraton's in the US be this "good". From the bellboy to the check-in, to the super helpful concierge, it all just flowed ... it was good, but put it all together and the experience was very good. The beds like all Westins/Sheratons are just superb and the Club rooms on the high floors provide excellent views over the city. The lifts were always quick to arrive, and quick up and down the 34 floors. Service in the bar was not as quick as the lifts though. The room we had was certainly in need of an overhaul, particularly the bathroom, with water damaged wall linings cracked tiles, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: SoupAirCool
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in such a fantastic location. All the shopping of St Catherine street and very close to the VIA Rail and Metro. Only stayed for one night for a concert but was very please with the service. The front desk personnel was extremely pleasant and accommodating. The room was lovely. When coming back to Montreal, this property would definitely warrant a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Doisberto
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night with wife and friends. This hotel is really well located, so you can get to St. Catherines walking and it is really close to the subway.Rooms are comfortable, although a bit outdated. Front desk were really helpful. Parking is a bit expensive, as well as food at the restaurant, so try to find other place to eat (and there are a plenty of it!).

Reviews.Title: “nice central location”
Reviews.Author: adchar
Reviews.Content: this is a good hotel very central to downtown. the rooms were nice the pool area was clean and the staff spoke english and french equally well. we stayed overnight to do some shopping and go to the biodome with the kids. we liked it very much. parking was slightly expensive and we did not eat in the hotel. because we used priceline we got a great deal on the room. would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Pricey Breakfast/Parking”
Reviews.Author: Nav S
Reviews.Content: I always love staying at the Sheraton but have recently started considering other options because the menu for in room dining is ridiculous. It costs $44 for two ppl to eat breakfast. So make sure to bring granola bars to hold you over until you can head out to grab something to eat. Hotel parking is also absurd. Too much to pay to park a car. Great thing is that you are centrally located - close to the Eatons Ctr (called something else now) and about 5 minute walk from the metro. Old Montreal is about a $8 taxi ride away. The staff and and the room were great. Very clean room. Very responsive staff. Very comfy beds!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Rob H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton April 5-8, 2012. Great room, great location. Bell Center across the street and St. Catherine St. just seconds away. Lobby Bar is great but a bit pricy. Try a Lychee Martini. My wife swears by them.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and well-maintained. Perfect for Habs games.”
Reviews.Author: stigs17
Reviews.Content: Stayed two separate times in the past month (SPG member). Pros: As standard at almost any Sheraton property, rooms are clean and very well appointed. Super-comfortable beds and pillows. Large work area with a useful desk chair. Contemporary colorful artwork. Large mirrors. Proper rocks glasses. Starbucks coffee. New 42" HD plasma with over 40 channels. Wonderful city views on the West, North and East sides. Directly across from the Bell Centre, close to the vibrant night scene and 3 blocks from the central VIA train station. Great soundproofing between rooms, never heard anything from inside the adjoining rooms (which was full as evidenced by the newspapers outside each door). Quiet heating unit. Decadent lobby and chic restaurant. Smooth check-in, though very busy. Efficient elevators and ice machine. Large bathroom, quality toiletries, tons of counter space. Plush towels. Ergonomic showerhead installed for someone 5'4" of shorter, but relaxing with three different firing settings. Slightly less water pressure than other SPG properties, no doubt for water conservation efforts. Cons: Rooms could use a mini-fridge. Soundproofing around entry door is poor. Expect to hear every door slam or hallway conversation, and due to the square design, many doors are clustered together in each corner. Ditto for the windows, as even on the 30th floor, you can hear the fire trucks blasting sirens several times a day. Lighter or even average sleepers would be well advised to bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: Bruce H
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and a great value. The staff is very helpful and will doing everything to make your stay enjoyable. That being said, in room Internet is $$$ and if you want a drink go to one of the many local pubs ( The hotel bar is very $$$).

Reviews.Title: “Very classical Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Konak_Hotel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sheraton centre Montreal for a long stay. the rooms are spacious and clean (apparently recently renovated). with a nice vew on Montreal. Please avoid the rooms on the North as you won't get any sun and it'a in front of a building hiding the view. the check in / out can take a long time, depending on the receptionist. The room service is quite fast but the food is not really good ... you will have to pay for internet if not member of Sheraton program.You can leave your luggage at the bell desk if you plan to come back in few days but you will have to pay 6$.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: timelesstart
Reviews.Content: Great room,great area . Great bar. Close to great pubs. Very friendly staff and patrons. Had a wonderful time I want to go back as soon as possible .

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: LuceHenriette
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for four nights and really enjoyed facilities and location. Well situated for safe walks at end of day, the hotel is a block from Bell Centre and shopping on Ste-Catherine street. Tried the food at the Boulevard Bistro and found it very enjoyable. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Only one drawback: a charge of 3$ per piece of luggage that you leave with the chasseur: seems unusual for a hotel of this calibre and the rates charged.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous four days”
Reviews.Author: 4rkidz
Reviews.Content: we upgraded our room to club level and had a great room with an amazing view for our girls weekend.. enjoyed the club lounge and the appetizers and breakfasts, was also nice to use their computers as opposed to the lobby. The wind howled a little and the elevator made my ears pop its so fast! Great choice for Montreal..

Reviews.Title: “A tourist hotel with lots of people”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderingCannuck
Reviews.Content: I was here for a weekend. Just too many people,and all a bit crazy. Took more than half and hour to check in. I have never seen a check in line up so big. Also expensive-- bar, restaurant and internet not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location but the staff attitude needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: slarmer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Montreal for the March Break with my teen. We attended a few events at the Bell Centre and, honestly, you couldn't ask for a better location.... It took but a few minutes to walk there. Also, we shopped alot! Walking downtown was a breeze and a nice way to get some exercise. Now to the not so good stuff. I want to start out by saying that I LOVE the Sheraton. We always stay in the Queen Street location when we are in Toronto. I especially love their beds! The Montreal Sheraton just wasn't the same standard as the ones in Toronto. The staff in the restaurants were insanely rude. I've never been treated so poorly. The food was very overpriced for the value. I didn't find any of the staff to be particularly friendly EXCEPT the room service staff. And I didn't honestly find our room was cleaned very well at all. It looked as though the maid threw the sheets up and left. I'm not sure I'd go back. I did like the location but that was all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: Maxspeed
Reviews.Content: This is a quality hotel I found at an outstanding price. The location cannot be ant better, as it is located across from the Bell Centre and one block from Rue Ste. Catherine. The room was clean and the beds incredibly comfortable. The hotel staff were good. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good location, but stuff needs to be retrain”
Reviews.Author: skyone
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 1:30am in the morning The front desk was very nice, however she is very slow, she have to understand, is late, I been on the road all day, so she really need to speed things up Next morning, I went down stairs, I saw the bellman, and I asked, where is the concierge desk. He pointed me the desk and told me is not open till 11am. 11am?? People going on vacation, time is counting, I don't want to stay in the room till 11am So I walked to the front desk, and the front desk agent saw me, didn't say Hi or Good morning, to me book, that unacceptable I asked, do you have any information for the Montreal, where is the must see places? He pointed me to the bellman. I walked back to the bellman and asked him the same information He replied: Yes, I do tours here and he handed me the Gray Line Bus Tour booklet I'm like what the hell? I need a map of downtown Montreal and some information where all the must see places. He replied: You have to wait for Concierge Later on that day, I went online and did some researched my self, and found out lot more information about Montreal, later in the evening, I asked my friend to go down stairs and check with the concierge how can we get to the basilica. He told my friend is only end of the block from the hotel. He must be losing his mind! The closes train is 3 blocks away, not a big deal, I from New York, I can walk 3 short blocks, but the problem is he giving us a incorrect information, not good The hotel is located downtown area, central of everything, close to the train station, many taxi parked at the back of the hotel, soonest you walk outside, is there. Many restaurants is walking distance, this hotel is located in 1201 Rene Levesque Boul West, is only 1 block walking distance from St Catherine Street, St Catherine Street is like a main street, many activities going on there, shopping, food, strip clubs. lol Now let's talk about inside the hotel This hotel have 2 elevators from the lobby to the underground garage, and 6 elevators from the lobby to rooms up stairs, I think the hotel have 35 floors, I'm on 31st, over see the city view Hotel room is basic, nothing really special or stand out Overall, 3 stars, hotel services, front desk, concierge, bellman, 1 star I'm not going to say I will not be back, but they do have many other options in that area, if you traveling there in a slow seasons, you might able to get a good rate

Reviews.Title: “Great location. service, comfort”
Reviews.Author: Tea_Meister
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for 3 nights. Hotel staff was attentive and efficient. Easy to get in and out of the hotel, the elevators are speedy evenon the upper floors. There is a very nice exercise facility including an indoor pool. Room was modern, plenty of outlets, flat screen, wireless worked well. Lots to see and do around the area. Access to the airport is about 20-25 minutes. Bar is nice but a bit pricey $15 for a standard glass of vino or $16 for a Scotch.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises - a great weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Guywilltravel
Reviews.Content: This was home base for a weekend in Montreal with our two adult children - 2 rooms. The staff were outstanding. The rooms were very neat and clean but the washroom was a little dated. Answered our questions with no issues. Valet parking was a little on the slow side so do not expect an immediate response. Did not purchase food or services in the hotel itself so we cannot comment on the prices. Location was ideal - one block to the south was Bell Centre and one block north was the Ste-Catherine Street shopping district. A great big thank you to the staff for allowing us to extend our check out time. It may not seem like a lot but it was very important to us - they were very accomodating. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: JandK786
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what you would expect from a large Sheraton property; it has large conference facilities, its situated right downtown in the business district and its tailored for business travelers. The hotel has undergone extensive renovations, as you can tell immediately when you walk in the lobby. The hotel was built in the 70's but when you walk into the lobby you feel like you're in a brand new hotel! The room was very large and renovated, however the bathroom still felt a bit old. It was a corner room with window facing west and south, with nice views of downtown Montreal (Bell Centre, etc.). The bed was incredibly comfortable. Although everything is a short-walk away in this area of downtown Montreal, the one downside is that the hotel is not connected to the underground city / metro (unlike Hilton, Fairmont and Marriott downtown, which all have direct access to the underground city and the metro). That being said, there's plenty of nice restaurants in the vicinity, more affordable places on Stanley street (adjacent), shopping on St. Catherine street is 1 block away and the nearest metro is 1 block south of the hotel. All I'm saying is that on a freezing Montreal winter day, direct access to the underground without going outside is a nice plus :-) I would highly recommend this hotel is you're in Montreal for a business trip, especially if you're an SPG member (there's an excellent lounge on the upper floor). If you want to come into town for the weekend for leisure purposes, there are probably better hotels (although the prices here are very competitive, especially in low season).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sukhdeep L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a road trip from Toronto to Ottawa to Montreal, stayed at Sheraton Le Centre Montreal Hotel for 2 nights. The hotel was great, location was wonderful, but the steep hill driving down to it was a bit scarey. Hotel was walks away from the main stores and restaurants. Definitely will go back again!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest view in town”
Reviews.Author: MariusF1
Reviews.Content: If you book a room in the upper floors you will have the best view over the town. It is close to the city centre, shopping, good connection to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: phil1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton in February for a boys trip with my father and brothers. The hotel was reasonably priced and in a great location, (not far from the Canadiens hockey stadium and tons of restaurants and bars). The rooms are nothing special, but also there is nothing especially wrong with them, just typical I suppose. The service was great as usual with the Sheraton and there was a rooftop bar/lounge that offers very beautiful views.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: SweetVanillaCSmooth
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Centre Sheraton when I go to Montreal on business for about 10 years. I've never had any kind of problems that weren't immediately taken care of to my satisfaction (and none that were the hotels fault) Rooms always clean, employees have all been nice and the bar (while expensive) is a good place for a night cap.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hotel that gouges............”
Reviews.Author: WestCoast123
Reviews.Content: Was once a really good top end hotel but not so much now as a place where you will stay and if not careful get gouged for food, service and EVERYTHING ELSE. Eat out - Montreal has some of the finest eateries in the world with great vibes. Everything in Le Centre Sheraton is super expensive. There are nicer boutique hotels I'll use in future. Its not like I'm desperate for the points!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay at the Sheraton Le Centre Montreal”
Reviews.Author: mrl975
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from Feb 24th to 26th for a romantic weekend with my partners. We got a good deal for the room and spent under $150 per night for a deluxe king room. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and I would stay at this hotel again if the price was right once again. Here is some information I would have liked to have known before going. 1. The hotel is a little hard to spot from a distance just because of the way it is designed and where the signage is. We drove right past it - luckily circling around the block is simple enough. The location was great for our plans. We were about a $10 cab ride from many clubs and bars, about 2 blocks from the shopping on St. Catherine street, a couple blocks from the bell centre and less than a 10 min drive to Old-Montreal. 2. There is heated underground parking below the hotel for $24/24 hours. This does include a full 24 hour period, as we remained parked there during the day after checking out while we did some shopping. I'm sure there is cheaper parking around, but for the convenience and security, this worked. Only thing i didn't appreciate was that they charged my credit card automatically for the parking without confirming with me first. 3. Our room was quite spacious, very clean and comfortable. There was a sitting area with pull out sofa by the window which i thought was nice to have. Large flat screen TV. Lots of pillows and linens. The bed was a touch uncomfortable, but i think we are spoiled with our mattress at home. There was no mini-fridge in the room, not the end of the world but it is something i like to have when traveling. We were on the 32nd floor and the view was fantastic, especially at night. Bathroom was nice, though the lighting is a little dark. And one thing i found strange - they give you only one robe in the room....two seems more logical, but oh well. There is free internet in the lobby area, but it is $15/24 hours to get internet in the room. We were half of an adjoining room and I have to say, the noise can be bad. We were unfortunately next to a crying baby, which made sleeping in somewhat of a challenge. If you're next to quiet people though, i guess you're good to go. 4. There is a cafe in the hotel open for breakfast and lunch only, and a bar/lounge which is open until 1 am. We didnt go to either of these so I cannot comment on them, but they seemed to be mostly empty. We also didn't use the pool/fitness facilities, but they are open until 10 pm. There was quite an extensive roomservice menu (again, we didn't try it) that was rather expensive, but what room service isn't? In general, an enjoyable stay and definitely worth it if only for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: thousandislands2
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre is the quintisential business hotel with all of the requisite features (free lobby wifi, clean rooms, central location, plenty of parking). I was pleasantly surprised by the virtually brand new fitness room which has more new equipment than my local gym :) The location is ideal if you're attending a game at the Bell Centre. The only drawbacks are pricey underground parking ($24 - but that's the price of driving in a MTL) and the fact that you are a healthy walk from tourist destinations along the water. We'll definitely return to MTL and when we do we'll look for the Sheraton first.

Reviews.Title: “August 2011 stay two rooms for two nights”
Reviews.Author: JTofAshland
Reviews.Content: Staff was very nice and helpful. Rooms were clean and bright. They accomodated our request for adjoining rooms. The location is ok - in the financial district - it was a long walk to the old city but we had great summer weather and all piled in a cab ride back that evening. I don't recall what floor we were on - about halfway up this hi-rise, but I do have a complaint about our room. There was water dripping down the window from the AC of the room above us (at least that's what the very nice service man told us who came up promptly when we called about it). Nothing he could do to fix it so we put a towel there which was soaked by morning. Also some mold in the shower which is not a deal breaker, but our room didn't sparkle like I generally expect from a four star hotel. Overall it was fine and I would stay again at a reasonable rate, but I personally would try to get a little closer to the old city since that's where we enjoyed exploring the most.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: sorjue
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights this past weekend. It was a pleasant surprise. We had stayed at the Le Meridien Versailles last time and found it a bit disappointing but the Sheraton was great. Nice lobby, friendly staff and the room was large and nice (although we did get upgraded from my gold status). Had a few hiccups like a weird $5 charge but it was easily resolved. Location was great, 1 block south of Rue St. Catherines. The washroom wasn't anything special but it had the nice body wash that not all Sheraton's have. Internet isn't free but at least they have the free Microsoft internet lobby area. Parking is expensive $24 for self park but we arrived at night and parking at meters is free after 9pm until 9am the next day. Another bonus, on Saturday's it's free after 6pm until 1pm the next day! If you can't get street parking the Stanley parking right beside the hotel is only $12 a night I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfnhockey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Feb. 17 to 20. Really, my only complaints are that they charge about 15$ a day for internet in the room (it's free in the lobby, but it's not the same...) and 24$ a day for parking. Other than that, it was a good place to stay, close to all the action in downtown Montreal. The room was clean and well appointed, the elevators fast, the beer in the lobby bar was good... I would recommend this hotel for sure, but it would be nice with free internet in the room and cheaper parking.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: Brett S
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in Montreal at this hotel. Check in was fine though there was a bit of a line. Upon arrival they had our room ready for us with the crib we requested. Our room with two double beds was clean and in very good condition. Parking in the hotel garage was $24 and they do not have free Internet in the room (but the do have free wireless and several computers in the lobby). We enjoyed the hotel pool and hot tub. They were packed with families, kids and young adults which might have been a drawback if we were seeking some privacy, but our kids loved it. Overall this is a nice very large city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: love2travelz08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Family Day weekend, and had a good experience. The hotel was very busy on Saturday evening when we arrived, but check in took about 3 minutes. If all charges are okay when leaving, you can check out over the phone. Parking is $24 per day for self park, which is on the pricey side, but the in and out privileges are nice to have if you are planning on using your car. We had an amazing city view from the 25th floor. The beds were comfy and the room clean. The only reason I am giving 4/5 is because of the paper-thin walls. The people in the room next to use were having some "fun" around 1:30am and woke us up- not cool especially after a long day of driving. Other than that, the location is amazing - 20 minute walk to old Montreal, Bell Centre is across the street and St. Catherine's St. is one block north. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Renovations at Established Montreal Property”
Reviews.Author: simonadelftblue51
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since we stayed at this well established Montreal hotel. Unfortunately it was just a short Saturday night stay. We hardly recognized the place when we walked in. The lobby is now very modern and fresh looking. Check-in was friendly and efficient. The room was spacious, modern and very clean. The mattress and pillows were ultra comfortable. The location is terrific, just below Ste. Catherine Street and close to stores, restaurants and nightlife. Although the hotel was sold out when we were there, we did not see huge lineups anywhere. Even the elevators moved quickly. Didn't like the hefty wi-fi fee in room, otherwise I would have rated this hotel excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jiabao
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Location is absolutely great. 2 Minutes walk from St Catherine. 2. View is good if you are on higher floors. 3. Room is spacious with a small sofa and leg rest. 4. Room service people is nice. 5. Not a big deal but in-room Starbucks coffee is good. 6. Parking is $24 until next day 6pm which in my opinion is pretty worth it considering the $3/hour high rate on street parking. Cons: 1 AC/heater unit is a HUGE problem: * First off it has very bad noise, the kind of high frequency noise that made my heart beat rate to rise during sleep. Very disturbing. Couldn't sleep if not because I was so tired. * Secondly it's impossible to adjust to the right temperature. There's no control for temperature, just heat level. If you set it a little bit higher it's going to make the room very HOT. If you set it just a bit lower, at first you feel it's blowing a proper and warm air flow but after some time it is going to blow COLD air. If you adjust it higher again it's gonna get very hot again then you need to adjust it down again. Then it becomes very cold in the room again. I had to get up multiple times at night to do this repeatedly. Had a terrible sleep as you can imagine. 2. When checking in, the front desk refused to honour the complimentary room upgrade or 4pm late checkout that should come with my Preferred Plus SPG membership. I can certainly understand no room upgrade (because of availability) but she lied outright to me (or was being totally ignorant) saying that only Platinum members (not even Gold) get 4pm, which is simply not true.

Reviews.Title: “amazing view”
Reviews.Author: Janymontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 3220 and we had such an amazing view of the city. We had requested a view on an upper floor and they delivered big time. It also was a clean, comfortable and modern room. There is also a beautiful gym which is not well-shown in their website, but bring your gym clothes as it is very nice. There are lots of restaurants around where you can get food and bring to your room. We will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location downtown”
Reviews.Author: maltyone
Reviews.Content: More than familiar with this property now, although its not new they renovate and keep on top of things. pro's Location - a block from the metro and saint catherines, same distance from the Bell centre on the opposite side. Club lounge on the 37th has an amazing view of the city. con's really aren't any to speak of, older so you can hear nearby construction if you are a light sleeper like me, but far from a problem

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: snowkoan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights last October and had a very good experience. The hotel is very central and close to the train station, Crescent Street, St. Catherine Street etc... The hotel itself is in good shape. We spent time in our room, the pool, business centre, hair salon, and the restaurant. All were quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: BrendanC_4
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Le Centre Sheraton when I go to Montreal. I think 99% of the time I go to Montreal, I go to see a Leafs game and this hotel is only about a 5-minute walk from the Bell Centre. It has a great location and very spacious, clean, comfortable rooms. The service at the hotel is generally good, maybe a little inconsistent. The steakhouse across the street is excellent (but expensive). Overall, a very good hotel with a great location. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: kc003
Reviews.Content: First time I went to this hotel I got horrible service and was very disappointed. I went back recently and got amazing service and I loved it. The hotel manager helped me with my room and accommodating for our two hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel average service”
Reviews.Author: kathy G
Reviews.Content: was there recently in Jan for an insurance conference hotel was nice but the service was average during the meetings....

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysW0rking
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I'm a loyal Starwood member and seek out their properties. Have stayed in this hotel many times - summer, winter, for business and pleasure. Other than their expensive scotch menu, the place is great, service is friendly and rooms are well appointed. The parking lot can be a bit of a challenge at times, but it's easier to self-park than to valet. Old Montreal is a 30 minute walk. The festival (Jazz/Comedy) is also walkable, albeit about 30+ minutes depending on how fast you walk. Lots of shopping (yuck) and food (yay) places within a 10 minutes walk. I've stayed at other Starwood and non-Starwood properties in downtown Montreal but keep coming back to this place. Generally there about 8-10 times/year.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, interesting upgrade but so very, very dated”
Reviews.Author: interpolation
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of October 2011. Overall, the experience was fine it not forgettable - so much so that I forgot to write up a review for this hotel. On the plus side, it is centrally located and within walking distance to the Metro. The breakfast bar on the executive suite, which we received as an upgrade through redemption of points, was nice with fresh Montreal-style bagels and coffee. The views were very nice. We were on the highest possible floor (one below the executive suite) and the room was furnished in a way typical of a Sheraton. The bed was very comfortable and met our expectations. The negatives included the overall look and feel of the hotel (very dated - much more so than the Sheraton Centre in Toronto, which went up at the same time and has the same concrete design elements), the amenities on-site (no convenient access to good restaurants, a SAQ etc) and the cost of parking, which was very expensive considering what parking cost nearby. Would probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal visit 2011”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel located in the city center of Montreal with an excellent view over the city from the upper levels of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel A++”
Reviews.Author: C_Pennell_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers great rooms along with great dining! The hotels location is great especially if attending a hockey game at the Bell Center! Cheap rates if booked through sites such as Hotwire.com, and Expedia.ca.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Missy2206
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here with friends and with my husband who was attending a Union AGM. Each time I have stayed here it has always been a pleasureable experience. The staff is ready to help with anything you need. Great prices and beautiful rooms each time. It is close to shopping, dining, train station and a great comedy club only a short walk away. The club lounge was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice, but probably not a third”
Reviews.Author: WindycityMatt
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, the Sheraton Le Centre is a fine hotel. However, I would never want to pay the full standard price. Both times I stayed here after getting a sweet deal from Hotwire. It's a big corporate style hotel in the middle of downtown Montreal. If you are here for business it's great. If you have a family and want to swim in the pool and have a fitness center it's great. The place is pretty close to many of the trains and a short cab ride down to old Montreal. However, if you are looking for a more personal experience in a smaller hotel outside of the commercial zone then this is not your place.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient efficiency”
Reviews.Author: ielkin
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location. Quick check-in/check-out. Garage parking (for a charge). Good views of the city from top floors! Walking distance to everything , and T-station right next to it. Cons: low water flow from the faucet, the door is not sound-proof. Pros: comfortable bed, sparkling bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: mjoma22
Reviews.Content: First I should say that if you are a starwood preferred guest at this hotel they go out of there way to acknowledge this and make you comfortable! i went with 2 of my friends and reservations had Booked us in a small suite with a rollaway bed. Well it turns out a rollaway bed really didn't fit in that suite so when I called and complained they upgraded us to a spacious suite with 2 bathrooms. Next we had an issue with construction being done early in the morning at the hotel. If definitely woke us up early. When we went to complain they acknowledged the problem gave us a room credit and even offered us breakfast coupons. They really know how to remedy a problem and make their guest feel better if something is not turning out as expected. Overall I would say it was a pleasure to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JogNy
Reviews.Content: This is a first-class hotel in a very good location, central to the business and shopping district and within walking distance of the old town. Hockey arena is a few blocks away. Many restaurants, department stores and boutiques in the area. Nice swimming pool, health club and jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tim103
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the sheraton and we were not disappointed. The rooms seemed to have a face lift. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. This hotel does not have a true restaurant for dinner but the room service food choices were excellent and delivered super fast.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could stay longer”
Reviews.Author: maehem
Reviews.Content: It was unfortunate that we could only stay overnight at this hotel, it was terrific! The service was friendly and warm, the rooms were huge, and the bathroom was clean, large and well ventilated (I hate bathrooms that do not have a fan in it) Free use of business centre was a huge convenience for us, however, no free wifi which is almost unforgivable in this day and age... although they have more than made up for that slight inconvenience with all the other things they do so well. Wish we could've have stayed a bit longer.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: alex655
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Having said that it is a typical Sheraton. You can get good rates but nothing comes with the room. Internet, breakfast and parking come on top. Those items can add a lot of money tomyour bill. Parking is 24/day. I recommend you park your car yourself which would allow you to save a coiple of bucks. If you want to be downtown and find good rates online then go.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is a bit of a zoo, but nice room”
Reviews.Author: NCLimey
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night. I think that there were multiple conferences and gatherings attended as the lobby seemed to be jammed with various groups of people that often seemed oblivious to the fact that they were completely blocking the passage between the doors, check-in and elevators. Maybe the hotel could employ some kind of roped off walkway area, so that people can mill around, slack jawed a little more out of people's way that want to pass through. The room was very nice, fantastic view of Montreal. I liked the TV input panel, nice large TV, and work area with free internet. The bed and bedding were very nice - very comfy quilt like at home. Staff were very helpful. Instead of trying room service, I had the bright idea of going out to a nearby eaterie and roughing it with some Palestinian Shawarma, which although tasted great, gave me terrible breath and a garlic overdose (headache and dodgy stomach the next morning). I would have enjoyed this stay much more if the lobby didn't seem so chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION IN MONTREAL”
Reviews.Author: swiss1968
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sheraton on first week of December. I booked a Kind Size room in the Club level. Room very spacious with a very big bed confortable for two person. Nice bathroom very well cleaned. I had my breakfast (continental not american) on club level on the last floow with a huge view over Montreal. Hotel very well located just two step far away from the Center Bell (go habs go) as well as the the shopping avenues. I would recommend you if you want to stay in the heart of the city. Je me souviens.

Reviews.Title: “feeling at home”
Reviews.Author: Petra_ehrhard
Reviews.Content: I've stayed again in Le Sheraton in October and was again super happy with the service and hotel experience. Staff even remembered my name and gave me the true feeling to be happy to see me again. Breakfast was great, check in very friendly and efficient, people look into your eyes, they care for you. The concierge service is one of the best I have experienced, 5* status! Location is great, you are in the centre of the city, from there it is easy to reach everything. I'll definitely go there again if I can. I felt being at home.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Robert_In_LondonUK
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is my fav hotel in Montreal. I stay here between 1 and 6 weeks per year. Renovated rooms are spacious, facilities are great, pool and hot tub make it a great place to relax. smack in the middle of the city. It is on the upper end for Sheratons

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlGrl77
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Montreal was to see the opening night of Immortal in Centre Bell. This hotel was literally a 5 minute walk away from door to door which was one the main reasons I booked. However, I had no clue it was so close to the major shopping drag! At right about an 8 minute's walk-away is Rue St. Catherine which is a major gateway to the famed Underground City. Eek! What a wonderful shopping concept! Your treasured loonies and twoonies will be spent faster than you can ask "Parlez-vous franÃ§ais?" Oops, back to the hotel... The hotel is generally standard as it comes to the Starwood brand. I have nothing but good things to say about the staff from housekeeping, concierge, bar, doormen, etc. I didn't use the gym or spa, but did find some nice commemorative trinkets in the gift store downstairs. The only minor issue is the check-in desk. It was a weird set-up of 3 kiosk-like counters with no direction of who was checking in who. My group happened to be behind a large group of people who at any given time were both checking in as a group and individually. It's very hard to be on the other side of a customer service issue, but a quick summation of who all was together and who still needed to be helped could have helped both the staff and the guests. Another slight to the review is the pricey room service. It's best to just leave the property and eat at a nearby restaurant. I recommend this hotel for its location and price. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: OakBay1
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beat. Not even one block away from the Bell center and one block from the st. Catherine's street with tons of shopping and resturants. We usually can book through a special on their website - some long weekends go for 3rd night free - always check for deals. We did eat at the resturant one morning however we had a special where this was included in our price. Normal breakfast of eggs,bacon, toast & homefries run$20/person so it is expensive although it was very good. The hotels is very clean and very organized. The staff are great and knowledable. We used the conceirge service and they were fantastic - recommending outside resturants, giving maps and calling for reservations. WE will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but meals could be pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Loves_Snorkeling
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel on business. Hotel is 2 blocks away from Bell Centre and 2 blocks away from St. Catherine street. Lots of restaurants are nearby. The food prices including room service were very expensive in my opinion. Because of this I eat at nearby restaurants. I would stay again just for the location. One major negative is that there is a fire station near the hotel so this was very annoying in the evening. Next time, I would ask for a room on the other side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of the City....”
Reviews.Author: terrill03
Reviews.Content: So it's not in Old Montreal....minor detail....it's centrally located, and within walking distance to the Montreal Forum (if you like hockey) shopping on St.Catherine Street, not too far from other great shopping areas on Rue St.Denis and Rue St.Laurent. The hotel I was told was extensively refrusished over the last 6 or so months and it shows. Great lobby area, business centre, actually a nice bar and bistro. It was raining a bit when I first arrived and they also had complimentary umbrellas for the taking - nice. The actual guest room was also good, lots of space, in-room internet connection, lots of counter space and storage in the bathroom, and a great view from the 32nd floor - ask for a higher floor. Plus one tip...there is a SPG lounge on the 37th floor - if they don't mention it - ask for access - great view up there, offers free munchies and beverages available too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Albertusguntur
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very nice, Good location, more than adequate for our stay in this wonderful city full of memorable. Very nice staff and great room.

Reviews.Title: “Love the chain, but persistent irritants”
Reviews.Author: gwilliams
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sheraton hotels frequently, because they are always dependable, have great staff, and really comfortable beds. However, the are also dependably irritating when it comes to internet access and other little things. They haven't landed on the shift from good to great - when the Motel 6 offers free wireless and bag check, shy does a hotel like this charge $15/day for wireless, and ask me to pay to store my bag after checkout? Bizarre - get the little things right, and you'll deserve both the superior rating, and the right to charge the rates you do.

Reviews.Title: “Service charges for everything”
Reviews.Author: padraigincanada
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not bad -- clean, good location, Sheraton beds, etc. It's under a bit of renovation right now which might improve it a bit. BUT, the problem is they try to rob you with service fees. Unlike most hotels in the world -- they still charge you $1.25 for every local phone call, even if you're in their Starwood Club. They have the SLOWEST WORST internet access I've seen at any hotel in Canada -- and yet they charge $14.95 EVERY DAY !!!! to access it (it is PAINFULLY slow whether you log-on by wire or by wireless, and costs the same either way.) The last straw was, upon leaving, I took 2 suitcases to leave with the bell desk until my meetings ended. THEY CHARGE FOR THIS TOO !! $3 per suitcase. I couldn't believe it !! The bellman just shrugged when I complained, the front desk clerk said it was due to "the union" and gave me the Director of Ops business card. I won't be back at this property ever again -- the Fairmont, just down the street, is a very old hotel but exceptionally higher class than the sheraton and is free for all of the above. The room rate is the full rate. I suspect the same holds true for Marriott which is also a block away. Do yourself a favour and avoid this property.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there a few times. I only stay there when there is a good rate or when the conference is there. The location of the hotel is not bad. The rooms are clean and average. They do have a line for gold and platinum members but that line is hopeless. I would recommend just staying at the regular line unless they change the system. I once tried to tell the staff there that there's got to be a better system to serve their gold and platinum members but the staff didn't seem to be interested to listen. She did apologize and said she's following the system she's taught. Stay at the Westin or the W if you can!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT MONTREAL VIEWS FROM THIS DATED CHAIN”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveler50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a party week-end mid Nov & had a great time. Nobody raises an eyebrow when you stumble in at 4 - 5 am, it's expected in fun-loving Montreal. Rooms clean & beds comfy, service is excellent though 37th floor business lounge was full of kids, very noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Little things matter at a major chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: gkq
Reviews.Content: This is a standard, 3 to 4-star downtown hotel, so I assume the basics. The room was pleasant, the bed was comfortable, etc. The little touches - both present and absent - become critical. On the positive side, there were enough hangers and, particularly, enough skirt/pant hangers. There were lots of available outlets (at least 8) , so I didn't have to unplug lamps to charge devices overnight. Three cheers for that! There is a pod with several computers and a printer in the lobby.On the negative side, the in-room Wi-Fi is $15/day, the pool was not available and the fitness centre under construction [no warning on the website or in the rooms about this], the room service charges were excessive, the menu choices limited, and the housekeeping inconsistent. The final irritation was being charged $3 a bag to have my luggage held between checkout and time to leave for my flight -despite a hotel bill of almost $1,000. "Nickel and dime" seems to be Sheraton's approach to balancing their books. It would be better to charge a little more on the room rate and improve the service.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T
Reviews.Content: Was accompanying my 93 year old mother to Montreal to visit with friends. We arrived at the wrong entrance apparently. (The one on Rene Levesque). No one there to direct us or to assist me with her walker, etc. We were not informed that the bar and dining room would be closed. Also, the fitness room was under construction and had been temporarily relocated. The beds are very comfortable. The staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster Service”
Reviews.Author: 2due
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in October 2011. Other than allowing us an early check-in, which we appreciated, the front desk service was slow and unhelpful: we waited 15 minutes or more at each visit (not enough staff, or staff that were doing something on the computer while others waited in line); they couldn't tell us if shops would be open on the Thanksgiving holiday; we had to return to collect an amenity gift that was not offered on arrival nor in our room, and they acted as if we were double-dipping. No warmth at all. The room itself, a deluxe room on a higher floor, had a great view that was marred by grimy windows (face and handprints on the inside), pictures that were not level, and dated decor. The bed, as we always find at Starwood properties, was comfortable and we liked the lobby bar. The small pool was mobbed with kids at all hours, so we weren't able to enjoy it. We will choose a different hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get what we paid for...”
Reviews.Author: DIVA8707
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fully paid for in advance. My husband and I asked for an early check-in and were happy they were able to accomodate however we paid for a king bed not a queen. We were so tired we didn't notice till the next day. Found the rooms to be very warm and had to turn on the air conditioning in mid November... Additionally at check-in the staff did not remind us that we had a continental breakfast & evening d'oeuvres included. We had checked in with only our reference # and forgot the details of our booking. As a Starwood preferred guest we expected more attention and service.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Jaysm78
Reviews.Content: As a corporate office employee for Starwood, I expected nothing but the best in service from all of our Brands of hotels. During my stay my wife, friends and I noticed that with the exception of a few employees most of the other employees was not as helpful. When we would ask a question in regards to our stay or our hotel bill it felt like the associate just wanted to answer our question and get us out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Babyruth325
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice and lives up to it's reputation. The only problem was that I picked the Sheration for the location and the fact that it had a swimming pool. I found out in the morning just before heading to the pool that it was closed, so I was no very impressed about that.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: elpolloloco
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great and if you're lucky enough to get a room on an upper floor, you might get a great view of Mont-Royal and the downtown area. On the downside, 15$ a day for Internet in your room (when it is free in the lobby), 1,50$/bag for consignment, and MILDEW in the bathroom (see pictures) like I've never seen before in a hotel room, makes this hotel a 3.5 in my opinion. On the plus side, the bed was very comfy and the front desk staff was very helpfuil and in a good mood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: simjenk
Reviews.Content: The pluses: the bed was really comfortable. The reception service was good. My wife and I also enjoyed having a drink in the hotel bar. The drinks were expensive but the atmosphere of the bar (high ceilings, nice lighting) was great. Really close to west end of St. Catherine street. Lots of breakfast places nearby. The nearest metro station is a little bit of a walk but no big crisis at this time of year. Free high speed Internet in the lobby. The negatives: the pool is pretty lame; it's small and in a windowless room without much joy. The hotel tried to spruce up the area with some greco decor but there's not much you can do with that space.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Maclock
Reviews.Content: Is Le Centre Sheraton Montreal perfect? Not by any means. Is it as good a deal as you're going to get on Priceline? It's about as good as it gets. I have stayed at only one or two Priceline properties that were better than this. The service was very good, the location is ideal, and the garage parking is both easy and secure. All in all, Le Centre Sherton Montreal offers very good value if you bid strategically using Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: jeremych
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of nights ago to celebrate my buddy's Birthday. We traveled all the way from Switzerland to celebrate this special occasion. The receptionist promptly upgraded us and congratulated us. We also had Club lounge access. The breakfast was a nice continental breakfast and the Hors d'heuves were nice to. The view from the club lounge is amazing and the staff is nice to. They're 2 Computer which are touchscreen, that one can use. The room itself was amazing. We had a view of all Montreal from our room (Floor 33). The beds were heavenly... If I could I would have taken them home with me.. Its hard getting out of bed in the morning :). The pool is nice not to big though. The hot tub and sauna was closed.I am not sure when they're going to reopen them. The gym has been relocated to the floor below the lobby. The Hotel bar is nice to, but quite expensive 2 Club sandwiches (70CAD) with 2 Cokes. The staff were all really kind and always gave us directions and great tips. I can truly only recommend this hotel. We got a Sweet Deal for 134 CAD with 40 CAD credit, a welcome gift and a late checkout. The hotel is located right next to Rue Ste-Catherine which is good for shopping. So the location is brilliant to!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel in the heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: siesta802
Reviews.Content: I chose the cheapest hotel out of our choices so I had lower expectations. The location was perfect. We rode our bikes to Mount Royal from our hotel and walked to dinner in Old Montreal. Everything we wanted to do was within walking distance. We brought our 35 pound dog and there was no extra fee. Our room was clean and the perfect size for 2 of us and our dog. The staff was friendly and nice. Parking was easy. We were pleasantly surprised and really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Use The Indoor Parking”
Reviews.Author: Bruce M
Reviews.Content: Parked ater 3pm on Friday and left Saturday at 1:30pm, less than 24 hours in total and charged two days rate of $48. Ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Three star at best”
Reviews.Author: EHRINCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in September, parts of the hotel were undergoing renovation so they were closed. It's in a great location, rooms are fairly normal though ours was a bit small. The most troubling was the obvious mold in the shower, enough to cause us to wonder about overall cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Anton M
Reviews.Content: Superior quality hotel, spacious room and bathroom with super-comfortable bed, excellent restaurant breakfast. The only drawback was lack of free wireless internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay in montreal”
Reviews.Author: baloubaka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located if you're planning on walking around downtown a lot. Room was great, just the right size, clean and the comfortable bed was a big plus. Simply put a great hotel. Watch for special offers on the hotel's website especially for last minute trips!

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping on an airplane or a bus at Disney”
Reviews.Author: cdchacker
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old daughter and I were on the 36th floor in room 3620. The view was magnificent, the room was very clean and very comfortable. Upon entering the room we found the temperature to be perfect given the chilly weather outside. Apparently there is a "air shaft vent" just outside this room and it makes a noise that is very reminisent of what it's like to be flying on a long airplane flight. My daughter said it reminded her of being on one the buses at Disney World. Either way we were both bothered by the noise and by the fact that the floor of the room had a distinct vibration in it for long periods of time. I love this hotel but would not choose to stay in room 3620 again. C. Chan

Reviews.Title: “Luggage storage”
Reviews.Author: Norrlandska
Reviews.Content: ok hotel, but, you were charged CAD 2 for each luggage you wanted to store until you were about to leave the hotel-- outrageous fee. First time this has happened to me-- just because it is Sheraton which is expensive as such, I donÂ´t think that this makes it ok to charge you for keeping luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location....”
Reviews.Author: anne6018
Reviews.Content: and smallish rooms.....! Knees hit the door to the bathroom! The sheets did not fit the bed! Small walkaround room, but do-able. 2 days was enough. Would look for a hotel in Old Town the next time. The food was good, esp. in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Misty H
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff were great. I was disappointed that I was not able to upgrade being a SPG member and my stay was for 6 nights. Also, I woke up very early in the morning to window washers outside of my room talking very loudly. This was very upsetting. In addition, there were other workers outside of my room with ladders making a lot of noise late at night.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: FINKEI
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine till I was leaving and trying to get a taxi at your exit.. I was late and in a rush and your 'Taxi Calling' guy aked me if I needed a taxi 3 times to which I responded 3 times 'yes' as I was rushing out the door .He obviously does not understand 'yes' or was to involved in his own world to notice I was in a hurry. He slowly pulled himself away from the wall inside as I went thru your door [he was still not to the door]as he was saying"I'm your taxi man".I responded that I was in hurry to which he sarcastically said "then go" and turned and walked back inside to resume his leaning on the inside wall. If I was not in a rush to get to my appointment I would have returned and told him what I thought if him and his hotel!!!!! His attitude is what I did not appreciate and will be remembered. He brought your rating down from very good to poor!! PEOPLE make a hotel more than the bricks and motar.....also,you should have free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother paying for internet.”
Reviews.Author: p b
Reviews.Content: Honestly, when the cost for a hotel room is around $200, the internet service should: A- Not suck- this internet is slow and weak. $14.95 is honestly insulting for this subpar, lame slow service. B- WORK ALL THE TIME- Constantly timing out. If YOU'RE GOING TO GIVE ME SLOW SERVICE, DONT CHARGE ME FOR IT. I hate you, Sheraton. Your service is garbage.

Reviews.Title: “No free internet in Rooms and expensive printing”
Reviews.Author: Andrea M
Reviews.Content: While the property and rooms and location are fantastic, the issue with the Sheraton chain is they charge $14.95 a day to use the internet in the guest rooms. I understand that uploading and downloading rings up quite the bill, but my suggestion would be to just block those sites, so that people can at the very least check emails without having to trug down, in my case, 24 floors to use a public computer. In addition, charging $1/page to print is excessive. Not a very travelling professional friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & courteous service, comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: JRfrom-TO
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location to everyting in downtown Montreal. Entertained some clients at the Canadiens game, and they were very delighted with the accomodations and courteous service from all the staff. The Club room was also delight. I have stayed many times at another hotel 2 blocks east, and never receive such courteous service. I am definately making the switch to the Starwood chain and Sheraton. 1 happy customer!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Excellence Service”
Reviews.Author: firechief-JL
Reviews.Content: Great locaton, comfortable beds, helpful staff. We attended a conference at the hotel and were treated very well. Everything that we needed was available with plenty of options near by for any dining pleasure. The rooms were well kept, place was quiet and offered everything one would need. It was nice to be close to everything, Old Montreal, St-Catherines, the Bell Center, Mount Royal. The location was the best part, with the courteous staff of the hotel made it even better. I will definately pick this place when i return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “3 Stars”
Reviews.Author: BFRMaryland
Reviews.Content: This downtown hotel earns a 3-star rating for having above-average service but below-average food. I was there on business so I didn't explore much of the city. Plan on a 15-20 minute walk to the old city and convention center (congress). So if you plan to spend much of you're time in the old city you may want to find a closer location. If you're a hockey fan, this hotel's location is ideal. The Bell Center, home of the Montreal Canadians and Hall of Fame, is a block away. I ordered room service several times and loved the "30 minutes or less" guarantee. But the food was well below average with enough salt to preserve a brigade of Canadian Mounties. My mistake for eating at the hotel and not at all the lovely cafes in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room, service”
Reviews.Author: loversfromanisland
Reviews.Content: Great location close to multiple dining options and interesting sights downtown. Park close-by. Very comfortable room and bath, great service from everyone, quiet. Everything just the way it should be. We checked in late after a long drive and out of our timezone, so were very happy for the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mb518
Reviews.Content: I have been to montreal a couple of times for pleasure trips. I have stayed in about 7 different hotels. This by far was the nicest to the eye. The location is fantastic to the downtown area! The customer service was very good. They are in the process of renovated rooms in the hotel, but I was not bothered by that at all! All in all one of the nicer hotels in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Woken up at 7am on a Sunday morning! Ugh!”
Reviews.Author: Bailey4444
Reviews.Content: Nice room in a great location in Montreal but the renovations cost me a good night sleep. A letter from management said that ongoing renovations would be conducted from 10am to 4pm on Saturday and Sunday. At 7am Sunday, I was woken up by workers in a nearby room. The noise continued until we checked out despite the front desk saying they would send someone up to stop the workers. After a late Saturday night in Montreal, I was dead tired all day Sunday. Also, daily Internet is over $15. Yikes! And parking is $24/night. Tip: park next door at the Stanley car park for less than $10. It's obvious this hotel does not cater to the weekend traveller. Why else would renovations be done on the weekend and not during the week. And only someone with a business expense account would pay that daily Internet charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed, Good Location, Good Lounge with a great view”
Reviews.Author: DBM24
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the years. All of it for business at the local university, McGill, which is an easy 10-20 minute walk depending on where you need to go on the campus. This time, I attended a conference, and the walk is aobut 15-20 minutes in the opposite direction. I never did appreciate how close old Montreal is from there. It's just a couple blocks away from the convention centre. So, in good weather, the walk is pleasant. This time, I stayed on the 36th floor (club floor), and had a great view over the water, not towards to mount. The view was great, and was even better from the club lounge. The food was generally good, and severice there was excellent. Breakfast was great, but would have done better with some tips from its sister property in Toronto. As with all Sheratons, these beds are fantastic. Sleep comfort, in-room amenities are great, and the overall attitude of the staff was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: big_ribbit
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable, quiet and clean. We were away for a long weekend to see and enjoy montreal. The staff was very courteous and helpful. On check in we had a choice of city view or water view and chose the city view, which was nice (the hotel has great views). The room was large and comfortable and the hotel was modern. We utilized the parking garage, which was convenient - though expensive at $21 per day. The concierge was helpful and knowledgeable, though we did have to ask specifically to get 'authentic' experiences VS fast/cheap. They had great suggestions and instructions for things to see and places to go and we used them to setup many of our activities. The location is central and a few blocks from a metro station and Sant Catherine ST, old montreal is a 10 minute easy walk. The bio dome (which is awesome) and botanical garden are a 15 minute $3/person subway ride without having to change lines. The only poor experience was the restaurant by the bar, which was overpriced and not very good. Places we visited and liked: Biodome (amazing), botanical gardens (really cool), insectarium (was ok - good for smaller kids), old Montreal (nice walk), old montreal waterfront (really nice, you can rent pedal cars which was fun), eggspectations near old montreal was an amazing breakfast place with a great atmosphere and the best food we found. For dinner we tried Mike's on Saint Catherine's, which was quite good and paris crepes across the street for dessert. We had a breakfast at Chez Cora near the hotel and it was absolutely terrible, the food was slightly burnt and just low quality. Both of us felt really sick afterwards and didn't even finish the food. Maybe it was just a let down after how good eggspectations was.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Alan C
Reviews.Content: our experience was wonderful. Staff very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay. Will stay there again . We were there for a wedding. Our son and family were there as well. Couldn't ask for anything more. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great service, close to shopping and Metro”
Reviews.Author: kitab r
Reviews.Content: We stayed September 27-30. I knew we would have a wonderful experience at this hotel because we were allowed to check in at 10am!! The hotel is located one block from the Peel station (enter on Stanley). It's an easy walk to the Museum, Old Montreal, the underground community, everything. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Sheraton experience”
Reviews.Author: darrennelson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 5 days at a work conference. The Sheraton is your standard Sheraton business hotel. The location is great; close to Bell Centre and close enough to walk to the Old Town. Service at checkin was good ... though a little slow. I am a SPG platinum member but did not receive and upgrade (sold out hotel.) All the rooms seem to be a little different size based on the maps. The room was standard though a little larger than some Sheratons. Great bed; only complaint about the room (heard this from others as well) was that the walls are VERY thin ... you can here what is going on in the rooms next to you. Internet is not cheap if you are not a Platinum member though I think there is free WIFI in the lobby. I also stayed at the Le Meridian on this trip; I would say this is a better choice of the two hotels as I found the other below usual SPG standards. If you are staying in Montreal, and can get a good rate, this hotel would make a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Very large convention hotel. Some staff shine but nickel-and-dime complaints are valid.”
Reviews.Author: Braindrain
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed twice over a 2 week period. I am a SPG Plat and hadn't been back in about 6 years. Location The hotel is well located. It's close to Bell Centre and the main train station. It's in the nicer end of St Catherine's and many high-end boutiques are close by. As mentioned in my title, it seems to be a very large convention hotel and has to deal with hordes of people coming through every day. Check-in and Rooms When I first checked-in, I was extremely early and my room wasn't early. The front desk mentioned that the Concierge could store my bags for me "without charge". I had no idea what he was talking about as I am normally never charged to store bags. Well, when I did go to the Concierge, he mentioned it'd be $3/bag so I better cough up $9. It was only after I mentioned I was checking-in that the Concierge conceded there would be no charge. Extremely bizarre. Maybe it's because nobody tips them? Even I were to tip him, the tip instantly vanished after that exchange. It's worth mentioning that the front desk people were extremely courteous. It's the Concierge I have a beef with. For my 1st stay, I received an extremely large suite made of 2 normal rooms. One room was used for the living room area while the other room was the bedroom. There was ample space everywhere and it seems the rooms had undergone a recent renovation. Unfortunately, the HVAC system seems to still be the style attached to the window and not central. My beef with this is that some units are quiet while others are extremely noisy. Luckily, mine wasn't too noisy. The bed was comfy as I expect for a Westin and my internet was comped as I was a Plat. For my 2nd stay, I received a regular room. Again, it seemed to be recently renovated. No, it wasn't a suite but since I was travelling solo on a biz trip, I really didn't need all that extra room. Again, the HVAC system was external. Club lounge As part of the Plat bennies, I was allowed to use the Club Lounge. Upon entering, I was greeted by "G". G was extremely courteous and explained the lounge - since I mentioned I hadn't been back for about 6 years. The evening hors d'oeurves were decent - comprising of high quality cheeses, meats, and smoked salmon. While I don't want to get into details, let's say G was extremely accommodating if you $how how to treat him right. Strangely enough, for both stays, the Club Lounge was booked for private functions in the morning. The result? I was given a coupon for any full breakfast in the normal ground floor resto. Well, I certainly can't complain about that! The food in the resto was fine but service a bit slow. Final thoughts Would I stay again? Definitely. Would I recommend a colleague to stay here. Yes, but I'd warn him about the ridiculous Concierge fees. And, from the other reviews, it sounds like some other charges seem pretty unreasonable too. Tips There are a ton of great restos in Montreal. Don't stay in the hotel to eat. However, from my experience, stay away from the ethnic restos as I generally found them to be below-par.

Reviews.Title: “Nickles and dimes”
Reviews.Author: Wade C
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, except that, for the amount they charge for a room, there should be at least a bit of a break on parking! My Wife and I made the mistake of renting a car for the 5 days we spent at this hotel. The parking fees were more than renting the car, and we didn't even use the valet servoce, which would have been 20% more!!! We were charged the same amount as anyone who wanted to use the lot. Personally, I think Sheraton should have a preferred rate to customers staying at the Hotel. Just my opinion. Next time, if I decide to rent a car, I'll stay someplace else. Wade Church

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay at an SPG hotel {Montreal}. SPG hotels usually the best experience for money spent.”
Reviews.Author: JGM2011canada
Reviews.Content: This was the most disappointing stay that I have ever experienced at an SPG hotel. I would like to mention that I have already stayed enough times this year to achieve SPG Gold status, so I do have a significant number of comparisons. It wasn't bad service, just well below what I have come to appreciate and expect. I will probably avoid using this hotel again as there are other SPG hotels in Montreal that provide the high level of service that I have come to expect from Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the value found on Hotwire.com”
Reviews.Author: adnlex
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through hotwire and got a great deal. Was one block from streetside shopping. Onbe block from Bell Centre. Close to old montreal. Parking is not included but you can leave and come back as many times as you want. Internet not included in the room, but they do have a business centre with a lot of computers and free wifi. Pool was good, but hot tub was out of service.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Centre â€“ GREAT Hotel Close to Bell Centre and St-Catherine”
Reviews.Author: HernameisRio
Reviews.Content: We got very lucky with this Hotwire booking! We were attending a concert at the Bell Center and couldnâ€™t have ended up in a better location (one block from the arena). The room was renovated, including a nicely updated bathroom, flat screen TV and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! Parking was $20 (to be expected) and Internet $15 per day (though there is complimentary wifi in lobby). I also had the best mojito north of Cuba in the hotel bar, served by the friendliest staff. J I asked for a late check out and was it was no problem to check out as late as 2pm. Staff were extremely accommodating. I would definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel should offer free internet in room”
Reviews.Author: LazOttawa
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel but at $300 per night Internet service in room should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bruziks
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel conviently located one block from St catherines st,about a 20 minute walk from old Montreal.Nice pool for the kids very expensive to eat there .parking expensive $25 but you can take car in and out compared to the cheaper garages. Wifi free in lobby but internet charges in room outrageous!!!! Science muesum in old montreal fab for kids Trois Brasseurs pub was great so were the cafe's but not kid friendly at all Overall loved Montreal just very very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nothing special overall.”
Reviews.Author: Jsokol
Reviews.Content: Nice place for a quick in an out to city, business trip. Friendly staff, good location, high rate considering overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: laldm
Reviews.Content: I was there on September 16 and 17, 2011 for a conference. The staff were very pleasant and helpful when looking for a bite to eat. The room was clean and very nice. We had connecting rooms with other participants, which was very convenient. The only fly in the ointment was all the construction outside the hotel and the fire station close by. I will gladly go back.

Reviews.Title: “3 1/2 stars is more like it”
Reviews.Author: keatingfamily
Reviews.Content: What to say that others haven't already said? Pros: - Bed is more comfy than most hotel beds but not what I would call great - Staff is friendly most of the time - Location is very good for what I needed - Room was plenty large with good workspace - I like the option to decline housekeeping and get more points Cons: - expensive, both room rate and food/incidentals - Loud, even on the 27th floor where I was - lighting in work area is insufficient - my lamp was burned out (I didn't say anything so I don't fault them completely) - reception staff is slooooowwwwww (this is true of every hotel I've been to in Montreal so maybe it's more of a culture thing) - horrible TV - when I'm on the road mostly I want news and this place had neither Fox News nor MSNBC. additionally half the channels it did have were in french

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Singapore_Paris
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs refurbishing. No buffet breakfast and no fridge in the room. The only positive point is its location near Saint Catherine. Quite a disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Business Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: olsonator
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal for a conference held at another hotel. Le Sheraton was located a block away from the Bell Centre. The hotel is very well situated. It is also a short walk to discover Old Montreal. The Hotel is only a block away from St. Catherine's Street if you need to do any shopping. There is a more to discover in the area including museums and old churches. The hotel room was nice...what you would expect from a 4 star hotel. Everything was laid out nicely and well kept. The hotel bar is overpriced on the food side in my opinion. There are many options for food in the area so do a little research and head out and enjoy the area. I think that the internet is overpriced but it seems internet is always an extra at 4 star hotels unless you have a membership and stay at that hotel brand all the time.
