You may need to factor $15 into your daily stay for a business stay that will likely require internet usage. There is wireless available in the lobby area for free.

Reviews.Title: “Solid upscale Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: nodrama1
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 star hotel which I like using for business travel to Montreal. It is in the center of the CBD with one of the best steakhouses in the city across the road (La Queue de Cheval). Rooms are nice and contemporary. The restaurants in the hotel lobby are OK - not great.

Reviews.Title: “An average conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: maytraveller2
Reviews.Content: Was here with my wife during a recent conference. Hotel is well situated for walking to downtown, old town is about a 25 minute walk. our room on the 10th floor was clean and laid out well, lighting and electrical outlets were well placed. The housekeeping was prompt and efficient. The conference venue was OK but proceedings were disrupted at times by refurbishment noises. I did not eat at the horel facilities but my wife had breakfast on 2 occasions and thought the value was missing-typical for downtown hotels. No complaints but not inspired either.

Reviews.Title: “A 4+ star hotel that could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Professor_E
Reviews.Content: The good: The location is incredible. It is run in the middle of the downtown area. We walked to most of the major sites from our hotel. The hotel is clean, and very busy with business people. They have lots of conferences there. So the lobby is noisy. The bad: The charge you a lot for parking and in-room internet connection. Also, there queen-bedrooms are connected to one another by a flimsy door. We could hear the personal conversations of our neighbor, every one of his coughs, and other noises. We called Reception desk and were given another room that was attached to an empty room. However, the next night, someone moved in and we could hear them, there 5:30 AM alarm clock, and so forth. This was very disappointing. The rooms are small. The windows do not open. The A/C/heating unit is loud and not electronically controlled. Again, something that I expect from a 2 or 3 star hotel, not a Sheraton. Lastly, we asked the concierge to recommend us a place to get some dinner. The place they sent us was one of the worst restaurant experiences in our recent memory. We used TripAdvisor for all future recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: BooWho3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as the conference I was attending was in the hotel. The rooms have been recently redone according to thei website and they are great for one person traveling for business. The large desk has a power station including USB charging right on the desk. The wifi was included in my special rate but is pricey otherwise. It was excellent for quality and speed and very reliable. Bed is very comfortable and there is one chair to watch the tv on. Starbucks coffee is the brand served in the room. Room service is pricey but served by such happy people, it almost does not matter. The conference food was ok for some meals and horrible for others. Only big flaw was poor English skills by front desk staff. I know it is Quebec but I received far too much misinformation from people who apparently did not understand me. It is a hotel and they need to be able to communicate accurately.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: hussein a
Reviews.Content: Perfect Hotel, in the heart of downtown, very friendly staff and great desk manager

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service Hotel”
Reviews.Author: macduff594
Reviews.Content: Late August we checked in at the Sheraton on Wed night as our daughter was getting married on Sunday. The hotel was extremely busy that week and weekend however, our service and experience during our week staying at the Sheraton was excellent. 1) We needed a wheelchair room - immediately we were upgraded to a room to accommodate my husband. We had a lovely room. 2) Because our room wasn't ready upon our arrival - we received 3 complimentary breakfast because of the delay. 3) Anytime we requested incidentals for our room i.e. extra wine glasses, chairs, extension cord, icebuckets even a fridge- anything we asked for was courtestly and promptly delivered to our room. 4) We needed storaged for the brides flowers - the hotel allowed us to store them in a separate large fridge - plus they brought them to our room on two occassions ( one to make the bouquets and return them to us the day of the wedding. 5) Wedding Day it was pouring rain - no problem, the hotel supplied us (many family members) with umbrellas. 6) Because it was raining on Wedding Day we couldn't have pictures outside - the manager allowed the wedding party to gather for prictures on the top floor in the VIP room/lounge to take photos. Thanks to the Sheraton we have lovely wedding photos. 7) Last but certainly not least - when we received our bill we noticed that we had an extra parking garage charge - no problem, no fuss, the front desk immediately removed the charge.

Reviews.Title: “What a location”
Reviews.Author: Mahesh B
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, with superb views of the city and the hills nearby. The rooms are very spacious, specially the family rooms with two double beds. One of the best places i have stayed with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kamal G
Reviews.Content: nice room. only thing lacking is a decent restaurant. there is no breakfast buffet available. also the club level lounge charges for beer & wine unlike many other SPG hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GabeIsC00l
Reviews.Content: I was here for a bachelor party weekend. The hotel was nice and located in a great area. I also enjoyed ordering beers by the patio by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: scottsdalesuzykat
Reviews.Content: Took the express bus ($8) from the airport and the bus stop was pretty much right across the street from the hotel - very convenient. Hotel lobby quite outdated (lots of brass everywhere) and oddly arranged - the escalators down to the conference level created a giant hole right in the middle - so not really a pleasant area to sit and hang out while waiting for people. There is a restaurant/bar that is open to the lobby area, but I didn't use it so can't comment. Our room was very clean and very nicely updated/furnished, a nice surprise after the lobby. Breakfast in the Club Lounge (for "members" with many Sheraton stays) was decent and included Montreal bagels and a 180 degree view of the city. Montreal is a great walking/biking city, and for those who love to walk/bike, this hotel was in a great central location. We rented Bixis (bicycle taxis) for $5/day and biked up to McGill, over to St.Laurent, up through the Plateau to Mile End, back down and around the mountain through Outremont, to the top of the mountain and back down and through the McGill campus. Later that evening we took the Bixis to Old Town and back. Our room was quiet and we slept well (probalby aided by the huge smoked meat sandwiches from Schwartze's!) Would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Beverly L
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was fine. However the people who worked there for the most part have an attitude. The concierge did not give the best advice when it came to finding a restaurant so do your research first instead of relying on them. We purchased a deal where we got breakfast each morning in the club lounge (usually only available for sheraton members) but they never had our name on the list and we had to get it straigtened out (even though we paid extra for this...it wasnt free breakfast by any means!). The hotel is NOT that close to Old montreal as they might claim. It's a good 1/2 hour walk each way. Not that the location is the worse...but if you want to stay closer to Old Montreal you need to stay one of the boutique hotels. My advice (which the concierge didnt tell us) is purchase the double deck tour (can do so from the tourism center which is actually around the block from the hotel) and this is a hop on and off tour all day. If you do that in the morning its plenty of time and a little less walking. I dont mind walking but when you have done it all day it's exhausting. Being that this is a VERY expensive city, you try and avoid cabs! Lastly, we did room service the last night for dinner because it was so late and we were so tired. The room service costs are SO overpriced. And they also charge you for a delivery charge! We orded two kids meals and two salads and its came to 60 canadian dollars! Originally they overcharged us and i called which they straightened out. Then I still felt it was high so i complained. The manager came out and was telling me i had all these things that i didnt. She then realized she pulled the wrong bill and didnt even apologize. I think it really reflects badly on sheraton! If you are looking for a room just to sleep then this is fine as it is clean but dont look for hospitality...because you wont find it here!

Reviews.Title: “pretty darn good with a discount offer”
Reviews.Author: VancouverOutdoorsy
Reviews.Content: We saw a tripadvisor or travelzoo or groupon deal for 50% off and grabbed it (after looking it up on tripadvisor to read the reviews, of course!). So it was $99 a night. (altho we paid an extra $10 for city view so $109 and that room was also a bit larger) For the price we were very happy. Great neighborhood. Close to McGill U. We ate dinner twice where the concierge recommended, and both turned out to be a bit pricey and just OK, so that was a small let down. If we paid full price, then of course that changes everything... It wouldn't be worth $200 a night I don't think, plus there were some VERY minor problems that wouldn't be as easily overlooked for $200 a night... 1/ there was a large crack in one water glass from the top right down to the bottom and that shouldn't ever happen 2/ there was wallpaper peeling off in 2 or 3 small areas near a power outlet and the airconditioner unit 3/ there was no minibar fridge and no microwave, which we could have used because we stayed 4 days. But -all in all, very good for a discount price. (parking and in-room Wi-fi are expensive if you need them, but there's free computers downstairs)(pool open but whirlpool closed) And staff and front desk were very helpful and professional. Oh yes -don't worry if you're visiting Monteal and don't speak French!

Reviews.Title: “Worse night I had in a long time.”
Reviews.Author: Walter M
Reviews.Content: Alot of noise in the hallway. Guests were knocking on doors around 230 in the morning. Finally when I did get to sleep a hotel employee was knocking on my door at 430 in the morning. Apparently it was a mistake but none the less interrupted my sleep. Needless to say I was not a happy camper. As well when I reserved my room I requested an upgrade if one was available upon check-in. No mention was made of the request when I checked in. I think a guest should be advised to the status of their request. This is poor business.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed before and will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: jamelp
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sheraton Le Centre several times before and have always found it to be a great travel experience. The location is very good, reasonable rates, especially with the Starwood Preferred Guest Program, friend,y and responsive staff, pleasant amenities and restaurant...

Reviews.Title: “Things That Keep Us Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: Elsie S
Reviews.Content: We were concerned about our trip home because we heard of the flooding in Vermont and the only way to get lunch is to get off an exit, which under the conditions didn't seem like a good idea. I called Room Service and asked if they could make box lunches for our Noon checkout. When we stopped at a Rest Stop and opened our lunches, we were very impressed. The lunches were excellent and we had enough to take home for dinner. We decided we'll order box lunches every time we stay at the Sheraton Le Centre. We also love the breakfast on the 37th Floor; it makes us get up early so we won't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Always the best in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: bendavid4
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, location can't be beat. We have stayed here several times over the years. Service was excellent, the reception staff accommodated our request for a high floor--34th! What a view of the city and could see all the way to Olympic park. Room had been recently updated and was very modern. Staff/service in the restaurant for breakfast was a bit of a disappointment, did not seem to care that we were there to eat. Food was fine. Bar staff was exceptional, although the beer prices were extremely high for the area--$12! Will definitely return to the Sheraton when we come back to Montreal. Pool deck was closed, would have liked to know that before we went all the way down there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location... will definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter_NYC2
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a couple of nights. The location is great (close to Catherine Street, Metro Station). The hotel was going through some renovations while I was there, but nothing too distracting. There's free wifi in the lobby/reception area which is a huge plus. The hotel gym was on the small side (and also no air conditioning) and the pool had way too much chlorine in it. Aside from the minor issues with some of the facilities, I would definitely stay at this hotel the next time I return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Overdue for a make-over”
Reviews.Author: rob_sohomet
Reviews.Content: Just spent a couple of nights at this hotel and although it is in a half decent part of town (especially if you are going to the Bell Centre for a game), the hotel itself is terribly dated and overdue to it's make-over. They've started renovations, so expect some noise if you stay here, along with stairways being unusable. Although the rooms are clean and of a decent size, they are lacking some of the small things that make all the difference - no bathrobes, no iPod docking stations, and no actual temperature control... The heat/AC unit appears to be out of the 80s, with just 'cool low / cool high / heat low / heat high' controls, and it's horribly noisy, like the old window-mounted AC units of years ago. Not something I'd expect in a Category 4 SPG group hotel. The bathroom furnishings again felt like they have not been updated in 20 years or more... And the TV was lacking in channel options. I'd definitely give this one a miss for the next couple of years while they undergo the renovations... After that, I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dededa80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in downtown and close to everything, shopping, movies, food, chinatown, and it is a great place to start your trip. You can take take the 747 express bus ($8 dollars each way - coin only unless you purchase the card from the airport) from the airport and it stops literally right in front of the hotel. The hotel has free internet access in the lobby, a great pool (closes at 10pm), spa and great room service options. I would definitely come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, nice hotel and facilities, and good price for a downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: OttawaAli
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Sheraton visiting Montreal for the comedy festival. The hotel has a good downtown location being close to the train station, Centre Bell as well as a lot of the main shopping streets and the metro. Rooms were a standard size, with a working area with a desk as well as a comfy chair and small table together with a good size bathroom. The room I stayed in felt modern, was clean and the bed was very comfy. There was a large TV in the room with lots of cable channels. Due to its location the hotel can get busy at times (especially after the Centre Bell empties out), so there can be waits for the lift and at check-in. Staff were polite, although not particularly helpful (my paid-up front reservation for a King-Bed room was changed to a two-double beds room and was told that I could take it or leave it with nothing offered to me). Breakfast doesn't start until 6.30am (so not particularly useful for those taking early morning transport). The pool area and fitness room were superb. The pool was a large size for an indoor pool, was the ideal temperature for swimming and there was a huge whirlpool and sauna area as well. One of the best indoor pool areas I've stayed in for a downtown hotel. Bad points - There can be a long wait for a lift at busy times. No free internet access ($15 a day). Good points - Very comfy bed, excellent pool area. Tips - The hotel is a short-walk from the VIA-rail train station (which has a huge food court area) and a number of restaurants so there's plenty of choice for food very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average experience”
Reviews.Author: Jim L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4-5 times and the service is diminishing each time. There is no water or refreshment centre in the rooms and although there are vending machines they only take coins and the front desk would not provide change. Heat contrrol was temperamental as well - too hot to sleep and A/C not functioning properly.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel... would come back.”
Reviews.Author: LearningHow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in August 2011. Check-in was very efficient. The hotel was decently located in downtown Montreal -- but I find that Montreal is spread very far so unless you plan on just hitting the main shopping street (Rue Sainte-Catherine) you will need access to a car, or use the subway system or taxis. Parking was $24 for a 24-hr period with unlimited in-and-out priviledges and is added to your hotel bill at the end of your stay. Parking was a bit disorganized -- the first time we left the hotel we waited at the exit for about 15 minutes as it seemed they did not have an updated list of guests at the hotel, and every car leaving took 3 or 4 minutes to get "signed in" to be able to obtain the access card which allowed the in-and-out priviledges. The room was very clean, as was the washroom. However, the room was NOISY. We had friends staying in another room on the opposite end of the floor and I could hear them coming from halfway down the hallway -- and they were not speaking loud or making a lot of noise. And even 21 floors up you could hear traffic from the roads below, which I found extremely odd. I work in a business building 11 floors up and from that height you can't hear anything, even though the building is right beside the highway. But here you could hear sirens and tires screeching and loud exhausts well into the night. The windows also start halfway up the wall with a little window-seat, and the curtains only go as far down as the window seat, so a lot of light comes in the morning. This is the first hotel I've been to that doesn't have full-length blackout curtains to allow darkness even after the sun has risen. At 7am the room was already quite well lit with the curtains fully drawn. The beds were EXTREMELY comfy, as were the pillows. Probably one of the comfiest beds I've ever slept in. We got an extremely good deal but it didn't include free internet, though I think some of the higher rooms categories do have it included if you pay more. Otherwise it would have been $15.95/day. The hotel pool was nice -- plenty of large towels to use (I find sometimes hotel pools have only small towels rather than full bath-sized ones). The pool hotel was good for kids -- the shallow end extends quite far so several smaller kids can play in 3ft water rather than being all squished into 2 feet at the end of the shallow end. All in all, the hotel was nice. I would probably stay here again if I got another really good deal (we got an EXCELLENT deal), but ideally I would probably stay closer to Old Montreal when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Gigi101
Reviews.Content: This stay was the last in a 4 hotel sweep for our family spanning the US and Canada. The front desk and room service staff were excellent. Although this hotel was not in Old Montreal (I didn't know the lay of the land prior to our visit just booked this hotel based on rate), the walk to Old Port/Montreal was okay -- a metro stop is a few blocks away. Our room, 21st floor, had a view of Mount Royal and the city which was really nice. The room was very comfortable. The hotel is located around a lot of eateries and a bustling nightlife (on the weekends). When visiting Montreal again, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Stefan01
Reviews.Content: Good points: Excellent location, right in the business and entertainment district Decent-sized pool nice bed Quick room service - when called for extra towels, they were delivered within a few minutes free internet in lobby Not-so-good points: - upon checking in, I learned that someone else had been checked into my room under MY name! At first, the front desk person made it seem like a case of identity theft, however after I insisted on going up with (or without) Security to confront the individual in question, another front desk person acknowledged that they were the ones who made the mistake. Two couples before me also appeared to have problems with their check-in. Apparently, they were both checked into the same room. One woman was very upset about this, as I think she was in the bathroom when the other couple came in. - fingerprints and dirt on the bedroom mirror in my room. I didn't bother complaining about this, though I'm surprised housekeeping missed them as they were quite noticeable. It bothered my wife enough that I eventually grabbed a tissue from the bathroom and wiped them off myself just to clam her up. :) - my early check-out statement showed a different credit card than the one I checked in with. Front desk quickly took care of and I had prepaid for most of the charges, however I was surprised they goofed twice on this. All in all, a decent hotel, as most of the other reviews suggest, though there are obviously areas for improvement, beginning with not blaming others for one's mistakes.

Reviews.Title: “The best 4-star chain hotel in Montreal?”
Reviews.Author: mpdesjardins
Reviews.Content: If my last review of this hotel (back in 2009), I contended that Le Centre Sheraton had pretty much everything to be a winner, except rooms up to 4-star standards. Fortunately, this has been fixed, and quite nicely. Using Hotwire, I paid 124$ for a room that was radically different to the one I stayed in back in 2009. The new decor is modern but very warm at the same time, using dark wood furniture and design objects all around. Business travelers will enjoy the oversize work desks and ergonomic chairs. My king size bed was comfortable and firm enough to provide good back support. The HD flat screen TV was impressive. After having tried most of high-end Montreal hotels in the last few years, I can confidently say that Le Centre Sheraton, with its terrific location, high-quality updated rooms, vast array of services, lavish lobby and reasonable rates, is now the best or second best 4-star chain hotel in downtown Montreal. After full refurbishment, the Marriott Chateau Champlain and the Omni Mont-Royal will play in the same league. Also, I would prefer Le Centre Sheraton over the Fairmont Queen-Elizabeth, even if the latter is considered a 5-star hotel in our local rating system. That said, Le Centre Sheraton should consider offering free in-room internet as the Marriott Chateau Champlain and other large hotels already do (still 14,75$ a day at the Sheraton). Finally, in-room breakfast is still outrageously pricey and utterly unappealing (especially considering all the local options).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great rooms, but a challenge to deal with....”
Reviews.Author: nigel220
Reviews.Content: Great location, only a couple of Infruating things - being charged per ip address for the wireless in the room (total rip off but hotels already know that) and the temporary gym which I appreciate was temporary but no effort to keep it clean and the lack of proper ventilation probably made it illegal (especially with all the cables lying around leading to knackered machines)! Didn't help that the tv kept on about the new gym!! Also had to track down the accounting dept which took three attempts - just to get an answer to a question about a transaction that the front desk had no way of looking up - started with a disconnect between central res and the hotel. Resolved perfectly but really not good at getting back to the guest as promised by the front desk. If this was a regular stay i'd probably stay again - but if I knew I had a special request I would go to a hotel that I knew communicated better with its guests.

Reviews.Title: “very good for our promotional price”
Reviews.Author: Lon-in-Vancouver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed a hotel near McGill for 4 days so we could help our daughter move in for her first year in university. We saw a promotion of 50% off on what looked like a perfect hotel on TravelZoo or a similar competitor and booked it. It was the Sheraton Centre and we paid $99 a night plus an extra $10 for an upgrade to a city view room. That was worth it as the room was also a bit larger. Overall the hotel is in a very good location, the room totally adequate, and the staff friendly and professional. (don't let anyone tell you you'll be treated poorly in Montreal if you don't speak French -that's nonsense. Everyone speaks English) If I was to be picky, I'd say the room maybe isn't worth the regular $200. There was a safe, always a good thing, but no bar fridge (we always like to store our own yogurt and juice there) and no microwave. Also there were 3 spots where the wallpaper was peeling for 3 or 4 inches. And one day the maid clearly didn't clean the toilet. Oh -and a water glass was cracked from top to bottom. Of course guest services/front desk replaced it, but it seems very odd that someone was so careless. And that's it. Overall maybe not worth $200 a night, but for any good discount you should be very happy here. (pool open but spa closed for renos. breakfast not included)

Reviews.Title: “Another solid Sheraton, in a great city”
Reviews.Author: JF1414
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Le Centre Sheraton for three days in late August. It is everything you would expect from a Sheraton or other major chain in any major city in the world. The pluses outweigh the negative, but there is one MAJOR con (see below) that may affect some of your decisions. I was able to make due, and would possibly stay again if I return to Montreal. Pros: - Not sure if we lucked out, considering how busy the hotel appeared to be, but the room was incredibly spacious (corner room) with a more than ample closet and bathroom. I was worried the room might be undersized because like many international (non-American) hotels, the only two bed option was doubles rather than queens. I had nothing to worry about. - The beds were extremely comfortable. A lot of hotel chains advertise their special bed "system" or appointments and they don't impress me. The Sheraton beds truly did. - As mentioned, the bathroom was plenty large, with a very nice rainfall showerhead (with some significant power, which is rare for those types) and a pleasantly surprising "magnified" mirror for putting in contacts, putting on makeup, etc. - The hotel appears to be recently refurbished and renovated - everything in both the room and the lobby seemed to be new (or certainly clean), rather than overly tired. - Extremely fast elevators - for a busy hotel with nearly floors, we never had a problem getting an elevator and getting to our room quickly. - The business center has 8 computers for use, and the lobby has free Wi-fi (which are positives, but see cons below). - The location is very accessible - the 747 Express Bus from the airport drops off right across the street, and there are loads of public transportation options Cons: - The hotel nickels and dimes you on everything. Internet in the room is nearly $15 per day. There are no free calls, including local calls. Printing in the business center costs money. I was told that they charged a storage fee to keep luggage after checkout. Though the room rate was very reasonable, those sorts of charges could add up significantly and unexpectedly. - While the location is very much Centre-ville/downtown, the hotel itself is not IMMEDIATE to everything. The Peel (green) and Bonaventure (orange) subways are a couple to a few blocks away. The lively nightlife areas on Cresent St and St Catherine's/St Laurent are a few blocks as well. They are all certainly walkable, but they're not RIGHT there. - The staff was okay, but not great. At times, certain staff members seemed aloof and disinterested. Also, I'd asked for a late checkout, and was told that would be fine - but when I called the next morning to confirm, there was no record in the system for my room (luckily, they gave me one anyway). Overall, it's a nice hotel, and if you're staying for business or cost isn't a concern, then there are no major issues. If you're on a budget, or just concerned about deceptive practices, I'd be very wary of the additional charges over the seemingly attractive rates.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, great choice for downtown Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: Niall
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights and overall it was a good experience, did not eat in the hotel, but used it as a base for travel around the city. Its location was excellent, 5 mins from the train station, main shopping area less than the 5 mins away. Some great eateries close by also in either direction from the hotel. Bell Centre across the road. Room was very good, and a fridge was provided when we asked for it. No complaints. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay and nice place”
Reviews.Author: Miquel_Mat
Reviews.Content: We find a good offer for this great hotel, we enjoyed our stay. The staff were very serviciable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff in the breakfast restaurant & hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catherine L
Reviews.Content: Staff in the breakfast restaurant was helpful and nice. Mr. Kim (I guess he was the manager in the restaurant) set up the table for us right away when other servers were very busy serving other customers, so we didn't have to wait for too long. We also like Voula (a lovely waitress), who was very responsive, smart and friendly. I was impressed by the room service we got from the hotel...we asked for extra towels and a dryer separately and the servers came immediately...we had a nice experience from the central Montreal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's my place in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Kowalski
Reviews.Content: I've been staying twice in this hotel this year and if I'll go to Montreal once more than I'll stay there again. The hotel is not new but it's perfectly maintained. The rooms are clean, tastefully furnitured and big enough for me. Every room is equipped with a large flat screen TV. There is also a coffe machine. Two things that differentiate this hotel from the crowd are great view on the city and the location. The higher you are the nicer view on the city and Mont Royal you get. As the name says the hotel is located in the center of the Montreal so you can enjoy all the attractions of Montreal by walking. It is also enough to cross the street to access the excellent underground metro system of Montreal. The bar downstairs is nice and the bartenders are real professionals. Actually all the hotel staff is professional and very kind. For the light breakfast you can go to the bar which server fresh starback cofee, fruits, some pastry, youghurt etc. or if you prefer larger breakfast you can either call room service or go to the restaurant, which is next to the bar. Though there is nothing really exciting about this hotel everything is just right. That combined with good corporate rates makes this hotel my place for all the times when I'm in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Beautiful, clean, comfortable.....”
Reviews.Author: HI-JI-10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and in a very central location for shopping, restaurants and site seeing. We had a car but walked just about everywhere. The hotel had pricey food, but well worth it. It was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: scorpio0870
Reviews.Content: Great location, very close to shopping at St. Catherine st. and other tourist locations. When we booked the room through the sheraton booking line i was offered an upgrade i could get access to the club floor which included breakfast and evening snacks for my family, When i checked in with my family i was told my older child would have to pay extra because the upgrade was for 2 people, at first the person at the check in desk was very short with me and told me to just pay the extra, discussion closed, I demanded to ask to speak to a supervisor and then all of a sudden my son could eat breakfast with us without having to pay extra, it could have been handled way better without a fight. Also the club lounge breakfast really needs to be stocked more frequently, both days we had breakfast up there, the empty trays weren't refilled very fast when people were coming in at 9 am when breakfast still goes to 9:30am,in fact i overheard a few people complaining about it too. Overall the hotel is very nice, clean and very close to everything but they are falling short on customer service.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: booklovr
Reviews.Content: On a previous trip to Montreal we stayed at another hotel that was much more expensive. Never again - the Sheraton was wonderful! We were promptly checked in and were able to get a late check-out so that we could explore downtown Montreal. The staff were wonderful and very accomodating. The internet centre in the lobby was a hit with the teens that were with us. Great hotel, great views, great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice refurbished rooms though still shows its age”
Reviews.Author: NickSmith
Reviews.Content: Good mid-range hotel in Montreal, nicely refurbished rooms. The hotel however still shows its age slightly... elevators and some of the switches and plaster wall finishings in the rooms didn't get a refresh. Not a big deal, especially given the great location. Slightly more annoying was the old-school in room Air Conditioning unit which was noisy as these units can tend to be! Though I refuse to mark a hotel down for the inconsiderate behaviour of its' guests, if you seek peace and quiet then request a room away from the elevators. Ours wasn't and there was a constant stream of loud conversations and screaming kids in the daytime. Overall.. a good choice but check out the pricing and location of other newer properties - such as the Hilton Garden inn (by McGill) or the Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “a bit small, but nice and clean, and affordable !”
Reviews.Author: sasli
Reviews.Content: The rooms are super duper small! No complaint though because i think thats just how all hotels in Montreal area are. Our 2 bed room literally had just that. enough room for 2 beds and some decorative chairs. Also a lot of the other hotels in Montreal has a European flair, tacky bedding, feels elizabethan. I get it that Montreal has that sort of charm. But i still would like to see modern bedding/modern furniture. Sheraton does not have the tacky bedding so if that's what you want i'd say try the Queen Elizabeth a few blocks down. Known for the European old flair. The pool is a decent size. Theres a hot tub and a sauna room that can probably fit 2 -4 people comfortably. Theres also an outdoor terrace to tan but we didn't get to use that. Parking does cost a bit extra for self parking or valet. This was the best deal with a corporate rate. The lobby was nice and spacious with a small area for seating. We went to Montreal during a busy weekend so the hotel had a lot of traffic in and out. The location was also great! walking distance to the shops (literally 2 blocks away) and some good food. The trek to the Montreal Chinatown was a bit far, maybe 15-20mins by foot if that helps. However I must say this hotel tries to nickel and dime you every way possible. The wifi in the rooms are additional costs. Luckily it was included in my corporate rate. My only complaint is the front desk attendants. They come across as snotty and not really willingly trying to help you answer your questions about the area. However because of the price, i will prob return next time I am in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: TinselCanada
Reviews.Content: I held a National Meeting here for two days and the staff was wonderful. My admin assistant booked the group and ourselves in the hotel. The service during the meeting was great; as well as meeting the needs we had as individual guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: L.Mitchell
Reviews.Content: We were in Montreal Aug 19-22, 2011 and chose Sheraton Centre Ville for the location, great rates, and as a family of four, kids under 18 stayed free. Great competitive rates are available by directly calling Sheraton or their website, they will try to match any online rate. If you are a CAA member, mention it to the rep! It is an above average hotel, very large & busy, but easy check in and check out. Elevators are fast! If you're looking for something small and intimate, maybe not the place for you. Staff were friendly and willing to help, and the rooms were clean, well cared for. Nothing much to complain about but here are a few cons/irritations mentioned in other reviews that they really need to change: - no free wi fi in rooms - no free LOCAL calls (its cheaper to use a payphone!! Inexcusable) - no fridge, no minibar

Reviews.Title: “Great place, needs to staff housekeeping around the clock”
Reviews.Author: Deedee1515
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time, the room was clean when we arrived. We did have an issue in the middle of the night and needed help at 5am. We were told there was no one to help until 7am. 7 came and went and I called at 8:15, was told that housekeeping does not come in until 9am on Sat. We could not use the bathroom for over four hours. That's a long time to hold it!! Then on Sunday we went out to enjoy the city and when we arrived back to our room to shower and go back out our room had not been cleaned, this was at 5pm. I have always trusted the Sheraton to make my stay the best, this I believe was just a fluke. I hope!!!

Reviews.Title: “OKAY, BUT COULD BE BETTER”
Reviews.Author: CalibHfx
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a good business-type hotel. Some parts of the common areas and pool were under construction. The rooms are adequate in size, but not overly large. The recent renovations make it feel fresh and updated and the cleanliness was good. It is a large property and the front desk, concierge, and business centre were always busy. Elevators (6) were fast, quiet and efficient so no problems there. Location can't be beat. Because the hotel "nickel and dimes" you it is easy to feel like you are getting poor value. Internet cost $14.75, fee for luggage storage, you can print from the business centre at $0.40/page, and parking is expensive (but I did not use). The Club Lounge is fine, but wine and drinks are outrageously expensive. If you can get a good internet deal, like $150 or less, this is a fine option. If you are opting to pay more than look at other options. My go-to hotel in Montreal is the Hotel de la Montagne. Large rooms, very clean with good rates also in a good location. Unfortunately it was sold out for this visit.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with Le Centre Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: fxdacat
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend in Le Centre Sheraton in Montreal. Got a good deal at $100/night on hotwire. Overall, my stay was very nice and I would come back the next time I'm in Montreal. (+ positive, - needs improvement, * neutral) + The room was large and clean (what I expect for a large chain hotel like the Sheraton). The pillows are very soft (almost like sleeping on a cloud). We had a room on the 22nd floor (out of 39 floors) so we had a good view of downtown Montreal. We were a little weary about having a room near the elevator but for the most part we didn't hear a lot of noise from our room. + Elevators are speedy! + The gym is located on the 7th floor. But the time we were there they were remodeling the gym. So there was a temporary gym on the 8th floor which was basically a room or two converted into a homemade gym. The treadmills were very nice (easy on the feet and lots of programs). The gym also supplies towels. Didn't try the pool but it looked nice. + Housekeeping did a good job at cleaning our rooms everyday and supplying us with toiletries. The housekeeper was very courteous. + Internet station. This was near the check in desk. There are about seven or so computers available for free surfing. They charge a nominal fee for printing. There was free wifi near the internet station. There were times when all the computers were taken but it was helpful to get online the few times we did. + Gustavo, the doorman was very helpful. He allowed us to hold our bags for entire day even though we checked out earlier in the morning. There is a nominal $6 fee to hold luggage (we had two pieces of luggage). + The concierge was very helpful in giving use restaurant recommendations. She provides us with maps and even made reservations for us. * Note that this hotel is in downtown Montreal so on the weekends everything is pretty much closed nearby. But the Bonaventure metro station is nearby and the Montreal metro system is excellent. This hotel is like a block away from the Bell Center so if you're looking to catch a hockey game, this would be an ideal hotel. - The flatscreen TV was good but the program controlling the TV guide was slow and a bit annoying. - Kind of annoying whenever you enter or leave the hotel and you see smokers puffing up in the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too big a place for relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: dutchy 1943
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our trip from here to there,and to meet family. Place is way too big for the relaxing type traveller. This is a place for business people/airline personell etc. Room way too small ,why do all these places only have room for 1 suitcase? No free internet,No fridge.walls have dirty stains on them,yach! BUT a super and I mean super nice matress/bed. Valet parking is both a pain and expensive. Location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls...”
Reviews.Author: DrunkInCubaNow
Reviews.Content: Love the room. Love the bar. Love the location... Had to change rooms after the first night of sleep interruptions though because they had booked me (a business traveller) beside a room full of 8 yr old yahoos.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and congenial.”
Reviews.Author: keyrose
Reviews.Content: We chose this location due to it's proximity to restaurants, shopping, Vieux Montreal, Metro. The staff were all courteous and helpful. The rooms were comfortable if not roomy. There were a number of computers available in the lobby for guest use, as well as easy WiFi access in the lobby. It was our bad luck that the gym room and whirlpool renos were taking place while we were there. The temporary gym was on a different floor, and guests only found this out by going to the usual location and being redirected by the pool attendant, The concierge recommended an enjoyable restaurant and made a reservation for us. Sleep quality was less than ideal, again due to the loud neighbouring guests who extended their party into the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “2011 Jazz MTL Festival”
Reviews.Author: dexwood
Reviews.Content: This was my fist stay at the Le Sheraton Montreal since their renovations and I must admit that all they have done is make the hotel even better than it already was/is. Moreover, I am continual impressed with the service provided extended to me at this property, which I have come to dub "my home away from home". The {Executive} suite, was clean & spacious enough for all of my friends who stayed at the hotel to congregate in. This enabled us to have a common room where we all would relax and plan the day's activities.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: HowieDC
Reviews.Content: We had the metro, malls, food and the olde port within walking distance. The hotel's concierge was great for guidance. The room with 2x beds and it was a little cramped. The pool was under renovation so the hot tub was out of service. Overall though, it was worth the price and I'd use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe is time to change.”
Reviews.Author: Eric A
Reviews.Content: This is my third time at this hotel. I'm considering changing my "home away from home" in Montreal. The main disappointment of this stay is that they put us in a tiny room even when we checked in with our AMEX and our Starwood membership. The other times I stayed there I got better rooms. And I don't believe they were full. We went for breakfast twice at the hotel restaurant. The first time we went the male waiter was VERY rude. The female waitress during our second time was very nice. Food is not that great. Breakfast is less than desirable for the price. They do have a nicely run hair salon with reasonable prices. Location is close to shopping, movie theaters and great restaurants. I would recommend to visit EUROPEA Restaurant, not Europa one block away from the hotel. Had the best malbec ever from James Judd in Paso Robles. Food was unbelievable. Also there is a metro station and a Starbucks a block away from the hotel. For great pizza near this hotel, visit Arlequino a block away from the hotel. DELICIOUS! One thing I have to say is that the iron has some nasty stuff in it and I did not look at it before I ironed my shirt. It ruined it. The hotel try to clean it, but they discolored my shirt. They were very proactive and they refund my purchase for a new shirt. That was appreciated it. I visit Montreal often. I may be looking now for a place that meets my more of my needs and appreciate my business a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, we will return”
Reviews.Author: Robin3452
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is in a perfect location, just a short walk to great shopping and restaurants. The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable and the bathroom is spacious, modern and clean. Free internet in the lobby and a casual dining area to get morning coffee/tea. A perfect set-up.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Susanne D
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Montreal has always been my favourite place to stay in Montreal, but a little technical issue put a little damper on our visit this time. We had issues with our television. It wasn't a hude deal, but we had called the front desk three times and the issue was never resolved. The last night of our three-day trip we had wanted to watch a movie, but we couldn't get the menu to load up so we just went to sleep. Again, not a huge issue but enough to cause a little frustration.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayson B
Reviews.Content: I am a SPG Platinum level guest and have been coming to this hotel at least once per year for almost 10 years. As ususal, we had a great experience at this hotel this past weekend (4 nights). Here's the deal. 1. As a Plat, I love the club lounge here. A very good continental style breakfast with great service. 2. Service... always very good. From the front desk to concierge to house keeping. 3. Location... cant beat it. I've strongly considered trying the W or the Westin but the location of the Sheraton is great. Right in the heart of the city. Walk at out any hour and there's something to do. 4. Lobby... I like this hotel because it has a "buzz". Lots of people coming in and out. You could people watch in the lobby for hours. 5. My REAL SCORE would be 4.5 but this is why I did not give it a 5. - Sauna and Jacuzzi are temporarily closed due to the expansion of the exercise facility. The pool is still open though. Not sure when it's going to be done. I wish I knew this before going as we walk 10 miles a day while there and could have have a dip in the jacuzzi. - With the above construction, the 6th floor outdoor patio is closed. This is a hidden gem of this hotel. I hope this opens up after construction is done. - I love the bar in the lobby but the drinks are WAY too expensive. I paid $25 for two draft beers with tip. While at a great restaurant down the street, I paid $5.50 for the same beer. I would drink in here every night if the drink prices were more reasonable. As a guy who makes a good salary and is in the demographic this hotel is targeting, I probably will avoid the bar here simply due to the cost of the beers. I can live with these things... other than that this hotel is awesome. solid 4.5. ...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: CampGirlWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights on a family vacation. The room and the bathroom were a nice size. The sheets were very soft and comfy. It is a great location near Rue Ste. Catherine and within walking distance to the port and Old Montreal. The kids really enjoyed the pool too. We were on the 25th floor and had a great view towards the area of the port. It was not quite as clean as I would expect a Sheraton to be. I found a chicken wing bone on the floor along the edge of the bed when we were double checking that we had all our stuff before we checked out. Also, the bath tub drained very slowly so that we were always ankle deep in water when we showered.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Poochie08
Reviews.Content: We love the Sheraton ever since we had stayed at one in New York City. We usually try to find one wherever we go. We found the check-in service very friendly and it was even better that they accepted our dog. The location of the hotel is excellent if you want to experience the downtown and enjoy shopping. Having said this it was also the first Sheraton we were disappointed with from the housekeeping side. Upon entering the room I could see the far bed was somewhat off in neatness. The pillows looked as though they had been used with the wrinkled look of after being slept on. I went further and opened the bed which the sheets were not tucked in or as crisp like the other bed in the room. When the sheets were peeled back we saw black balls of lint and it was obvious to see the bed was previously slept in. The duvet covers also had dirt marks. We had called to have the bed changed and in good time it was completed. The next day when showering we had found there was a shortage of towels,since the room was not made up properly initially. We had also found a dirty coffee cup. If we were to return to this location we would do a walk through of the room to make sure it was complete in cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: tacmgp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a trip to attend a conference. Great location, comfy and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “WOW Feedback”
Reviews.Author: mjbtravel_11
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the hotel in April as they were there for a tennis event for my kids and had a great experience. We decided to stay there again for the August tennis event and prepaid back a few months ago. Unfortunately today my daughter was injured in a tennis event and is not able to play next week in Montreal. I called to see if they would allow me to cancel as it was pre-paid. Marie said no problem given I was a platinum member. This reinforces why I am a dedicated starwood hotel member and also why the Sheraton Le Centre Montreal is so well run! THANKS! You have just captured a supporter for Life...see you next April!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: choptliva
Reviews.Content: Had to stay overnight in downtown Montreal, and found a good rate at the Sheraton. So decided to give this a try and compare to the Westin. Unless there is a large price gap, I'd go to Westin without any hesitation. This hotel is entirely adequate for a typical Sheraton. Rooms are supposed to have been renovated, and the furnishing is still in good shape. The A/C units still look like from a while back, and they are quite noisy, but they work. Shower/tub combo looks old, but water pressure is adequate. Toilets have the half flush button to use less water if desired. Was upgraded to a junior suite, which is two small rooms put together. The living room area has its own full bath, which uses up a bit of space and results in the junior suite actually being kinda crowded. Living room area also has a large set of drawers, for what purpose I do not know. As well as closet and a second inroom safe. Again, wasted space IMO. Bedroom area is very small. I HOPE it's not the size of a typical room. If it is, it would be of deplorable size. No minifridge or minibar in room, but lounge (on 37th floor) is open till 9. Lounge is huge, basically an entire floor. Serves decent continental breakfast and snacks 5-8 in the evening. Also, coffee/tea during the day. There is a bar for alcholic drinks (charges applied, I think). If you have a laptop and a mobile device, you cannot use both at the same time via the same internet connection. Say you have your laptop connected, and then you want to quickly look up something on the mobile, one will be cut off. I guess unless you pay for both connections (SPG Plats get free internet, but i don't know if you can get free for two connections). There is no restaurant open for dinner at this hotel. No problem. Montreal has so many good restaurants, why would one want to eat in the hotel anyway. But be forewarned. Service at the lounge is okay with some moments of warmth. But doormen, front desk, etc. all are very perfunctory, if not indifferent. In fact, the valet car guy was more courteous than the doorman. Starwood, shame! For instance, when I pulled up to the entrance, the doorman stood there staring into space. He saw the car, but made no move to come and help or anything, until I waved at him. No move to open the door for the missus, or even a make-believe greeting of welcome. Really not what I expected from a supposedly four-diamond hotel (has grade inflation gone so far?).

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased...would return”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkFamilyfun
Reviews.Content: Our family of six stayed for 8 nights in two rooms. We were on a high floor (32) which we requested ahead of time. I noted that the sign on the floor was SPG, which we are...not sure if non-SPG end up staying there. We had a king room and a double double room. Very large. I noticed on their website that there was a large range in square footage for standard rooms. If you click on the room descriptions you will see what I mean. I am sure we had one of the larger sized rooms. We requested a view of the Mountain. Both rooms had this view. Because of a leaky airconditioner that could not be fixed in the king room, part of my family had to move. Considering this was a room that housed my 20 year old and her boyfriend, I had no problem that they were relocated to the 34th floor. They were upgraded to a junior suite which was basically two rooms...one with a king bed and the other with a living area. Important to note that the size of the two rooms in the suite were very small, so if that is the size on the lower end of the standard room range, I can see where people commented that their rooms were small. Because of the inconvenience of the move, which an upgrade was given, we also received a fruit basket and two bottles of wine....which I thought was very nice. We used the health club every morning around 7 am. There were business people around the hotel, but I never waited for a treadmill. There is only one ellipitcal though. The pool, located on the sixth floor, is very small and if I remember correctly goes to about 4.5 feet. There is a person who works right outside of the pool area covering the pool and the health club, but there is no lifeguard at the pool. You have to be 16 to enter without a parent. There is a hot tub which my kids liked. It is very hot inside the pool room. There is a terrace on the sixth floor as well, but it is under rennovation. Seems like poor planning to me as it would have been GREAT to sit outside on that terrace while my kids were in the pool and or just to relax on the summer evenings. We had coffee once, Starbucks, in the lobby bar area. We did not use the restaurants. The gift shop is very small, it is open until around 10 pm. There are other boutiques with expensive items, but they were not open in the morning before we left to tour and they were closed when we came back. There is a business center in the lobby with about 6 dell computers with free internet access...very very convenient as we were traveling outside of the US and didn't want to rack up the international data charges on our IPHONES. I found this to be a very convenient location. Easy walk to green line and orange line of Metro. One block from St. Catherine. Lots of good restaurants near by. Entrance to underground city close but not direct from hotel. Near bell centre. If you are going for a concert or hockey game, I would stay here...it is about a three minute walk. Grayline does pick up from this hotel for tours, but literally the starting point, which the shuttle bus will bring you to, is about a four minute walk. Housekeeping was great...fresh linens and everything cleaned well. Rooms were in good order, no mildew or chipping paint. Beds very comfortable. Pillows fluffy not hard so you judge based on your preference. Concierge was AWESOME! Tickets to different attractions were available and they were so helpful. On our check in night, I found the front desk clerk to be stand offish and rude. It wasn't a great start, but things improved because I didn't have to go to the front desk (except for the leaky airconditioner) again until check out. There was a different person at the desk for the airconditioner and check out and he was very nice. I will tell you that on Friday night a lot of people came in at once and they were very busy in the lobby. The line was very long for check in and I could imagine that people waited an hour. I would have hated that. My check in was quick, but we arrived at 9 pm and no one was on line. I rated the value excellent, but I got a deal for $99 per night Canadian. I would NOT have rated the value that high if I paid the original 200 per night. Although it is a downtown business hotel. Any questions, just send me a pm. Happy Planning

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Centre Bell!”
Reviews.Author: Mexx8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Good: great location, good restaurant on first floor, comfy and clean rooms, nice pool and fitness area. Bad: no fridge in rooms, internet access is $15/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Fairmont5
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed with our family of five for two nights. We were incredibly delighted with the reception staff, the convenience of the location to all neighbourhoods/activities we wished to visit and the comfort of the rooms. The parking underground was easy to manage. The only minor complaint we had was that, for two days in a row, the cleaning staff just walked into our room without knocking. We had breakfast in the bar area downstairs and appreciated the good humour of the servers despite the noise of renovation. The kids loved the pool.

Reviews.Title: “nothing to complain about here !”
Reviews.Author: Kaeri
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in May while on a trip with my mother and I could not fault this hotel. It had a very central location and extremely helpful staff. The rooms were large, comfortable and tastefully decorated. The breakfast was a highlight- the best pancakes with fresh fruit I have ever had. If I was back in Montreal this would be my first choice

Reviews.Title: “Talk about hospitality - what an amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LadyLinzee
Reviews.Content: For the August long weekend we hopped on a train to Montreal for a friend's birthday. I tied the trip into work and stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights. I'm a Starwood member so was upgraded to the Starwoods floor with wonderful views of Montrael. Upon arrival at the hotel I was checked in quickly and arrived at my beautiful room. It was spotless from top to bottom and I just couldn't get enough of that Sheraton bed. My friends joined me the following day and there was a little bit of delay on check-in as there were several large groups who checked in at the same time but the front desk were courteous and did their best to get the line moving. During the course of our stay we ordered room service and I have to say the food was spectacular. Working in the event management business I visit a lot of hotels and I have to say the overall service level and hospitality provided by the Sheraton was outstanding. I would not hesitate to recommend the Sheraton to friends, family and colleagues alike!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feeling about this visit”
Reviews.Author: bobpeg6
Reviews.Content: We thought the room was VERY small. Upon returniing home I saw a rate of $149 posted in my email. Dissapointed that I was not apprised of this special rate when booking. However, haveig stayed her many times in the past we do generally like the hotel and its location, and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, busy area”
Reviews.Author: Dolcetravel
Reviews.Content: Got this for $109/night on Hotwire which is much lower than published. Very nice hotel, great service, great bar & lobby, comfortable rooms, location was in busy downtown highrise area, to be expected of a biz class hotel. Walkable to Vieux Montreal, Latin Quarter & Chinatown a bit of a hike. $10 taxi to Little Portugal. City is so large hard to say what a great location would be anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mariw11
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in other Sheraton hotels we looked forward to our two night stay in the Montreal hotel. We were most disappointed. Our room was ok but we were surprised to find that there was no fridge. Our main grouse was that we were uaable to sleep as the air conditioning was extremely noisy all night long. To add to our woes during our very expensive and but standard breakfast we were deafened by a pneumatic drill being used in the basement directly under the dining room. It was so loud that the cups rattled in our saucers. Realise that repairs have to be done but at 8am? We did complain as we were checking out at our complaint was noted. Really disappointed as previous experiences of Shraton hotels have been good....particularly the one in Edinburgh in Scotland. Will not use again if ever in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms and Attention to Detail!”
Reviews.Author: bguilbo
Reviews.Content: Beautifully renovated rooms, attentive staff and access to the club lounge made for an awesome stay here in Montreal. Great location close to shopping, transit and restaurants, reasonnable parking rates (about $21 CDN per night for self-park) and great hotel amenities will keep me coming back for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “No problem here. Great property.”
Reviews.Author: sens1992
Reviews.Content: Le Centre Sheraton Montreal is a great property. Located just accross the Bell Centre in the heart of downtown Montreal. The room was great. The furniture is brand new. The bed was great and the room was immaculate. We ordered room service and both the food and service were excellent. Book this hotel with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific and Clean”
Reviews.Author: PrincessPeaNJ
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with convenient underground parking garage -- charge it to your room for in and out privileges, but we parked and stayed. Metro is across the street -- get a 3 day metro card for ease of use. Hotel is clean and beautiful. Concierge was helpful. Lobby and bar were impressive looking. Room was quiet and comfortable. Elevator was quick. Only negative is that one bellman takes your things out of the car and another brings them to your room -- double the tips!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!! Le Centre Sheraton Montreal”
Reviews.Author: LuisAngel69
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Montreal, so I was so excited and called the hotel the night before and spoke to Vannessa which was helpful in getting me some info. I arrived on July 22-26 and was greated by Anna at the front desk, which welcomed us with a warm smile and always available to answer any questions. My room was perfect and was fortunate to have a nice view of the city. During my stay I had Club Level access, which is when I met the nicest lady Jeannie, she was always busy like a bee but would take a minute to give awesome tourist site suggestions. She recommended the fireworks by the water, Totem show and good restaurants; Jeannie is trully amazing hard worker; please give her my commendation. All in all it was an awesome and amazing fun time.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: cookiecrew5
Reviews.Content: Attending a convention and got a deal, otherwise a bit expensive, but so is Canada! Hotel was as expected, staff were all very good and the front desk very efficient .Prices in the bar were expensive Room was clean and tidy the bed excellent. Good location especially for shopping!

Reviews.Title: “our trip to montreal”
Reviews.Author: irabellovin
Reviews.Content: a decline in overall hotel service from previous stays is apparent. the $5.00 credit for not making up room is disgraceful for a major hotel. you should rethink that policy.

Reviews.Title: “Great commitment to excellence at this location”
Reviews.Author: SKSC
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this location a number of times and I've written several reviews on Le Centre Sheraton. This had to be the best stay! The caring and commited staff made it a wonderful experience. Check in was flawless and friendly with a comp. upgrade to include access to the Club Lounge...very nice! Our room, newly renovated provided us with a wonderful view of Mount Royal made even more spectacular when we watched a free show courtesy of Mother Nature via a thunder and lightening storm one night. Kudos to some wonderful employees that made our visit most memorable. Jesus...friendly, funny and helpful. I don't think I've ever seen someone enjoy his job more than this man did. Thank you for the shear joy that you demonstrated to us! Mark (conceirge) who ordered us our Indiana Jones exhibit tickets and even printed them off for us! That was simply above and beyond the call of duty. Alexandra (guest services manager) This wonderful woman came down to the front desk to see me after I'd had a "argument" with the maid on our floor. Simply stated, she listened to the problems I had encountered with Susanna (the maid) and came with me to my room to give us the box of kleenex I wanted but couldn't get from the floor maid...she wouldn't give it to me. Alexandra also made sure that we got our wet towels exchanged for dry ones. I was so angry, and Alexandra went out of her way to eliminate my upset. Graciously, she sent her card to our room with 2 comp. breakfast vouchers. What a wonderful ambassador for customer service! Thank you so much Alexandra! Finally, Bruno (concierge) Who, upon hearing that the bachelor party guests staying on the same floor as us had not only woken us up at 3:30 a.m. one morning, but had also ended up that same evening eating at the same restaurant, at the same time at the next table, had given us a very rough evening (so much so, that we had to leave the restaurant early) sent to our room a lovely bottle of port with imported chocolates, maple candies and a wonderful card. It seems that the manager of the restaurant next door (La Queue de Chevall) had phoned him to tell Bruno what had happened. We were so touched by this over-the-top display of kindness that it brought a tear to my eye. Thank you so much Bruno...you do your job extemely well. Your boss should be very proud of you and he should be of all his employees! Of course, with the exception of the floor maid, everyone was wonderful, helpful, kind and all went out their ways to make us feel like we were really important and that we mattered! While at the computer station, a young man from the front desk approached me and asked me how I had made out the night following all the "bachelor" troubles. How thoughtful was that? These are just a few reasons why, when we visit Montreal every year, we always choose Le Centre Sheraton as our home away from home. I know that not everyone has had such great luck as we've had over the years. That's too bad, because this really is a wonderful hotel. It's clean, centrally located, close to great shopping and fine eateries. The Bell Centre is almost across the street and the walk to Vieux Port is do-able. Thank you for such a wonderful time. We will be travelling back to Montreal in June 2012 to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. I know that Le Centre Sheraton will not disappoint! Thank you all for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marbig1966
Reviews.Content: Large and comfortable room, quite and well sited hotel in the business area but no far from the walking area downtown. rates: good in some periods, in general in the average for the rank of the hotel. Stayed 2 nights. Breakfast is possible at the starbucks or at the cafetteria in the hall area. Both are quit good, the service at the cafetteria is too fast

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: jdcanada022
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in numerous hotels throughout downtown Montreal,this one is still my favorite.Great location;welcoming large lobby;spacious,bright hotel bar. Comfortable,clean rooms.Good rates if you put a bit of work into your search.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Decent Sheraton. Convenient In/Out for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: TooFrequentTraveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Sheraton several times over the past months. I find it really well located with lots of restaurants around. Easy registration and check-out. Have not used the gym/pool. Club Lounge on the top floor is ok, but only just ok. Not a great place to hang out for either work or to decompress. My main beef is the expensive room service (a burger and a beer get you to $35) - but with the restaurants around that can be avoiced most of the time. Parking fee is high at $25/night.

Reviews.Title: “Good time on canada day weekend”
Reviews.Author: VFCO
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean - 13 guest checked in Pool well kept and fitness center is good - spa is reasonable price Rooms have starbucks coffee Rooms not ready until after 3:00pm - not a problem Breakfast was not included with our stay - had to go down St Catherine to second cup or up bishop to subway Cora's is also very close to hotel Was a bachelor party weekend - very close to all activities (i.e. night clubs, food) Vargus steakhouse was good (within walking distance) Les 3 Brasseurs pub and grill good food as well on rue st catherine St catherine not the best place to walk with family as lots of adult parlors and adult shows (even during the day)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Friendly staff, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: oldebaldy
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a great property. Well trained, friendly and attentive staff; comfortable beds; spacious rooms, and a great location only a 15 minute walk to the old town, but 1 block from shopping and the sports arena. Also on the same street as the airport bus so very convenient to get to and from. Only negative was the gym (very small). According to the gym attendant, they are planning to renovate the gym later this fall so it should be much bigger and nicer. Nice big lap pool and hot tub. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect every time”
Reviews.Author: lonelybaker
Reviews.Content: I love going to Montreal and have stayed in this hotel at least a dozen times. While I thought it was darn near perfect, the hotel underwent a serious renovation last year and.. it got better. They modernized the furniture and toned down the traditional elements, bringing it further into transitional and making those of us who love modern feel at home while our ... ahem...traditional-loving husbands feel at home as well. While big, it is not impersonal as the staff is very helpful and ever-ready with advice, reservations, locating that special toothbrush or lost luggage. The cleanliness level is beyond reproach as is room service. Yeah, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location (near train station)”
Reviews.Author: kaberle
Reviews.Content: We got a great online rate and stayed here during the U2 concert. The room was a good size, was updated and clean. Check-in and out was fast. An easy walk from the train station (about 5 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Damning with faint praise”
Reviews.Author: AgentSmithDC
Reviews.Content: Positives: Check-in went smoothly and courteously. My room was compact and well designed, with nice furniture and decor. I appreciate the effort to be eco-friendly, along with the flat screen. The room was clean and comfortable. Improvement needed: a shell had been dropped over the existing tub and it didn't fit. There must have been a gap of over 1/2" between the thin shell and the old porcelain tub, making it hard to stand up and stay balanced. Despite the double glazed glass and a 9th floor location, there was a lot of street noise, no doubt the result of the HVAC unit mounted into the wall. The hotel itself was a bit tired and dreary. The pub had 2 tiny TVs...a group of us were watching a sports event and couldn't see much. In sum, not a bad experience, but should be better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rosey1963Toronto
Reviews.Content: As always, the Sheraton is a reliable and comfortable place to stay in any city. The location is fabulous, within walking distance of McGill and the main shopping district, close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great downtown location close to shopping and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Reginaredhead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after booking on Hotwire. We got a great deal and the hotel definitely lived up to its 4-star rating. Our room on the 8th floor was spacious and modern, very clean and offered a lovely view. It was very hot in Montreal during our stay and the air conditioning was awesome, not like some hotels where it's moldy and hardly blows at all. Housekeeping keeps odd hours- one day our room wasn't cleaned until after 5 pm. There was no refrigerator in the room. Internet access costs $14.95 per 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the updates”
Reviews.Author: Bobbert63
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came home from our mini vacation in Montreal to see the Paul McCartney concert at the Bell Centre. We arrived by train and looked for a hotel within close proximity to both the train station and the concert venue. We chose the Sheraton as we have stayed there in the past and always liked it. It is just a few blocks down the street from the train station and an easy walk even with luggage. Upon arrival, we quickly noticed the new look of the hotel since our last visit which was sadly too long ago. The hotel was starting to look a little dated the last time we stayed but nothing too major. First off, the front desk looks far more modern. The small bar is now at the other end of the lobby and is a much larger more open area to have a drink or to sit and discuss business if that is what you are there for. The smaller area that was the bar is now the restaurant area. The staff were very friendly as we arrived. More than one staff member smiled or greeted us as we got ready to check in. Anna, our front desk clerk was so nice to talk with and helped us out with a few issues we brought up. She actually talked with us and not at us. Great asset to the company. The room was as we remembered with that great bed that makes a stay here worth the cost. The room really looked great. The bathroom received a huge makeover which was about the only area that we felt needed it. Really liked the new coffee area too. On checkout, we once again had a little issue as we were not scheduled to leave until late afternoon and were not sure what to do with our luggage. Once again, the front desk came to our rescue ( Anna again! ) and just made us feel so glad we booked here. Sometimes it's the little things like this that make you remember why you chose the hotel you did and in Montreal, there are many great choices. Our choice from now on is the Sheraton. Thank you for a wonderful stay and for all of your help.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: caw358
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel but the noise from the street made it a miserable trip for the lack of sleep. We stayed in room 1229 which faced Rene Levesque and the car horns, sirens, and what sounded like busses braking woke us up all night long. On Friday night we even heard noises from people on the street and remember this is on the 12th floor. We did not ask to switch rooms for Saturday night and that is my mistake but I somehow thought we would be tired enough to be able to sleep through the noise the next night but sadly that was not the case. The way the air conditioner is set up, we were not able to leave the fan on all night long to help with noise and there was no bathroom fan that we could use.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Locs376
Reviews.Content: First time in Montreal and this hotel was great! Very friendly staff and a very clean place. Great location for a downtown trip. Would stay here on our next visit

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, but some gaps in service”
Reviews.Author: synToronto
Reviews.Content: Location: Central downtown location. One block away from shopping at St. Catherines, and virtually next door to the Bell Centre. About 20-25 minutes walk to Old Montreal. Parking: Self park for $24/day or $35 valet. The parking garage first three levels is valet only. Access through the hotel car pick up/drop off area. Check in/out: No real issues. Room: Rooms are clean and what the decor is consistent with what you would expect from a Starwood hotel. It had an in room safe, desk, chair, flat screen TV, internet access for a fee, but no fridge. I noted that the entry door is so thin that you can hear everything in the hall (especially at 3AM when the bars close). Service: Service is a little spotty. More than one request for amenities were not responded to and then for other requests, the service came fairly promptly. When management is aware, they do seem to try to accomodate requests (perhaps as a result of cost cutting or they are overwelmed). Features: The hotel pool is small, but nice and warm. There is also a hot tub and sauna, and exercise room on floor 6.
