Club floor access: On the 37th floor is the club amenities for platinum members only or if you purchase access (ie. up from gold status). The breakfast is mostly an assortment of cold items (breads, muffins, boiled eggs (cold), fruits, cereals, oatmeal (hot), juices). Go earlier if you can because I noted that the selection gets very sparse by around 8:30 and in some cases so does seating. Overall: I think the hotel was certainly good enough to go back to (if the price is competitive), but not great enough to consideration of the other hotels in the immediate area such as the Fairmont or the Marriott. Better service is reserved for Platinum members.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Spot to Enjoy Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Mustang697
Reviews.Content: We chose the Le Centre Montreal for our honeymoon spot because of its amenities, access and top-flight accommodations. We were not disappointed. Every day of our stay was like the first. Staff were consistent in their service, food and drink was superb ( I have a new found appreciation for Eggs Benedict!). We had a great time and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Montreal trip with the family”
Reviews.Author: Sp00kyfish
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 2 nights in July -- travelling with kids aged 7 and 10. This was a great hotel for our purposes, which included a concert at the Bell Centre and general Montreal sightseeing. Easy walk to the Bell Centre and the downtown attractions. Lots of great restaurant choices nearby. Also close to a subway stop. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, and the kids loved the pool. A very clean and well-located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dpikula260657
Reviews.Content: I unfortunately did not have a very pleasant stay. On my first night I had asked for a bath robe twice and did not receive one. I also discovered a condom rapper along the side of the bed under the mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Derail63
Reviews.Content: To get from the airport to Hotel use the STM Shuttle, only $8 and it drops you off in front of the hotel. The sundeck at the hotel is closed for renovations. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. The bed was great, nice fluffy pillows, but I like firm pillows. The hotel is close to many restaurants, shops and malls. Great location especially for business, for pleasure trips next time I will consider staying in Old Montreal, there were several nice renovated hotels there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but don't get the queen room!”
Reviews.Author: tycl516
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel purely based on the reviews here on trip advisor. The only thing that I would suggest is that if u see a great deal on expedia, orbitz, or hotels.com, make sure u snatch it right away, as this place books up super quick! I waited too long to book, and subsequently could have gotten a $120/night rate, but I ended up paying $170/night before taxes. The room we got was the queen one, and while the bed was quite comfortable, especially after a long trek, the room was very small and felt a bit tight. There was a nice chair with ottoman next to the bed, with a large mirror on the opposing wall. The view we had was facing the backside of the street, so it was pretty quiet. Water pressure was great in the shower, and the bathroom was nicely decorated with champagne marble countertops with granite flooring. It's just a shame that the ceilings had that "popcorn" look to them. The other thing is that there is no fan in the bathroom, so just be prepared for that. The central location to all the main attractions makes this place very attractive, and with all day parking at $21/day with in-out privileges, u can't complain. Overall, I would recommend staying here, but don't bother saving a few bucks for the queen room. Definitely get the king room, it's much more worth having that extra space. Great customer service, and excellent English skills, so I recommend staying here! FYI, Internet is $16/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, facility and location...definitely a place to return back to!”
Reviews.Author: JCFairmont
Reviews.Content: The concierge was most helpful in identifying the perfect restaurant to celebrate my husband's 60th birthday. We had an enchanting evening and the hotel stay was comfortable, very clean and convenient. If you upgrade to the SPG lounge you can see amazing views of Montreal and enjoy a delicious breakfast and evening cocktails and canapes. No hesitation to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: george00
Reviews.Content: I recently spend one night at Le Sheraton Montreal to do some sightseeing. The hotel is well located downtown, close to the train station, metro stations and Crescent Street nightlife. The hotel is fairly large and seemed packed with "partiers". I was worried that I might not get much sleep but I only woke up once due to loud revelers returning to their room. The view from my room was great. The room was very clean but small compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Montreal. Check in was quick with no issues. The negatives would be the same as for most Sheratons - you have to pay for in room internet access and it is impossible to get a late night snack in the bar. I was hoping that a hotel of this size would have some sort of snack available at 11 pm in the bar but they didn't (and of course the shop on the lower floor was closed).

Reviews.Title: “I love your place and people.”
Reviews.Author: RicardoHamden
Reviews.Content: After 25 years I came back to Montreal and I found one of the most interesting, professional, clean and loving hotel. I recommend this hotel to the whole world. Good rate and service; great location. You food was wonderful. I'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Stan_MS
Reviews.Content: being SPG platinum member entitles to complimentary suite upgrade if available. Le Centre Sheraton Montreal Hotel was not prepared to offer it until asked. Even then it took some negotiating to get it and accommodations themselves were not all that "sparkly" SPG lounge did not offer any complimentary alcoholic beverages, even got charged for a fruit juice for the kid there is a decent size indoor swimming pool mostly for kids with sauna and jacuzzi but amenities are across the hall and down the corridor, which made it somewhat inconvenient. there were no music dock that chargers iPhone/iPod in the room. I usually expect more from Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Fell short of a standard expected from a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatherineMReading
Reviews.Content: I have never complained about a hotel before. I tend to give places the benefit of the doubt. However, this hotel and the service in it was so poor that I feel compelled to write a poor review. The 4 concerns were as follows (in order of importance): 1. Internet charges I cannot believe that a 4-star hotel that charges premium rates can get away with charging for in-room Wi-Fi in this day and age (CAD14.75 excluding taxes!). Most cafes, coffee shops and restaurants in Montreal and throughout Canada provide free Wi-Fi, as do the majority of budget hotels around the world. There was no free Wi-Fi in the bar either (although there was a â€˜Linkâ€™ Sheraton station by the front desk which looked like a naughty boy corner). Shocking. 2. Layout of the room My room was next door to another, the two were tucked away together in the corner. I suspect previously they were adjoined and were a suite. The only thing separating me from my neighbours was a thin bathroom door. This meant that I heard EVERYTHING going on in the room next door, including their conversation and, even worse, their bedroom activities. I heard this loud and clear, as if it was in my room! 3. Charge for keeping bags I arrived on the first day at 9 am and was told my room was not going to be available until 12. I had asked for an early check-in the day before and was told it was not possible, so this in itself was not a problem. I understood that the hotel was fully booked. What was a problem was that the hotel charged me CAD6 to keep my bags for 3 hours. Most decent hotels offer this as a complimentary service. 4. Queues at Reception Every time I went up to the front desk there were 5 â€“ 10 minute queues, with only 2-3 receptionists available for a queue of 8-10 people. Again, this is unacceptable. I stayed at The Met in Vancouver before coming to Montreal and there they had 3 receptionists even though they had no queues so you were seen within a minute or so, free wi-fi, no charge for bags and quiet rooms. Quite a contrast.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, good location”
Reviews.Author: MarkL78
Reviews.Content: Amazing views from our 31st floor corner room were the highlight of the hotel. Clean, nicely furnished room with a very nice bathroom. Good location for a short visit to Montreal for sight-seeing, shopping, etc. Bar and restaurant are over priced, the food was average at best but there are lots of other options within walking distance for eating and drinking. Staff were not the most friendly or helpful people (except the bar staff). The bistro staff were grumpy to the point of rudeness so we only ate there once. It is an ok place to stay but not one of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MetroDetroitBen
Reviews.Content: We took a couples getaway trip over the Fourth of July weekend to Montreal. We took the train and the hotel was just 3 blocks out of the station doors. The entire place has been redone within the past year or so and the rooms show it. All of the public areas are nicely appointed, and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. We stayed on our starwood preferred guest points and opted for their club level rooms. Our room was on the 35th floor with a specatacular view of the city and Mount Royal. The location couldn't have been better. It is 1 block off of St Cahterines a major restaurant, shopping and club area and directly across the street from Bell Centre. We did have an issue with the AC unit leaking water onto our carpet but it never interferred with our stay and maintenance was prompt in getting it taken care of while we were out. All of the staff we dealt with were friendly, helpful and curteous. My only complaint about this place was the height of the shower heads. I don't know if the French Canadians are just shorter but my wife and I had to duck to get our heads wet. Other than that I thought it was one of the better Sheratons I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away...over priced and you get nothing for the $”
Reviews.Author: arifiano
Reviews.Content: Not the best place for a family to stay. It is overpriced and you will get nothing that a young family may need. Plus the parking is way overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: pollack_daniel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business off and on for eight months. The hotel is ideally located in downtown Montreal, within walking distance to many amazing restaurants and sites. The recently renovated rooms are nice and were always clean. What kept me coming back was the incredible service provided by the staff. In particular, a concierge named Bruno often went the extra mile to ensure my stay was as memorable as possible. He took the initiative to make sure my room was ready on my arrival and he helped with tickets, restaurants and personal areas (a colleague required a doctor). He always followed up to ensure my requests were completed to my satisfaction. As a regular business traveller, I was incredibly impressed with Bruno's dedication and high level of service. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any business traveller or guest looking for a great hotel in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great service and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Wilymay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - close to good shopping, restaurants and bars. Its right by St. Catherines street and a short cab ride from Old Montreal (where all the great restaurants and cool bars are). It's also nearby bus stops, train stations and highways if you're driving. The staff is extremely helpful when it comes to check in, providing directions or even giving you restaurant selections and even for room service. We traveled with a large group of girls around 16 and we asked for joining rooms which was perfect. The rooms are a decent size perfect with a good size bed, and nice bathrooms which are always important. The hotel even has a pool, hot tub and sauna which is a nice to have when you've had a busy day of walking, eating, and shopping. If you're looking for something online there is free internet in the business centre. I would recommend this hotel to friends and a small family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAM_smitian
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, it is clean modern and the staff was helpful. Since the hotel is downtown and we were spending most of our time in Old Montreal, we had a 20 minute walk to Old Montreal. If you need a downtown hotel this hotel is prefect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SoxTrips
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is in a great location in downtown. It is one block from the Bonaventure metro (subway) station, Bell Centre and one block from St. Catherine street which is full of shopping. Parking is expensive at the hotel but you can park in a garage on Stanley Street called Parc Stanley for $14 a day. Stanley Street is located along the side of the hotel. The rooms are small but they are very clean and spotless. The staff provides great service. If the excellent concierge was busy and there was a line then the bell captain would step in and ask if there was a question he could answer which was great if you needed directions. There is no free wifi in the rooms but there is free wifi in the lobby. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: aland60890
Reviews.Content: We paid for two nights and got the third free. The hotel is in a great location. The staff and the room are wonderful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: valleylight
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. It was clean, comfortable. We loved the view (stayed on floor 34.)

Reviews.Title: “Found a good deal and it was very nice”
Reviews.Author: bjorn5555
Reviews.Content: Too many extra charges. Didn't have free internet. They wanted to charge $15/day. Parking not too bad at $23/day. Pool area had too much standing water. 2 employees just sitting at pool counter. Get a mop! Pool, Hot tub, sauna very nice. People very nice. Good service. No free coffee downstairs but in room. landscaping needed work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Valutravler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 times for conferences and both times the stay was very pleasant. The staff go out of their way to accommodate you and really makes your stay that much more enjoyable. Everyone from the front desk (especially Dana) to the concierge, bellman, gym attendant, to the servers in the club lounge were incredibly gracious, friendly and attentive to your needs without being pushy or intrusive. The staff really made my stay much more pleasant. Conveniently located in the heart of downtown. Close to shopping on St. Catharines (1 block), old town (15 min walk), and right on the 747 bus line to the airport. Also a block away from the Arena where the Habs play hockey. The facilities are nice - standard Sheraton

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: CTFamily08
Reviews.Content: After doing extensive research on hotels in Montreal, we decided on Sheraton Le Centre Montreal on Rene Levesque Boulevard. I couldn't have been more pleased. The location was outstanding. We took the train from Albany, NY to the Gare Centrale in downtown Montreal which was just steps from the hotel. Since we arrived late in the day, it was a relief to be so close to our destination. I wasn't sure what to expect when we entered the hotel, but I was pleasantly surprised at the elegance and cleanliness of the decor. My teenage children remarked that the Sheraton was the "fanciest" hotel they had ever visited (yet, they have stayed at much pricier places). The room was large enough for the four of us, the beds were extremely comfortable and the view was awesome. Our main purpose in Montreal was to attend the Jazz Festival. Initially, I was worried the festival venue was too far from the hotel, but it was actually a pleasant fifteen-twenty minute walk on flat city blocks filled with interesting shops and restaurants. The service at the the hotel was amazing. Check-in was swift even though the hotel was quite busy. However, the most remarkable experience was the prompt and effective remedy I received regarding a slight snafu in our reservations. I don't think I have ever received such excellent customer service!! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay there when in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: Georges28
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel that I recommend both for business and holiday travels. Breakfast could be improved. But the service is always so nice ... George, Paris

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic High End Hotel with a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: orishok
Reviews.Content: We spend 2 nights here at the recommendation of a friend - the hotel was amazing! We were greeted upon arrival almost like royalty, our room on the 14th floor overlooked a gorgeous view of the city and we thoroughly enjoyed our fantastic location on Rene-Levesque O, one block from Rue St Catherine, which was ideal for shopping and sightseeing. We walked everywhere! The hotel also had underground parking, which was very convenient. Would definitely return & recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Same old boring Sheraton.”
Reviews.Author: PickE
Reviews.Content: Clean, standardized corporate Sheraton rooms. Decent service. Limited room service, not even 24 hours, surprising for a large business hotel. After 10pm,. there is no real food places or activity around. Location is good for business downtown and near the metro. Room service quality was 4/10. Had a chicken club and some cake, it was 42 bucks! and not even that good. Wouldnt stay here unless for business and someone was paying for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: hoppertheglobe
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. The rooms are on the smaller side. Nevertheless, very clean, great service, spotless bedspreads, good shower pressure. Front staff very helpful. Would definitely stay there again. We loved the view from our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Melissa150
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Le Centre Montreal Hotel was not the best place I've stayed at when in Montreal. The good part was that it was very clean, the location was great and beds were comfy! But unfortunately the bad outweighs the good here. Their front desk staff are unbelievably rude, and should probably consider that many people traveling to Montreal can speak both English and French. Two front desk staff (one of them being the manager) actually made rude remarks about us in French right in front of us. Not very professional. Also, when we booked they told us a fridge and microwave would be included in the room free of charge, but when we arrived they were apparently not available and if we wanted one, we would have to pay $30 per appliance per night. Might I add, they yelled all of this at us. Overall clean hotel, convenient area, but I would not return solely because of the management. There are tons of hotels in the area... you can definitely find another one with better staff.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, rude staff, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Tegan4141
Reviews.Content: This hotel ranks as one of the most overpriced hotels I have ever stayed in. Be prepared to even pay to have the concierge hold your bags in storage! There is nothing here that is included. Add to that the fact that the front desk staff is rude, arrogant and unwilling to help in any way and you have good reasons to stay away from here. There are much better Starwood hotels in Montreal where they actually care about customer service. Front desk staff define incompetent. Made multiple errors on my bill and double and triple charged on items and refused to fix! No one should have to put up with this level of rudeness from front desk staff. Yes the hotel is nice but definitely not worth dealing with the staff or the absolutely overpriced rates. Others here have made similar comments and they are correct! So do yourself a favor and check out one of the many other better hotels in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: mimimoura
Reviews.Content: I had excellent service when I arrived. I got a good rate $140 for 2 double beds from hotels.com. I was debating between this hotel and the Hilton Garden Inn. This hotel is located closer to the waterfront. It was right next to La Queue de Cheval which is where i went for my dinner. I also recommend you go to Hakata Ramen near the hotel for appetizers and bubble tea. Their bubbles are filled with juice, unlike any bubble tea I've had before. The room was very spacious and super clean. Although we were located across from the elevators, I hardly heard anything at night. Just the usual noise of people in the hallway waiting for the elevator in the morning. There are also ports to charge your devices like a USB port which was useful for my iphone since I just brought the cable. I had a chance to use the gym. They have two new threadmills that allow you to watch TV or connect your ipod to save your workout. The pool was very long. I didn't have a chance to use it, but my husband enjoyed swimming laps in it. I would definitely stay here next time I stay in Montreal for the weekend. I do recommend you park at the Stanley Parking lot which is located on Stanley street next to the hotel. I can't believe I parked there overnight and it was only $12 on a weekend. That was an awesome tip I received from someone else on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: kl_mpls33
Reviews.Content: Great location and very nice accommodations. Service was very good by all staff. Only problem was the slow elevators during busy times of the conference. Drinks at hotel bar were also very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hello”
Reviews.Author: nnnn3
Reviews.Content: Love the location - stay there when on business. But some problems continue to exist that are disturbing. The tub had water in it when i arrived and the water pressure is so low , when one is getting ready to head to work it is frustrating. The cleaning people need to drain the tub after they clean the room!

Reviews.Title: “Dog friendly, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: tiddlywink121
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took a weekend trip to Montreal with our Bulldog. Checkin was quick and as soon as the receptionist saw our dog, she gave him a doggy bandana! When we got to our room there was a doggy sleeper, dog bowls, and a little dog kit with gloves and poopy bags! When the cleaning ladies come to clean your room, you have to be there because if you have a dog. You're not supposed to leave your dog unattended in your room, but our dog is very well behaved and he just sleeps when we're not there! The hotel is in a great location! everywhere is walkable including a park less 5 mins walk so the dog can do his business! concierge is very friendly, they suggested some great restos to eat at! Every time we walked past any staff, they would stop and play with the dog Parking is a bit expensive, $24 to park yourself, $31 for valet Overall, very friendly staff, clean hotel, great location and value! definitely will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Aust_mum
Reviews.Content: I arrived at midnight after 32 hours travelling from Australia and was astounded that the room service had already closed at 11 pm. I thought it was a 5 star hotel and would have 24 hr room service. The bathroom appears to have been renovated which was good. Great size TV. There was a very old, noisy air conditioner sitting on the floor below the window - which doesn't automatically set the room temperature and turn off or on as needed. The internet was expensive and you had to pay for each device - laptop and iphone - separately each day. The champagne/sparkling wine list is very small. The laundry costs were expensive. The walls are the painted-spray-on-sand finish - really dated. No refrigerator. I'll try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Petra_ehrhard
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller. I have organised an event in the hotel with 120 international guests involved. They all stayed in the hotel, too. The event took place during the F1 GP, busiest time of the year. Hotel staff was excellent, in all occasions. Always prepared to go one step further, to offer extra time & effort, always with a smile. The hotel will be renovated during summer, I heard. If the staff keep on going with its excellent service attitude, renovated interioer and location will stay - all in all, this hotel will not have any real competition in Montreal, I suspect. One negative point though: internat rates are far too high. Le Centre Sheraton, they made me feel at home- for 10 stressful days. I'll definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL (especially if you plan on seeing a hockey game)”
Reviews.Author: Queensjad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in February. This hotel has a great location- lots of shopping, bars, etc. within walking distance and it's literally across the street from the Bell Center, which was perfect for us since we were in town for a Habs game. Nice rooms, clean pool, just an all-round nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & convenient location hotel with friendly & courteous service”
Reviews.Author: Travelite11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in downtown Montreal. Friendly & courteous service from the hotel staff. Room was clean but the temperature was too warm - could improve by increasing the air conditioning. Also recommend providing guests with disposable slippers, shower caps and toothbrushes/toothpaste. Parking was expensive at $24/d - could improve by having discounted rates for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: lighthouseboy
Reviews.Content: Room was great. Comfy bed and nice flat panel HDTV. Room faced west. Paid $85 plus tax on priceline and I parked in the Parc Stanley ($14/day but if you take the car out, you pay your ticket and you get a new ticket the next time you park). I have breakfast both morning at Cora's and I love walking Ste Catherines retail mile. Staff was excellent and there are free computer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: rev12349
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, we felt bad disturbing the front desk at check in, the concierge was not helpful and the bar and parking prices $31 night are ridiculous, the room was clean and the location ok

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever”
Reviews.Author: Platna
Reviews.Content: The location is great - a block away from St Catherine, a 10-minute walk to Crescent St and 20 minutes by foot from the Old Town. We stayed on the 27th floor with a panoramic view of downtown Montreal. Parking was $24/day without valet service and was only a few dollars more expensive than other lots in the area. Check-in was a breeze, and they let us have the room a couple of hours early. The room and bathroom were very clean. And the bed - it's just incredible. Unbelievably comfortable with a vista of the entire city in front of you. I think I'm going to buy it. The staff is nice and professional, helping out with directions. A small snafu which happens at many hotels: the bill at the end of the stay was incorrect. They charged us for 2 drinks at the upstairs lounge which we never visited. This has happened at another Sheraton in the past, and was taken off right away when I brought it up. Not a big deal, but do check your bill. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !! except the $24 parking per night”
Reviews.Author: DevilsCutePrincess
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the sheraton for the memorial day weekend. the hotel is very nice and clean. we were given a room at 24th floor with a breathtaking review. The furniture was new and stylish and contemporary. we also used the pool and jacuzzi which was very nice. The only thing we did not like was the parking per day. I got the hotel from priceline for 110 $$ per night, but with taxes and parking..it was almost 155 $$ per night.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine, thank you very much!”
Reviews.Author: dentgal
Reviews.Content: My friend's first foray into Priceline--and he got the Sheraton Centre in Montreal. We went for his son's graduation and wanted a cot put into one of the two rooms which were purchased. A phone call to the hotel prior to our arrival was not satisfactory, to say the least, but upon arriving at the hotel, the front desk staff were very nice and helpful regarding the cot. Thank goodness the hotel redeemed itself or my suggestion for priceline would have been problematic!! However, when we went to our room, we couldn't enter with the room key and it turned out that the room was occupied by another person and somehow the front desk mixed this up. Hmmmm. The poor guy in the room was running into the bathroom wrapped in a towel and wasn't thrilled when the hotel staff used their master key to enter! For our aggravation, we negotiated free internet for the duration of our stay!! The lobby is very nice and the hotel is in a good location near St.Catherine street and McGill University. The room was pleasant and more than adequate. Not as nice as the Westin of Ottawa--where we went the following weekend--but certainly quite nice. Our main complaint was the noise in the room. We were next to the elevator shaft and I'm not sure if that was the source of the noise, but it was bothersome when it was time to sleep. However we got a pretty good deal on Priceline, so it's hard to complain too much!

Reviews.Title: “easter getaway”
Reviews.Author: traveltdot
Reviews.Content: We drove to Montreal for a weekend getaway with another couple. We both had lovely rooms,a comfortable bed and enjoyed our stay here. It is right across the street from the bell centre, a block away from St. Catherines (shopping), around 20 minute walk to Old Montreal. Small gym but can get a decent workout, if its nice out jogging by the water wouldn't be that far from the hotel. I didn't eat at the restaurant but I would avoid it for breakfast. $$ Go to the lobby bar and get a coffee and croissant instead. We received a special room rate of $ 99 a night included free internet in our room. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Toronto31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our 5th wedding anniversary and enjoyed it. The staff was very helpful and the hotel was in a great location - it was easy to walk everywhere and we never needed a taxi. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It was a very positive experience and anyone considering visiting Montreal should consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: Arch201
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the central part of town. The service was great and the hotel accomodated our needs. I will stay here again with my family. The next time I will ask for the junior suite as a roll away bed is not offered for a family of five with two double beds. Parking is expensive $31/day and I am a New Yorker. Overall, lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluephlash
Reviews.Content: While there's nothing really spectacular or amazing about this hotel (other than the view from higher floors), there's nothing bad about it either. The only thing that I wished for was that it was connected to the Reso (underground city). It rained while I was there, and it would have been nice not to have to go outside in the rain. Some other hotels in the area are connected directly to Metro stops and other buildings. The rooms were nice, and quite large. The bathroom in particular I remember being very nice. Each floor is not that big, so there aren't a thousand people around at all hours, and it's very easy to get an elevator too. Front desk staff were helpful and friendly. Don't go to the bar though. It's nice to look at, but be prepared to pay $13+ for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, well below average club room”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice. Nothing spectacular, but nice and comfy. Pool/gym area was great for downtown city location. Quite impressed. Also was quite impressed with the staff. Often folks in Montreal can be a bit surly. This was not the case at all in the hotel. The location, as many have said is great. The Club Room however, is awful. It is, in itself, a nice room, but if I were paying separately for the club room and was not upgraded to its use, I would find it to be a waste. There were a few snacks that were oh kay at best, below most Club Rooms, and there was no water or grab and go drinks to take to your room. No bottles of water, soda, etc. I understand they may not want waste but it is also extremely cheap to do that. They need to think about the customer that may want to grab and go. Also the Club Room is large but very very outdated. I felt like I was in the parlor of an old aged home. Otherwise, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: QueenVictoriaBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (along with another married couple) stayed at the Le Centre Sheraton for two nights 5/28/11 - 5/30/11. The hotel was very busy and we were unfortunately not able to check at 1:30 pm when we arrived and had to come back at 3 pm. When we returned at 3:30 the line was quite long for check-in and it did take a bit of time to finally reach the front desk. The gentleman informed us that unfortunately the rooms we had been assigned were still occupied and were not ready for us. I explained that this is the second time we've tried to check in and that after driving for 6 hrs to get to Montreal we would really like to be able to get to our rooms as soon as possible. I very nicely asked him that if our rooms weren't ready perhaps he could upgrade us to other rooms. He could not have been nicer and stated that he would like to be able to do that. He then disappeared for a while and returned with happy news for us. We were upgraded to Club Level rooms and received not only the lovliest views but also complimentary access to the club lounge where we could have breakfast and afternoon snacks and soft drinks/coffee/juice. This was the nicest surprise and so much appreciated. The weather this weekend was less than ideal with rain on and off throughout the day, but we were so happy with our rooms and the service we received from the Sheraton we didn't mind it so much. My husband and friend decided to go for a dip in the indoor pool but it was around 6 pm on Sunday afternoon and the pool was full of families with young children splashing around so they didn't. The lobby is beautiful and the location is unbeatable - close to St. Catherine, Sherbrooke and other action-packed streets. We have been to Montreal at least a dozen times before and have stayed in it's many hotels, this one has now moved up to our #1 choice and we'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Last year we stayed at Le Westin Montreal (closer to Old Montreal) and although it's a new property, the service there was just lousy and we'd never go back. I highly recommend the Sheraton, you will not be disappointed if you choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Poor business Centre”
Reviews.Author: goracingguy
Reviews.Content: Was presenting a spe3ecdh at a conference and could not proint at Business Centre (so called). Each person I aslked expressed surprise and no help. Bell desk triec to print and could not....pathetic. Had to take computer to conference and try to print which I luckily did. Feedback to my collegues...avoid thois hotel despite my being a Starwood member.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to a return visit”
Reviews.Author: robert388
Reviews.Content: I can't think of one negative comment. Polite staff, great location, very clean and comfortable rooms. I can't wait to shop for the same type of pillows. Just wish I knew what type they were and the manufacturer. My head never rested so comfortably. I can't think of a place i'd rather stay when visiting this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding, as aways”
Reviews.Author: Cupcakebaker11
Reviews.Content: I stay at Le Centre Sheraton in Monteal at least once a month for work. Every time I am impressed with the service. The check in is friendly and always accommodates my request for a quiet room, the room service is top notch and the people working in the hotel are always friendly and happy. I have never had a bad experience and I have stayed there probably close to 11 times in the past year. I was so impressed by Sheraton that I booked them for my family vacation to California this year! No matter where I travel, I want to stay at Sheraton from now on. -The Montreal hotel is in a great, safe location. Being a woman travelling alone, I do not worry about my safety. There is lots to eat near by and the Eaton Centre is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't adjust room rate when provided government rate”
Reviews.Author: DmansS
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms and provided government id, was told by te front desk they would give us the discount rate, cause the agent was busy, told us they would handle after. Thinking it was taking care off, our bill came and they said they weren't adjusting the bill. The friend staying with us with the government left early morning on flight and the front desk told us that we didn't to c I'd, has they misplaced it. Since the friend had left, they told us too bad. Can't help u or will honour your request. So the staff there was unhelpful and wouldn't reconmnend the hotel due to the poor staff help

Reviews.Title: “Love the pool!”
Reviews.Author: LifeOptimist
Reviews.Content: I'm a Montrealer, but I've stayed here numerous times to rack up Starwood points and have a "Staycation." They have an excellent heated pool, jacuzzi and sauna - all very clean and never crowded. My son is a toddler, but I find the rooms very safe for him and uncluttered. The only thing we have to move out of his reach is the coffee maker. The views from the rooms are superb (though I've only ever stayed on floors higher than 24) and the breakfast lounge offers an even better view of the city. The breakfast is great and service is also. The beds are super comfy. Basically I have nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “not for a traveler with food allergies or on a special diet”
Reviews.Author: jvanderlosk
Reviews.Content: my only negative about this hotel i would have to say is that if you are a traveler with food allergies or special diet needs this might not be the place to stay. in my travels i am almost always able to get a fridge with freezer put in my room or included (usually without an additional fee at other hotels.) not only did i have to pay (i believe $25 a night) for having a fridge put in my room, but it did not include a freezer so i couldn't keep my freezer packs cold, which in turn made it difficult to travel with my food. i asked not only the restaurant at the hotel but also the front desk if they would mind freezing my ice packs overnight so they would be frozen for me the next day, and they both refused. bummer!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay in Montreal either for pleasure or business”
Reviews.Author: chak811
Reviews.Content: Room was clean. Sheets, linen, bath towels changed daily. Nice lounge. Free internet at the lounge. Excellent room service, great breakfast. Cannot ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, I wish i could have stayed for more than a night!”
Reviews.Author: mongreloflove
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel... First of all, the location: Just a few steps away from the bell center and the Bonaventure Metro. The check in was extremely fast and easy. The lobby is really impressive. Then the room... new, comfortable, the view is amazing! Our room was on the 29th floor, we could see the bell center, the city and the mountain. The best part about this hotel has to be the beds and the pillows, most comfortable bed i've ever slept in... I cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location...hidden charges!”
Reviews.Author: dizzygoo82
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean. It was very close to the Bell Centre which was the reason we were in Montreal. There was no free wifi...it was 14.95 a day. There are computers downstairs and you can print up to 4 pages before they start charging you. The day we left our flight wasn't until 7PM. We went to have them hold our bags and they charge 2 bucks a bag!! I thought that was ridiculous but it's worth it to not carry them around all day. Overall it was a nice hotel and the staff was helpful and nice!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Westchestergurl
Reviews.Content: I booked through hotwire and got a 93 dollar a night rate. The room was modern, spacious and had a nice view. I got nervous about peace and quiet when I saw Stanley Cup revelers, a crying infant and 2 dogs get off on my floor, but I could not hear a thing. The pool area/hot tub/sauna area was clean and relaxing. The staff spoke English well, which could be an issue arounf Quebec.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: mjuliennow
Reviews.Content: Stayed over one night on business but was pleasantly surprised. I hadn't been here in about 5/6 years and they have have done a great job renovating it. The rooms are nice, modern and clean. My room had one king bed with a view westward up Rene Levesque Blvd. Check-in was quick and very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Fraudulent Billing!”
Reviews.Author: jaylaw333
Reviews.Content: We received an unpleasant surprise when we received our bill. International calls charged to our room and we never made the calls. The Hotel Manager (Jack I believe) was courteous and professional and waived the fees, however, it took 20 minutes (and a disconnected call) with the front desk to contest the call. No explanation was given for the "mysterious" call made from our room and the fraudulent charges. While no financial harm done, it tainted our view of this hotel and the management as a whole. I would not stay here based on this experience alone. We had a 2 night stay in Montreal. The room we stayed in was very small, however, the bed was very comfortable! The hotel pool and spa was average. Parking at the hotel was $24 and the garage was very unpleasant and a disaster zone. Front desk staff were relatively friendly but very uninformed and added very little value as they did not give us accurate information. Local and 1-800 calls are charged from the room, no Wi-fi provided either and only one pay phone in the hotel located in their basement floor which was not convenient to get to.

Reviews.Title: “I'm conflicted about my stay.....”
Reviews.Author: carmamarie
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the hotel had just had a flood of some sort. They gave me a room key and sent me on my way with the comment of "I don't think this floor is flooded too badly" I got in the elevator and when I stepped off there was 3+ inches of standing water in the carpet outside the elevator. I went back downstairs and they gave me a new room. Went to that room and someone was in ther taking a shower! I went back again and they gave me a 3rd room and from then on the stay was very pleasurabel. So while there were some really grave hiccups it ended well. The resturant near the main lobby the service was really awful. Woman working there threw the food on our table and acted really huffy about everything. Not sure what that was about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to the Bell Centre and St. Catherines. Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Brett6
Reviews.Content: Great location to Bell Centre and shopping. Surrounded by quality restaurants and atmosphere of Montreal. Concierge was absolutely terrfic in assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice perks for conference attendees”
Reviews.Author: tandys_trainer
Reviews.Content: I'm staying here now as part of a professional conference (SRCD). When I arrived, I had an initial negative reaction--the hotel is like 12 blocks away from where the conference is being held. But, there's a free shuttle running at least every half hour, and the hotel is giving conference attendees free wi-fi for our stay--a really lovely gesture. The desk staff and concierge have been top-notch; the wait staff in the bar at night less so. The bar food was only ok--but the rooms are lovely and well appointed, and they make a decent latte in the morning. I'm glad I stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but Nothing to Write Home About”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel2012
Reviews.Content: On arriving into the room at this hotel, I was pleasantly surprised. It appears that there has been a renovation fairly recently, and the rooms were nice! I stayed for 6 or 7 nights with a work colleague. Pros: Nice room decor, clean rooms, central location, good bath products, reasonable price (booked off hotwire). Cons: Dingy hallways, just nothing exceptional in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service, great location”
Reviews.Author: pollack_daniel
Reviews.Content: I was regularly staying at this hotel for business. The location is in downtown Montreal, an easy walk to many restaurants and bars. I found the level of service incredible. The employees went out of their way to make my stay memorable. The rooms were recently renovated and are clean and adequate. The gym could be larger, which is my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice surprise indeed”
Reviews.Author: smokedmeat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night, March 26-27. Reserved one room through Hotwire at the nightly rate of $96 USD. This was not the hotel I was expecting to get (I thought I would be booking the Hotel de la Montagne), so it was a pleasant surprise to get a Sheraton. We arrived at the hotel a couple hours before check-in, but the room was ready for us. Our room (1213) was a smallish corner room with a double bed, high definition TV and a desk. There was also a comfortable chair next to the window giving a north view of Mont Royal and the other buildings in the downtown area. The bathroom was also small, but it was nice and modern. There was a floor heater underneath the sink, which was a pleasant touch. On the down side, there were no towel racks except for the pull-out wire located above the tub. When we left our room to explore the city, we requested for room service to change the linens. However, we noticed it had not been done by the 6 p.m. time that had been promised. Aside from that, all employees that we met were very courteous. We took advantage of the fitness centre located on the sixth floor, which contained a hot tub, swimming pool, sauna and exercise area. It is open from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. and was always staffed whenever we stopped by. Towels were plentiful at the desk. Other users have noted that there is a fee to store bags, and this is definitely the case. We had a couple of hours in the city after check out, so we left a bag with the bellman for a $2 charge. During that time, we watched television in the corner lounge located next to the business centre (with many Internet stations that guests can use for free with an assigned password). The hotel is located one block from the Centre Bell, home of the Montreal Canadiens. It was a Saturday game night when we were there, but we couldn't hear any noise from the street once the fans left following the game. Instead, we heard our loud room neighbours throughout the evening. I always enjoy visiting Montreal, and my experience at Le Centre Sheraton has helped improve that impression. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to have a great stay in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “A nice suprise”
Reviews.Author: meritagebc
Reviews.Content: Finally the last leg of our trip! We booked this one on Hotwire - such a nice suprise to find ourselves in a very central downtown hotel. We were very close to transit - making it super easy to explore Montreal. Check in was very smooth - clerk was friendly and helpful. We found ourselves in a corner room #2421. Two double beds in the room, a great work station, flat screen, modern furnishing (the hotel feels to me about 30 yrs old?), swimming pool, updated bathroom, typical amenities (a real blow dryer - yay!) toiletires etc. The room does get cold from the large windows - but the view was lovely. Room was very clean and service each day was excellent. Sheraton's beds are always comfy & Montreal was no exception. Hotel staff was very friendly and always helpful. Would come back here and recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “best concierge in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: WLB1
Reviews.Content: Maria at the concierge desk was amazingly helpful. She always had interesting ideas about restaurants, and her recommendations turned out to be fantastic. She followed up on every request and was able to get many last minute bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, poor building”
Reviews.Author: Smith029
Reviews.Content: Room standard is quite high, although generally in the wrong places. The room was poorly lit and the large gap below the door made it impossible for a sleepy traveler to ignore noise from the corridor outside. The fitness center is small - the section for weight training can in practice only accommodate one or two persons - but there is also a number of treadmills which were appreciated. For a traveler being used to European hotels, the expensive internet (17 dollars per day) and hidden taxes and extra charges everywhere proved to be a real nuisance. The staff was generally very pleasant, although a bit varying in the breakfast restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value”
Reviews.Author: sah1967
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend who was attending a conference and was disappointed at the following: 1. We had to pay for Internet in the room (the mention of "free wifi" doesn't extend beyond the lobby). 2. Even local and toll-free calls incurred a charge. 3. There was no mini-fridge in the room. 4. The ice machine on our floor (9th) was broken. 5. They do not provide shower caps. Overall, this felt like poor value for money. I've stayed in other hotels for the same price and had a far better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with the perfect location for a Hockey game”
Reviews.Author: Anglefan
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. No worries here. The price is not cheap. $9 for a small bag of potatoe chips says it all.

Reviews.Title: “good stay great service missing a few ammenities”
Reviews.Author: patrick_dumoulin
Reviews.Content: first the check in was fine arrived at 3:30 pm and only took about 5minutes to check in the room was nice great washroom and shower head . I was a litle sad that it did not have a mini fridge in the room to store drinks. The room service was exceptionally fast called for towels and had some up emmidiatly. The workout room was very nice .Also they did make sure to remind us of the time change. /the sweet sleaper bed was very comftarble and room design was nice. Only downpoint really was no mini fridge in the room and the room looked a little dusty.Perfect location downtown for the nightlife and very nice staff

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Same High Quality Worldwide!”
Reviews.Author: Duchesnay
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 days on a business trip and was given a wonderful room with views of the mountain and river. Great new modern decor and very modern bathroom. I always sleep extremely well at a Sheraton hotel - bed and pillows just perfect and heat control worked very well. The restaurant on the main floor was lovely - took in breakfast one day with Starbucks coffee and incredible pastries. Service 1st class - except for charging $2 for checking a bag for a few hours

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lyle29
Reviews.Content: For anyone looking for a place to do business and then relax at the end of the day, this is the place. The Gold Floor lounge is top notch! Lots of room, wonderful atmosphere, well taken care of. I had some of the best sleeps ever on the hotel room beds. I forget the names of them, but they were soooo comfortable. I will be staying there again when I am back in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for events at the Bell Centre”
Reviews.Author: KLM1
Reviews.Content: We got last minute tickets to see Bon Jovi at the Bell Centre. Since we've never visited Montreal, and don't know our way around on the Metro, we wanted to find a hotel close to the Bell Centre. We lucked into a deal at the Sheraton for only $109, plus $24 for parking in the underground garage. The location could not have been better. We walked out the front door, walked one block past a parking lot, and into the front door of the Bell Centre. Room was very nice, and the beds were very comfortable. Nice view from the room. The pool and hot tub looked great. There were lots of people using them in the afternoon. Unfortunately we ran out of time to try them. Free wi-fi in the lobby. Hotel was VERY busy that weekend, but service was very good at check-in, and from the concierge. We were only one block away from Rue Ste Catherine, and all the shops there. I will definitely recommend this hotel to everyone, and especially for people visiting the Bell Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: magentaOttawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Valentine's weekend - rooms were recently updated - everything worked/looked great! Location is PERFECT for shopping/touring around the city. The pool was amazing for a downtown hotel - should have spent more time in the hottub - but then I would have missed seeing the city!

Reviews.Title: “good location, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: j75fr
Reviews.Content: Certainly a hotel I would stay again although it is a place without a soul, you stay there for the location and for a good night rest. Rooms are ok, pretty standard. If you have a good deal, go there! I would describe it as a stay without problems but nothing to remember. Only weakness is the front desk, always packed and pretty impressive waiting times.

Reviews.Title: “The food was AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: cemcgrath
Reviews.Content: We spent superbowl weekend there to watch 2 Montreal Canadiens games. The Bell center is right across the street so we always stay there for the location. We ordered room service both nights and the Dinners were amazing. We reccomend the creme brulee for dessert..and the filet mignon for dinner. We also enjoyed our breakfast downstairs in the cafe. The beds were pretty comfortable and the room was very clean. We stayed on the 35th floor in the club room. The Hotel is pricey, but we have the money and we enjoyed ourselves..we make the trip from NY once every Hockey Season so we don't mind splurging a little bit. The service was great.. Everyone was very friendly. We will be back again next season. There isn't anything worth nit picking about..overall our stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience with warm hospitality & outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: KolkataSelf
Reviews.Content: The services provided, the quality of rooms, the location, the amenities provided were excellent. However, would like the following to be considered, if possible: 1. Provide a simple tea-maker in the room 2. Provide a very simple (with minimum features) Microoven in the room 3. A common smoking place inside the hotel (even in some Airports we find one!!)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing level; of service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: barklrs
Reviews.Content: No mini bar in room, unacceptable presentation of breakfast on a single plate including the toast piled up on the side, also surprised to find no buffet breakfast available, attempt to charge $2 to leave bag with concierge at 08.30 having checked out early for the convenience and advantage of the hotel. Generally not the level of facility and service I would expect from a Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, friendly staff, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: Delco63
Reviews.Content: Location is good - 2 blocks from the train, 2 blocks from the underground shopping. Lots of restaurants within a 5 minute walk. Staff were very friendly, restaurant was good but expensive. Rooms were well appointed, very comfortable beds and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: MarMar-NS
Reviews.Content: Beautifully updated rooms; Full sized ironing board and iron; Safe - but too low to the floor; Up-to-date tv Room bigger than it looks; Bed and bedding - comfy and cozy - no need to bring your own pillow from home; Beautiful view; Very close to Bell Centre; Convenient for walking to St. Catherine's Street.

Reviews.Title: “We were disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sarahmoyal
Reviews.Content: I called The Sheraton in advance to book the room and I asked for two double beds and a cot and was told that there would be no problem. Upon arriving at the Sheraton I was told that this was not allowed and that the price was lowered. Then when checking out the price was not lowered. The inconsistency and the lack of attention to detail is not something that one would expect from the Sheraton. It was New Years and I was distressed by the situation. I am very disappointed in the service and the consistency of this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: hiker99nh
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was nice and the Concierge staff was very helpful. The beds where great as was the bathroom and shower.Great location and close to everything. The only bad thing was papers and soda bottles on the hallway floor and in the elevators left by guests, but being New Years Eve it is partially understandable for the hotel not to be able to keep up with the housekeeping

Reviews.Title: “Not worth four stars - very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Barbarella34
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the new year and were very disapointed. Because we bought our stay with hotwire, they gave us the cheapest smallest room, but for the price we paid it was not so bad. The room had no bathroom fan, so after we both took a morning shower, we couldn't see outside for the rest of the day due to the foggy windows. There is no central air/heat, just a small noisy unit down the window, like in a cheap dated motel. The renovated bathroom was nice, but the bed sheets were of poor quality, with few stains of unknown origins. The location of the hotel is very close to the nightlife... maybe too much because the hotel was full of over-drunk partying kids who screamed down the corridors all the night. There was trash and vomit everywhere and I guess we could have get soned just by the powerfull smell of weed floating throughout the hotel! So if tou want a nice romantic stay, it's definitly not the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was hotwire's choice”
Reviews.Author: gatine
Reviews.Content: Booked a very affordable night here on the web so keep in mind the room I got probably was their cheapest.... The hotel is nice. We arrived late and left early enough so I didn't see a lot of the facilities. The room was quite small but had a beautiful view from the 34th floor and was tastefully furnished. The bathroom was also very small. Quiet, we didn't hear any neighbours. We enjoyed the Starbucks coffees in the morning. Internet in rooms in pricey though their business center is great, and free. They said at the desk they provide 45 minutes free each day, the computer said 1 hour and me thinks it's pretty much unlimited as I'm not sure how they would even control that, with the computers or wifi not prompting for access. The only weird thing about this hotel is they charged me for parking even though I never entered their lot. When I arrived, I did ask the front desk about parking fees but I also mentioned looking into the many private parking spaces all around. The parking was on my bill the next day and when I asked why, I was told probably 'because I asked about it'. You need a more thorough system Sheraton...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, Great location, bit noisy though”
Reviews.Author: JonnyCanuck99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a solo trip to montreal in November 2010. I got the room through hotwire so the price was great, but I would have been a bit disappointed in the hotel if I paid full price. The staff were very professional and curtius, the hotel was modern and clean, the room was very nice with a marble bathroom and a very comfortable bed. The whole thing was great but from my room I could hear everything going on in the hallways, a little more than I should have been able to. The cleaning staff started very early in the morning in rooms right next to mine and noise came in through the door. Overall though I'd recommend this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place, though it could use a refresh”
Reviews.Author: GoLeafsGo0907
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in September 2010 using starwood points. Hotel is located right near the central train station, which was helpful for us. It's in the south/business area of downtown, just a few blocks of St Catherine street (the main east-west street running through downtown). Most of the things to see/do will be east/northeast towards St Laurent street and Old Montreal area is also nearby. With its location downtown, the only real view was other skyscrapers but that was fine. Hotel itself was fine. It's definitely not the newest or nicest, but it is conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mdefano
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is in a great location - downtown Montreal. Within walking distance to so much - even in December. Staff was great and the room was very clean and comfortable. My only complaint is there isn't free WIFI in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Excellent Sheraton.”
Reviews.Author: MTLSteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here after having won a free night at the hotel at an office holiday function. Despite the room being a "freebie", we were given excellent service at all stages, from reservation to check-out. Upon check-in we were informed that we would have a room on the 31st floor. Beautiful view. The room was very large, with 1 king bed. The hotel has recently undergone a major renovation and inside the rooms there were very few signs of its previous life. Everything was redone, from carpets to wall coverings to most of the furniture, the decor, artwork, bathroom, etc. High quality finishings, all Kohler hardware in the bathroom, with nice marble floors. Large flat-screen tv (I'd say it was 42-inch, definitely large for a hotel room), lots of channels in english and french. Decor was really nice, and closely resembles what is shown on their website. We could occasionaly hear noise from other rooms or the hallway, but even as a fairly light sleeper this did not keep me from sleeping perfectly soundly, in what was an extremely comfortable bed with great sheets. When we came in from dinner, we found a tray with a bottle of sparkling water and chocolate-covered almonds, compliments of the general manager. A nice touch considering we weren't even revenue-generating guests :) Definitely built up some additional Sheraton goodwill! Location is central for both business and leisure. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation to both business and leisure travelers. Without being over the top, this is a modern, clean, friendly, and comfortable hotel. Among the better and more luxurious Sheratons I have ever stayed at. Excellent job with the renovations!

Reviews.Title: “loss of Sleep”
Reviews.Author: 780Edmonton
Reviews.Content: Everything was great except for the street noise which interrupted my sleep both nights.

Reviews.Title: “We love Montreal”
Reviews.Author: futureeastcoaster
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent staff, close to everything, easy check-in check-out. Very enjoyable stay, again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant atmosphere, relaxing"”
Reviews.Author: KansasQuebec
Reviews.Content: We had one small mix up with towels needing exchanged. It took two calls to straighten things out ... a bit annoying, but the hotel was so great. Would have liked to have free internet in the room ... a real downer. We loved the bar's atmosphere and the rapid check-in and check-out. The hotel is also so close to great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming property”
Reviews.Author: rxty
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, great lobby/internet area. Excellent meeting space.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SL123080
Reviews.Content: I found the rooms very spacious, loved the bed and pillows. Best sleep in a long time. Very quiet. Very friendly staff. Food was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel beautiful in appearance, lots of small mechanical issues, service at front desk a disaster, poor hotel processes”
Reviews.Author: 154996Reviews
Reviews.Content: Consistent training of front desk staff needs to be a priority in policies, procedures and how to work less mechanically with guests. Also having enough on hand to handle lineups. Bellman & Concerige need effectiveness training. When promises are made, live up to them. Surprised at poor quality in rooms: Shower did not work, sink drain would not work, TV controllers a real issue to use (Must be direct in front of TV for them to work). Charging for internet not a fan of. Delta provides me with free internet in MTL. Parking garage personnel great to work with!!! Maids always pleasant. Great location and hotel designed well. Beds great.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic getaway for a short weekend, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: JCSCMS
Reviews.Content: Gym facilities are great along with the pool and hot tub facilities. Wonderful bar/lounge area for coffee, hot chocolate, breakfast pastries and 2 TVs for sports watching.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly ok--- not great by any stretch”
Reviews.Author: ordinarymind
Reviews.Content: I should say at the outset that I am not a big fan of "chain hotels." They do have their advantages--- if you are coming into a city that you don't know well, you are reasonably likely to be ok at a Hilton or Sharaton or whatever. I should also say that I tend to view the Sheraton chain itself as old and tired; my parents stayed there in the 60s and it seems like it's still the 60s in Sheraton land. We stayed at the Sheraton Montreal for a business meeting. It was a large group (I am the supportive spouse here so i didn't attend the business meetings) and it looks as if the Sheraton staff did a good job on this, and the facility is ok for a large meeting (in a dull 60s sort of way). Several aspects of this hotel are pleasant. There is a large and friendly bar on the ground floor level, and all of the coffee stuff was Starbucks, so pretty good. Sheraton has added a smallish, "hip" business center hangout adjacent to the bar, with a few computers etc., so that was useful (but crowded). The gym and pool were good. The rooms seem to have been redone in the past few years but still seem dated-- an old room with some new stuff. There is a coffee maker that makes Starbucks coffee in the room. No robes or other spiffy stuff. The bed struck me as soft-ish (I have a bit of a sensitive back, so it may not be a problem for you). The food in restaurants was predictable, relatively bland and a bit expensive. So, what I would say is that there are probably 20 more interesting places to stay in Montreal--- there are a bunch of boutique-y small hotels in the old part of town, and several more interesting looking chains. If you have to be at the Sheraton becuase of a business event, you'll be ok; if you can get a really good price (we paid about $190/night as a group rate), then fine, but otherwise, I'd go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “My once a month consistant lodging!!”
Reviews.Author: CurtainJumper
Reviews.Content: I visit Montreal once a month for a three night stay for business. What I enjoy the most about the Sheraton Centre-Ville is the consistant quality of service I've become accustomed to. I've been staying at this Sheraton now for over 4 years and even during the renovations I had a pleasant stay. The people are awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “really nice stay...”
Reviews.Author: Flipje67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights for a convention in the hotel itself and was generally very impressed. Lucked out with a room on a high SPG floor with nice views over the city. Room was a decent size and pretty standard Sheraton king - ie, nice neutral decoration, well furnished and very well maintained and very clean. Good set up for business travellers with plenty of sockets at the desk including a 5v USB power supply to charge mobile/Blackberry etc. Found the staff to be very helpful - also during the meeting itself with coffee and lunch breaks very efficiently handled. Great support when I needed a screw-driver to fix something. Great sized swimming pool - a real bonus since hotel pools tend to be poky and not worth a swim. Conference rate was fair - not cheap but I'd say good value for money given overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “this is a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_from_Toronto
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for the 3rd time this year. The location is good, the service is great and the rooms are lean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: arthur111
Reviews.Content: Updated and beautiful. The location was perfect for walking to Old Montreal or St. Catherine, etc. Staff very helpful to some extra requests. Lovely pool.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel. Central location. Small inconveniences.”
Reviews.Author: rjoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because the conference I was attending was there. I was travelling with a colleague, so I was pleased to see the room we were in was large enough to share. The beds were very comfortable, room very clean. We did notice that although we were on the 29th floor, we could hear a lot of outside noise, sirens and vehicles, mostly. The hotel bar was a nice quiet place, but the food was quite expensive for what it was (arrived in evening, didn't want to go out to eat). I'd expect a hotel of this size to have more choice. One big complaint-the wi fi is expensive-and only works for the room you are in. Someone in my seminar had paid for the day, but could not access it in the conference room without incurring another $15 charge. This is a big inconvenience if you are attending a conference. Luggage storage for early check out also cost $2 a bag. I've stayed in many hotels that include things like this with no charge. These may seem like small things, but would probably make the difference in my choice to stay again. I would still recommend the hotel, but would let people know nothing is for free at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably OK”
Reviews.Author: ek_mk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located, and a reasonable value for the price. The facility looks like it could use a "facelift" and the club floor facility is very average. The brakfast served there is exactly the same every day and food quality is average. Good selection of fruits. The snacks in the evenig - below average and the cost of drink very high (many club floors elswhere offer the drinks for free during certain hours)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: DrMDZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an excellent stay at your hotel. The room, the service and the food were top notch. I could not have asked for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssstravel39
Reviews.Content: loved the beds, fast elevator. Plenty of restaurants nearby, close to transportation and easy to walk around. Safe environment.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic weekend in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: MontrealLover017
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love to do a sports weekend annually in Montreal. Hockey and Football in that city is a true passion. We have always stayed at the Sheraton on Rene Levesque and love the Hotel. The staff bend over backward to ensure that you have a wonderful stay. Whether we stay in a traditional room or are lucky enough to get upgraded, the rooms are beautiful. well maintained and the staff wonderful. My favourite hotel for a sport weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but deserves a 3.5 rating”
Reviews.Author: davidplustanya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in April 2010 over Easter Weekend. Didn`t think the service at the front desk was that great, and they messed up my reservation. Fortunately it got fixed, but we ended up with what must have been one of the smallest rooms in the hotel. I confirmed this by looking at the fire escape blue print on the door. Room was updated and clean, just really really small. Perhaps the strangest thing about our stay is how three or four times other people tried to come into our room because they were assigned it after checking in, It as almost as if the hotel was triple or quaduple booking our room. The hotel is in a good location, pretty much in the heart of downtown. Shopping centers and places to eat are a few minutes away. A positive was the pool, on the other hand fitness center was surprisngly old (compared to some hotels). Staff at the pool and fitness center was very good however. Although I would recommend the Sheraton, there are other hotels I would recommend over it (Hilton Garden Inn!). I consider this a good but not great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Frenchybabe
Reviews.Content: The "make a green choice" program is great. However, there is one little problem with the program. You are not eligible for the $5 coupon on the 4th consecutive night. This is my problem, your letter indicates: "should you still decide not to have your room cleaned today, kindly place the "do not disturb" sign on the door knob." I have not placed the "do not disturb sign " on the door knob and my room did not get cleaned. This happened on 2 occasions. I feel that if you don't clean the room, you should be eligible to the $5 coupon.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent service - good location”
Reviews.Author: deapackedandready
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights during the conference mentioned by others. I had a colleague with me and had reserved a Club Level room with 2 beds. The room was smaller than I anticipated, but functional. The recent renovation is a real mixed blessing. The beds were good and, if you fancy lots of fluffy pillows, you're in luck. For some reason known only to the designers, the bathrooms have no towel bars. There is one towel ring for a hand towel, but nothing else. When I inquired of Guest Services, I was told that I should just call Housekeeping and someone would be right there to whisk away the used towels. That's just ridiculous in this era of conservation and cost-cutting. I was also very disappointed with the Club Lounge overall. It is a large, pleasant room with excellent views. The breakfast was just fine. However, the service was not worth the extra fee; the "butler" was overworked apparently; running in all directions, and barely civil. I needed a few pages printed from the computer in the lounge one morning; the printer was not working, and there was no staff on the floor except the butler. I asked him for assistance. He snapped, "I'm just a waiter". I found a phone and called Guest Services who sent someone up to help. He could not solve the problem, but took my USB key to his office to print the documents. This took far longer than necessary. Another big surprise in the Club Lounge was that there were no complimentary beverages at hours other than breakfast. No coffee, no water, no juice during the day. So, if one wanted to use it between breakfast and cocktails for any kind of gathering, you were on your own. And, at the cocktail hour, they served modest appetizers and no complimentary beverages. Wine and cocktails were charged at very high prices. Most (probably all) Club Floor Lounges that I've stayed at around the world have at least complimentary house wine for a couple of hours in the evening. I get the feeling that at this hotel, nothing goes uncharged. I used the internet connection in our room for the outrageous daily fee. My roommate took her laptop to the lounge because the website proclaimed that wireless was free in the lounges. Not so fast! She reported that she could not sign on without incurring the daily fee. Needing to get work done, she went ahead. So, for that particular day, we were charged nearly $35 for internet connection. The next day, I went to the SPG desk to protest. After too much discussion, the clerk agreed to remove the 2nd charge. This was another example of lack of clarity in guest information. The website clearly touts free internet access in the two lounges. There was no information in our room about the hours of service in the Club Lounge despite assurances that we were indeed on a Club Floor. when I finally found a card with Club Lounge hours (up in the Lounge), it said that the Lounge was open until noon on Sunday. But, on Sunday, I could not access the Lounge at 11am to print a boarding pass. The concierge desk told me that the Lounge closes at 10am on Sunday. Another surprise for a large downtown hotel was that they do not have 24 hr room service. We arrived late the first night and would have liked something to eat in our room or the Club Lounge. On Friday of our stay, it rained hard in Montreal. When we went to the room after lunch, someone had been in and set up an ice bucket under a water leak in our bay window. We were amazed at the amount of water coming in; towels had been put at the window sill and the wallpaper was coming off. We needed a nap and were sound asleep when the front desk called to say that someone in our room had requested to move and were we ready now? Actually, we were sleeping, Thanks anyway. We emptied the bucket and went back to sleep. When the leak had not abated, we took them up on the offer to move.....and the front desk was going to send a bottle of white wine to our room. I got keys from the SPG desk and we moved our things to the designated room. It was a room with one bed -- and there were two of us. We called the front desk - no answer after many many rings. I went down again and had to be agressive on queue because the SPG desk was not staffed and I didn't want to wait forever to correct their mistake. We were once more reassigned and promised a bottle of white wine for our trouble. Back up the elevators; move to the third room; this looked fine. We quickly unpacked and got ready for our evening function. The doorbell rang and there was a waiter with a bottle of red wine! At that point, what could one do but laugh? If this had not been the conference hotel, I doubt I would have stayed here - or I surely would not have stayed 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay a Le Centre”
Reviews.Author: pks2000
