Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in mid-October; eight women had four rooms. We were pleased that we had all adjoining rooms that had been beautifully refurbished since our last visit four years ago. Very contemporary decor, clean with nice updating in the bathroom: vanity with shelves underneath to store items as well as a mounted magnifying mirror. The location is excellent, only a block from St. Catherine St. as well as the underground at Ville Marie Place. We booked very early and got the great "pay your birthday" rate. Even with the Canadian tax and almost even exchange rate (we are from the US), this was a good value. Drawbacks were no free internet in rooms (only in lobby), and very high prices in the restaurant....no problem as Chez Cora is close for breakfast. We all love the pool area with hot tub and the availability of massages on site. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very enjoyable weekend at the Sheraton Centre.”
Reviews.Author: Baron65
Reviews.Content: We had two small items that were bothersome. One was the water pressure in the bathroom sink, that spray nozzle was not efficient and two was the noisy air conditioner unit in 3409, The Club lounge was outstanding for service, food quality, decor, and view.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointing Stay:(”
Reviews.Author: SKSC
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd review I've written about Le Centre Sheraton. As stated in previous reviews, we've been staying exclusively at this hotel for 25 years (as recent as July 2010). This time it was very different, and frankly disappointing. When we arrived, as SPG gold members, we received a small upgrade (from 2 queens to 1 king) but we didn't get the Club Floor as requested as they told me the hotel was sold out for the night. The clerk at the desk put a flag on our account and promised an upgrade to Club Floor if we checked in the following morning between 9 and 10. We did, and they accomodated us on the 34th floor. We had to move ourselves and we weren't even offered any help (I found this very strange as this has happened before, and previously they have offered to move our things for us when we were out for the day). The front desk clerk looked at me and said "can you move yourself NOW!?. Most abrupt! The rooms have been renovated and were lovely. The view of Mont Royal with its fall colours was breathtaking. That's about it for the good stuff. The night of the room change we went out to a new untried restaurant and had a VERY DIFFICULT TIME with the servers. We looked forward to returning to the hotel and going for a swim. When we arrived at the room and turned on the light, low and behold we had a guest scurrying around--a cockroach! YIKES! My husband killed it, put it in a kleenex and proceeded to take it to show at the front desk. Most unsettled after the problems at the restaurant and now a cockroach, I got my swim suit on and headed for the pool. When I got there there was no one in the pool (good). When I entered the pool, I noticed there was quite a bit of white "stuff" floating on the top of the water and also laying on the bottom of the pool. I quickly got out and told the pool attendant. He came and looked and told me that someone?! had probably brought their baby into the pool with a 'regular' diaper, which exploded! He started to clean the "stuff" out of the pool but I was so grossed out by this time. I just left in tears (what a terrible nite!) My husband spoke to the Manager on duty that nite and she called the room to apologize and offer us free parking for 2 out of the 3 days we were there, also offered was a full breakfast for 2 for our last 2 mornings, and she took a restaurant charge off our bill. I very much appreciated that she called and the freebiess she offered. She seemed genuinue enough...but cockroaches on a Club Floor? "Stuff" in the pool? and nobody noticed? When I checked out, the clerk at the desk didn't even ask us how our stay was...most unusual. I will stay at this hotel again, cuz one bad experience in all these years does not undo all the good. I was rather disappointed. The front desk people should work on their "charms".

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Impressions”
Reviews.Author: TakaMorgan
Reviews.Content: Staff seemed impatient/haughty. Concierge - Marie particularly - very informed/helpful Room ok - desk lamp never worked even tho reported to front desk - no lamp at only comfortable table in room Fitness center outdated - poor equipment - staff never seemed to know hours of operation Breakfast much too expensive - $20 for eggs/bacon/toast $$$$

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: SSmith4345
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is very busy, the rooms are quiet. Great views at the city and very comfortable beds. Nice bar and restaurant. Good location. I would revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Never staying at Sheraton again!!”
Reviews.Author: ReptileKings
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst hotel experience ever! Extremely over priced for what they offer! They don't tell you parking is extra on the phone until you get there, and then it's $23/day. Valet is $30. The washroom in the room was the worst. It had extremely LOW PRESSURE in the sink, and absolutely NOOOO hot water!!!! The last thing you want when you wake up slightly cold in the morning, is to wash up in a sink with nothing but COLD water! I couldn't even shave due to the very cold water for my 2 1/2 days stay there. By the second day of my stay there, at the conference I was attending, I looked terrible since I couldn't shave. The shower also had very low pressure, and the bathtub's drain was clogged, so it was like i was swimming in it. I felt more dirty getting out of it than going in! The pillows on the bed were so damn fluffy and full of air that I felt like my head was drowning in it ALL NIGHT. I didn't sleep more than one hour and I had to be up early next day at 6am to get ready for the conference on no sleep. I called the following day for thicker pillows as I had to get at least some sleep for next days conference, and they had NONE to offer!! When I went to use the phone for food delivery, they later charged me for that on my bill. It was local calling!! What's the $5 charge for? They should make a note of that on the phone so you know there'd be a charge if you use it. I could've simply used my cell phone and paid less! They advertise that they offer hi-speed internet, and once you get there, they tell you it's extra/night stay. Are you kidding me??? Even motels offer free wi-fi and they charge a lot less. Give me a break! Thank goodness I brought my internet stick. Two days stay there was a little over $600 and it was the worst experience I've EVER had and I've stayed at a LOT of hotels. The Hilton far outbeats this crappy establishment. I also enjoy Holiday Inn Express much more than this place. Much better rates, and you get more for your buck! Think twice before going to this place. You'll regret it if you do! I've already told my experience to all my peers, as I don't think this place deserves anyones buck!

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: ToniBevSmith
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! Just when I thought customer service was dead, I had the pleasure...the EXTREME pleasure of dealing with the Centre Sheraton in Montreal. I usually frequent this hotel once a year, however, would LOVE to stay more than once. Two years ago, prior to their incredible renovations, I stayed there on a weekend that was mainly to lose myself, clear my mind of all things that ailed me, shortly after my father had undergone treatment and hospitalization for cancer. After months of taking care of him, getting a clean bill of health, I decided to escape to Montreal and chose the Sheraton as my landing place. After an uncomfortable sleep in a bed, I came home and sent an email to the hotel explaining the issue I had with the bed (they tried to accomodate me at the time by switching my room) and a few other minor things (I STRESS that they were undergoing renovations at the time) and was called back within MINUTES by a lovely woman by the name of Marie Robillard, on behalf of the hotels' GM, Michel Giguere. Ms. Robillard was very concerned at the fact that I, little old me, did not have a wonderful experience in the hotel. She went out of her way to accomodate me on my next visit, making me feel as though I were royalty or worthy of some special, high-end treatment. The weekend that I went back was, not only incredibly amazing, but left me with the desire NOT TO GO HOME!!! As a business owner, my husband prides himself on customer service and, to this day, still talks about Ms. Robillard and Mr. Giguere and their willingness to please their clients and the extent they went to make it happen. This year, I chose to stay at the Centre Sheraton again, even after I had an opportunity to pay much less at the Fairmont through a friend who works with that particular hotel. I opted out of the lesser deal with the Fairmont and stayed loyal to the hotel that catered to my every whim. Once again, we had the most beautiful room, the most amazing view of the city, and cleanliness and service that was above anything else. I had been so bold as to call Ms. Robillard to tell her that I was coming for a romantic getaway with my husband and, upon entering the room, were greeted with a beautiful bottle of wine and a lovely cheese/fruit tray from Mr. Giguere and Ms. Robillard. Talk about stellar customer service. From the concierge, to the check-in clerk, to the cleaning staff, there is no comparison to the impeccable level of customer satisfaction and service (and I have stayed at NUMEROUS hotels). I highly recommend the Centre Sheraton in Montreal. It is beautifully maintained, close to everything you could want, and is blessed with wonderful people who work their and are working FOR YOU. For me, it is MY hotel in Montreal and I would never even consider staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well-priced, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: bgarrand
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed IWF conference here in Montreal. Club accommodations especially nice. Lovely room, comfortable bed and club lounge gracious and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “really nice”
Reviews.Author: ide05
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 days on sheraton on 31st floor wao what a view to the mountains, very clean rooms, good service, delicius breakfast, and good room service, big tvs if you wanna just say in the room, the bed are very comfortable is close to everything, and very clean bathrooms, didnt complain about nothing on my stay

Reviews.Title: “IWF Canadian Conference 2010”
Reviews.Author: JoanFisk_10
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Le Centre Montreal hosted the International Women's Forum World Leadership Conference, Oct 13-15, 2010 There were over 750 Women Leaders, from 40 countries, and many guests that converged on the Hotel. The staff was friendly, helpful and professional. It was a very good display of Canadian Hospitality and quality accomodation. I would highly recommend a conference in this facility. Well done. JOAN FISK

Reviews.Title: “Valet?”
Reviews.Author: Sactown_Girl37
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel each time I come to Montreal, but I might go with another hotel on my next visit. The hotel itself is fine with comfortable rooms and a nice location, but the service isn't as great as other Sheratons. The valet(s) would stand there and watch me load/unload my trunk without offering to help, and it often took a couple of minutes to even get their attention to come take my car.

Reviews.Title: “Location is of utmost importance!”
Reviews.Author: mrshen56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed for two nights, October 8 and 9th; we came in by via rail so were entitled to an "upgraded room" which we received (and of which was very comfortable); however I had "requested" a late checkout on Sunday, the 10th as our train was not leaving until 6:30 pm; I was told the latest check out was "2 pm", otherwise we would be charged. If you check your "upgrade with via rail" you will note that "late checkout is offered until 4 pm"; however even after giving my room #822, the attendant was very firm with the "2 pm" checkout. Please bring your staff up to date on these issues. Also charging for "bag storage"? Please give me a break! Wendy and Jim Henwood

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Cowgirl5
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at the Sheraton. The staff was wonderful and answered every question that we had. The room was spacious and lived up to my expectation of a Starwoods property. We went during Jazz Festival and the location was perfect ... not too far .. not too close. The walk to all of the events was approx 5-10 minutes. I like the lobby and there is a section with computers for free use. Starbuck's coffee is sold on site. The hotel combined with the staff makes the property a perfect stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in the heart of Montreal. But expensive.”
Reviews.Author: macdaddyWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Room was beautiful and immaculate, service was friendly. My only complaint was the noise from the plumbing would wake me up - strange gurgling sounds. Also, continental breakfast of coffee, oj and a muffing was $16. Wha? I had to check out of the hotel at noon, but was in a meeting until 4:00 so I checked my luggage. This is the first hotel that I've been to that charges to store luggage. However, all in all a gorgeous hotel a block from st. catharine's avenue and all the best shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: phladun
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights paying a conference rate of $219 plus taxes for a total of $256 per night. On the second and third nights, I was joined by my husband and 1.5 year old child. This hotel is in an excellent location in central Montreal. That pretty much sums up the positive aspects of this hotel. It didn't look like it had been updated recently however, the bathroom was in decent condition and had a long countertop. And now, the negatives: -the room was teeny tiny and barely fit two queen beds. -there was a musty smell upon entering. -as the room was a very basic hotel room, it was way way way overpriced. -the restaurant was horrendously overpriced. As we had a child and didn't want to search out restaurants, my husband went down to grab a sandwich ($18) and a glass of wine ($15). Yes, it was a mistake. -the TV remote barely worked. It took about 5 seconds to flip channels. -there was a huge mirror on the wall and I mean wall-sized huge. This isn't really a negative (and it was probably there to make the teeny tiny room look more spacious) but I found it a little irritating to constantly see myself. -parking was approximately $20/day plus tax. I know this is an irrational complaint given the hotel was downtown however, it was just one more annoyance to add to the list. I sure it would be easy to find cheaper, yet nicer, hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “eccellent location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: larry90
Reviews.Content: i am a repeat customer and very pleased and will definately return on my next stay. excellent rooms,service,staff,location and a fair and competive plice

Reviews.Title: “Good place, great location”
Reviews.Author: tzanoni
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view from our room. Good room, LCD TV 40".Good bathroom. Good location in town, near by the most importants places of commerce. Not far from metro system and Mc Gill University.

Reviews.Title: “staff is excellent, rooms are fantastic, view spectacular”
Reviews.Author: trips_are_my_passion
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights the hotel was booked but you would never know it with the service. The pool and hot tub are very cleaned and managed well. We used them both nights. My husband loved the Sauna. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Sandy12_10
Reviews.Content: Would be helpful to provide bathrobes. Appreciated the ability to connect to internet for free in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sarahgina
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! it was right on main street and walking distance from EVERYTHING! nothing to special about it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for holidaymakers”
Reviews.Author: Chattyboo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a perfect location and rooms were very comfortable, clean with modern decor. Within walking distance of Old Montreal and shops and restaurants. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBrummie
Reviews.Content: The room was not cleaned very well. The dust on the TV stand was so thick I wrote in it and you could read it. There was a hair clip on the floor from a previous guest, so when did they last vacum the carpet. A waitress at breakfast over filled my coffee cup so much it filled the cup, saucer, and ran onto the table, instead of just taking it away she mopped the saucer up with a cloth she was using to wipe tables which left a hair on the saucer, she then tipped some of the coffee out of the cup and with a "sorry madame" walked off. No body seemed to care about service at all.

Reviews.Title: “"I've found yet another place to call...”
Reviews.Author: Gregorna
Reviews.Content: "I've found yet another place to call home... My stay will forever be REMEMBERED! This property is everything I was looking for and more."

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but overpriced, rooms small, service iffy”
Reviews.Author: jobeansyUK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for location to shops, and conference centres etc, however, they had lost my reservation on arrival, and initially appeared not to want to deal with this. I was offered an alternative room, but it was very small, certainly less than $199 a night. Also my check out dates were wrong, and I was badgered to leave the room even though I had a day left. Bed very comfy however. Overall OK but there are better value hotels within walking distance with better service

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular View”
Reviews.Author: ony-tay_udie-ray
Reviews.Content: I had a nice room on the 24th floor facing south, with a view of Canal Lachine and the river and even the mountains of Vermont. But really, in this day and age, it's galling when a hotel tries to charge $16/day (including tax) for internet access in your room. Ugly.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility, bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: greenajax
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, rooms are clean and modern. Nice view of the city. Heart of downtown Montreal, near everything. The one thing that was a bit of a let down was the customer service. Not very helpfull or friendly at check in or check out. All 3 front desk staff taht we spoke to on different occasions came off with a little attitude and not very riendly. Not what I expected from the Sheraton. Overall the hotel is alright.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect holiday!!!”
Reviews.Author: robertomoises
Reviews.Content: I really recomend this hotel....beautifull roomy rooms, great service. All great the only but would be the noise of the mechanical parts of the elevetors...We stay at floor 36 on the south side of the hotel...up to us was the elevator mechanical room...it was no nice and easy to sleep listening at night all the noise from going up and down the elevetors...everything else. 5 start top noch...great place I will be back there. Great for kids....really excelent holiday week.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - only 3 stars, they maximize their profits”
Reviews.Author: Tweety021
Reviews.Content: - Good location for tourism and business - The rooms are clean, the beds rather small - Breakfast is very common and overpriced; they dont know the difference between scrambled eggs and omelet ... - The waitress in the bar was unfriendly andwith an air of superiority. - No minibar/fridge in the rooms. - WiFi should be free and avaibalble for all users in all rooms.; the free( ??) internet in the lobby has a very very poor capacity. - When you book a room for 3 you expect to have everything for 3 persons in the bathroom. We had to ask a 3th bath towel; we got 1small bottle of shampoo and no bath-douche soap - As we were flying home tot Europe in the evening and the check-out is at 12 o'clock, we asked to keep the luggage for a few hours. We have been in a lot of hotels over the world (2 --> 5 stars) and they never asked a fee for this service (only the tip). Here we had to pay 12dollars for 3 bags during 3 hours. UNACCEPTABLE !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: cpack
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton over Labor day weekend. We booked a great rate through priceline. The first night our neighbors woke us up at 4 in the morning to music and talking. We called the front desk who were partially able to quiet them down. The next morning we voiced our complaint to the front desk and they gave us free breakfast for the next two days. It made us happy. That night we had turn down service, but they left no chocolates which in my opinion puts the icing on the cake after coming back from a night out. The next night we asked about the chocolates, and we were told that the hotel stopped giving them out, however when we came back to the room the hotel left us two cadbury chocolate bars. Between the complimentary breakfasts and the chocolate bars, our hotel stay was greatly improved. Those little gestures really add up and means a lot to us. In terms of the hotel, it is your standard upscale business hotel. The hot tub and the gym were nice, but what is best is the location. It is right in the action of everything. All in all a great vacation. I would reccomend this hotel for business and or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, excellent rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Nancy178
Reviews.Content: Le Centre Sheraton is my home away from home in Montreal while my daughter is at university close by. Things I like - Location is central to shopping, restaurants, train station and the university. The rooms are very nice. Comfy beds, electrical outlets in reasonable places, wireless internet (for a fee). The Club Salon is worth an extra $30 but not worth double room rates. I always ask for Club if there is a promotion going on. It's so nice to have a place to start and end the day, with free internet too. The staff are very service oriented. Check-in is fast. Things I don't like - I've had enough issues with the quality of food and drink via room service that I only use it as a last resort now. I have a beef with ALL hotels that charge extra for internet. Wireless internet should be integrated with the price for the room and available to multiple users in the room at the same time. Paying for internet reminds me of old motels in the 60's where we had to put quarters in a slot on the TV to make it run for an hour. Hotels should get with the times and make internet a standard feature in their rooms - like TV's, showers, desks are. I've stayed in Le Sheraton Centre 6 times in the past year. Some were emergency stays with short notice and undetermined departure date. They accommodated me beautifully each time. It really is starting to feel like a HOME away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: rockyviewmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on Jul 5, 2010 with safeway tours. Nothing outstanding but its location. It is very close to Sainte-Catherine Street . Walked to Rebuen's deli. Free WiFi in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Big City Property What You See Is What You Get”
Reviews.Author: TravelCheapskate
Reviews.Content: Got this on Priceline for a below than expected price for a weekend one day stay. This is a very large convention type property and a solid business type hotel. Nothing memorable, either good or bad. It is exactly what you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but nothing too special”
Reviews.Author: GWSD
Reviews.Content: I had a bad start to my stay, because even though I had both booked a club room and confirmed that with the hotel the week before I arrived, they did not show my reservation as being for a club room. I eventually got (most of) the benefits of the club level, but it was fairly annoying to have to deal with this upon check-in. The staff were friendly enough, and they did give me some drink and food coupons to assuage me. The hotel was fine. It has a nice pool and decent, but very cramped, fitness center. The location is good for both business and tourism. The room I had was clean and decent, but pretty plain. Overall, the hotel is ok, but given the other good hotels in the area, it's hard to imagine that there aren't better choices available.

Reviews.Title: “Not really deserving of the Sheraton name”
Reviews.Author: Smashing2
Reviews.Content: Located in downtown Montreal, Le Centre Sheraton Montreal is about a ten minute walk from the Peel metro station and a five minute walk from the shopping on Rue Saint Catherine Ouest and restaurants of Rue Crescent. This sounds like a good thing, but that's about all there is in the area. The hotel restaurant, like all chain hotel properties, not only is way overpriced but also has odd hours. I think 7am-2pm. Perhaps the Sheraton assumes that none of their guests will dine in. The lobby cafe/bar is beautiful, but it's not an all out restaurant to get a full meal. Plenty of restaurants are ten to fifteen minutes away, but for inexpensive eats you'll have to rely on fast food chains. In fact, if you're ever starving for a quick bite to eat, the nearest thing would be the gas station convenience store just over a block away. My hotel room was quite dated. It was obvious that the room hasn't been vacuumed as there was noticeable hair in the bathroom and carpets. I was disappointed to see just one complimentary bottle of water. My room didn't have a fridge/minibar so storing food and drinks wasn't possible, and one of the lamps didn't work. The complimentary soaps and gels were pretty low quality. I almost always use the in-room amenities for convenience, but in this case I did regret that I didn't bring my own. At least the Starwood heavenly bed was as comfortable as always and the TV channel selection was plentiful. The fitness centre is quite small and dated, but the indoor pool and hot tub are good places to relax. Wifi is freely available in the business centre and the Sheraton also provides workstation terminals for guests to access the internet. They'll tell you that wifi is available in the lobby, but the truth is the signal strength is pretty poor if you're even just outside the business centre. Wired and wifi in-room is available for a ridiculous $17/day. What's the point of this when it's free downstairs? This tends to be a problem among every Starwood property that I've stayed in. I wouldn't stay here again because there's nothing in the immediate area (within a five minute walk) in terms of easy food options or availability, but if that's not an issue for you then it's location downtown is pretty convenient. On the plus side, the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Except that on a rainy morning they didn't have any umbrellas available. This hotel doesn't really deserve the Sheraton brand. Isn't Sheraton supposed to be Starwood's luxury flagship? I read an article recently saying that the Sheraton is a brand in decline and Le Centre Sheraton Montreal certainly reflects that. The service is still (mostly) there, but everything else in this building needs to be redone.

Reviews.Title: “Typical convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ben_Most_Everywhere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at Le Centre Sheraton for a convention. It was typical of this type of hotel--nicely appointed, but expensive and not many complimentary ammenities. As others have noted, wifi access is an extra charge. Colleagues staying at other comparable nearby hotels had free wifi. We were on a upper floor and had a marvelous view, but the inside of the window could have used a good cleaning. However, the pool and spa were nice after a day of meetings. We used the Metro to get around and it was only about a 10 minute walk to the nearest station. (Although the nearby Marriott Place du Canada is connected to the Metro station.) All in all, it was fine since my employer was paying the bill, but I wouldn't spend my own money to stay here. There are better or cheaper hotels (perhaps both) in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Highly overrated, overpriced, and thank god my stay there is over.”
Reviews.Author: joelford
Reviews.Content: We booked a week at the Sheraton Centre Montreal for a combination conference/leisure trip. It was one of the conference hotels and the reviews were not terrible, so we went with it. While we traveled as a family, I am a veteran business traveler and I cannot recommend this hotel for any purpose. There are just too many other great options in Montreal for anyone to have to suffer through this travesty of a hotel. Where do I begin? The hotel is nice enough as hotels go; rooms were mostly clean and comfortable, although the hotel is dated and the window-based AC units are noisy. Getting hot water out of the sink faucet required a wait, although hot water from the shower was plentiful. We found that the staff were less than friendly on many occasions and seemed to want to steer us to hotel services rather than help us locate local providers. The television channel options were pitiful, however. Like most higher end hotels, the Sheraton hotel provides a concierge lounge that provides breakfast, evening hors d' oeuvres, beverages, and business center access. This hotel, however, charges $60 a day for their lounge access, which is easily 130% of the average. For this over-priced amount, we got cold cuts and cold boiled eggs for both breakfast and evening meals. The breakfast did provide some pastries and cereal as well and the evening fare added some rather cheap and tasteless finger foods. There was also coffee, but no soft drinks, and no snacks at all except during the meals. The staff of this grand buffet were consistently glum and disrespectful. The entire affair seemed to be carried out with an air of suspicion and an intent to minimize the provision of anything to customers. Refills of beverage, even water, were scarce and when asked to do anything, the staff responded as if they had been bothered by a fly. Oh well, at least they had a business center with internet access... On my first attempt at using the two PC's and printer that made up the "business center", I found that one PC (in French) required a password - no instructions were available and the staff... well, we've already talked about them. The second PC gave me a blue screen of death when I tried to use it. A subsequent effort to use the center to edit a PowerPoint presentation found that the PC's had NO business software AT ALL!!!! No MS Office, not even a Word or PowerPoint VIEWER?!?!?!? They did however, have the free adobe reader, probably only because it was free. The systems were also in French. Now, I know that the national language of Canada is French and I'm okay with that. But even in Paris, they provide language options for travelers. The hotel advertises free wifi access in "public areas", however, their "public area" is a very small place on the first floor and I was appalled to find out that my $60 a day for concierge access did not include wifi. NO, that would be an additional $16 per day and I could not access the public wifi in the lounge. Not only that, it did not allow the connection of multiple devices, so if my wife was connected with her iPhone, I could not connect with my laptop without bumping her off. We complained to the desk about this, who immediately blamed the provider and stated that they were powerless to do anything. We also complained to the desk about the exorbitant lounge charges and the poor food options, but this resulted only in a wincing agreement from the desk clerk. The beds were comfortable enough, but we had to call housekeeping to exchange the heavy winter-weight duvet covers (they weighted about 60lbs!) for lighter blankets. The housekeeping staff seemed to be forgetful; one day we'd have new glasses, another we wouldn't. There were no refrigerators in the room, although when we asked about that, we found one could be provided (for a nominal fee, of course). I've stayed at a lot of hotels of varying quality and style. I'm not snobby nor overly demanding, but I do look for and appreciate quality service and a good price to quality ratio. Neither was available at the Sheraton Centre Montreal. This hotel, more than any other I've ever stayed at, was focused only on maximizing THEIR profit. Every aspect of this hotel operation made an effort to provide minimal service to the customer while charging the maximum payment in return. This greedy concept was so ingrained that it was blatant and arrogant. My stay at this hotel has left me with a strongly negative perception of the hotel, Montreal, and the Sheraton franchise as a whole. Montreal is more expensive now than it ever has been and the recession has certainly impacted the service industry worldwide. That is no excuse, however, for poor service and exaggerated pricing. Other hotels in Montreal are able to provide outstanding quality and service in the same price range. The Sheraton Centre will happily take your money, but you can get much better value and quality for your dollar in other Montreal hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Le Centre Montreal is a great hotel in the heart of Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: KevToronto
Reviews.Content: Last weekend a group of friends and myself decided to make a weekend trip to Montreal. Thinking that we were going to have to pay top dollar due to our last minute plans, we went on the Sheraton Le Centre Montreal website and found a great rate on two rooms. While that would have been enough to make us happy, when we went to the hotel for our stay we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was great. The room we stayed in was newly renovated and the staff were extremely courteous. The room and hotel was very clean. One person who was extremely helpful and friendly was Voula in the breakfast dining room. She was such a pleasant person and took the time to talk to us about our travel plans and provide some ideas of things we could do for the day. She definitely deserves a big thank you for making our trip a great experience. There are always lots of choices in hotels when visiting a big city, but when you have such a wonderful experience, you want to share it with others. I highly recommend staying at this hotel on your next visit to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: rescuev
Reviews.Content: After searching many hotels and reading reviews on trip advisor, I choose the Sheraton. I was very satisfied. The location was good. It was a few blocks from St. Catherine which has alot of shopping and restauraunts. You can also walk to Old Montreal in about 20 minutes. The rooms were nicely updated. There is not free Wi-Fi in the room, but the business center in the lobby is. Unless you are doing alot of work, the business center is the way to go. Everyone was very helpful. The second night we had a disturbance next door at 3:00 AM. We called the desk and they came right up. The next day we asked if we could change rooms in case it happened again but they said the guests were checking out. I don't want to say, but they made up for the inconvenience. We were very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: JayBos
Reviews.Content: Overall, disappointing. This hotel is packed with tour groups and frat brats (and men acting like frat brats) during the summer week I was there. On Friday night I was woken up by a screaming drunk woman pounding on doors looking for her room. On Saturday night at 3:30 a.m. somebody pulled the fire alarm. Classier, similarly priced and possibly quieter hotels exist in downtown Montreal. The lobby interior is dated. Lots of 80s brass and "marble." The gym area is cramped and cannot be used by more than a few people at a time. The room I had was small but adequate with a nice view. The bathroom sink AND tub were malfunctioning and only drained very slowly. The bed was nice and the room was cleaned spotless every day by a very friendly room attendant. I'd say for the money, stay someplace else. This place is barely 3 stars and the amenities are disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Be smart, avoid all of their services, and you may achieve bargain Nirvana”
Reviews.Author: wombat23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton after booking through Hotwire. At $108/night for a family of four, I don't have a lot to complain about. The room was tastefully appointed, the beds were really comfy, the bathroom was beautiful, and the view fine. It was all newly redecorated. Beyond that, we found the pool clean, attractive and well-managed, with plush towels a-go-go and helpful staff on hand. Even the elevators were swift and smooth. At the rate we booked, this hotel far exceeded expectations. But I still have a few niggly issues, each involving ridiculous charges. First, the parking was outrageously expensive. Luckily our car with roof box was too tall for the lot, and so we had to seek parking outside the hotel. Literally sharing a wall with the hotel and probably more convenient was a garage off of Stanley St.. We paid less over the whole weekend than it would have been for one night in the Sheraton. There appear to be tons of options, so I advise travellers to look outside the hotel. Second, the internet access fee of 15$ per day may not be uncommon in Canadian hotels, but it is a bit of a joke for seasoned travellers. When even one-star motels in the sticks offer free wireless internet, the idea of a four-star hotel in a major city squeezing visitors at a ridiculous rate is just in poor taste. Third, the food services are also offered at obscene prices. A breakfast at Reuben's on St. Catherine, two blocks away, would be about 40% of the hotel charge, probably better, and your coffee would be refilled. Because of my resistance to the irritating internet access gouge, I went down to the bar to use the free wireless. They give you 45 minutes for free. It is renewable but also unnecessarily confusing. Anyway, I had two drinks the first night in the very nice bar area. 23$!?! I asked about the bill ... I mean we are talking about domestic beer here ... but apparently there is a charge for everything. Summary: Their renovation is outstanding and the place is very attractive, tasteful, comfortable, and well-located downtown. However I would rather not feel like I am being "nickel and dimed" when in a four-star establishment. It is T A C K Y. For our weekend, I am awarding 5-stars for the room and 3 stars for the services; averaged this is 4 stars and a satisfied customer but I hope the hotel will reconsider its absurd mark ups.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: sjkel
Reviews.Content: Through priceline we got a room for 3 nights at the Sheraton. We go to Montreal 2 times a year and have always gotten a different hotel. This one was the complete package, the best yet. It had a wonderful pool and hot tub. When we asked about a fridge, they ushered one up to us right away. And it was a big one! The room was clean and modern. We could order movies if we wanted. The bathroom was really nice. The lobby was beautiful. The location was good for downtown. No matter where we stay downtown we always take the subway to Old Montreal- for adventure and ease on the legs- but one could easily walk there from this hotel. And its only 2 blocks from the metro, if you decide to go that route. There was free internet in the lobby, which our teenagers, and apparantly other's teens loved. All in all we were very happy this hotel. The cleanliness, service, pool facilities, location, and beauty were all wins for us. Not to mention we did not feel treated like second class because we did priceline. (Which happened to us once before at a different place with a different budget program- read one of my other contributions.) 2 thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more...”
Reviews.Author: nancy12988
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Centre Sheraton with family on our trip to Canada. We got the room for free using the points on our Starwood Preferred card. Went to Canada during Fourth of July weekend and it was filled with customers when we went that weekend. Had to pay for parking (self is $23 and valet is $30). We chose self parking since they give you unlimited in & out also it saves money on the tips if you put the car in valet. St. Catherine street is literally 4 blocks away, so great location if you plan to go out for restaurants and drinks at night. Great drink specials...$6 martini even at midnight on a Sat. Went out for dinner one night in Old Montreal for a pre-fix menu for $25 with 3 course meal that comes with 10 oz. NY strip steak. It's about a 15 min walk to Chinatown for dim sum. Def. worth it to go to Underground City. It's filled with restaurants and botiques inside. There is a pool in the hotel, but due to construction the sun deck was not finished when I was there. The pool was small and not many lounge chairs to relax. The hotel was so-so..could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service-Great Pool/Fitness!!!”
Reviews.Author: JannieBoo
Reviews.Content: Although there was construction all around the front of the hotel and window cleaners everytime we tried to open our drapes, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves here. Beautiful room was nicely upgraded, shower head was the raintype, computer area was always accessible and the staff very friendly. Really enjoyed our first visit in a sheraton and would definately stay here again. Can't beat the location, Metro is right across the street!! Can travel all day for $7-great way to get around. Yummy chez cora just around the corner on stanley, great starbucks coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “As always, a great place to be!”
Reviews.Author: SKSC
Reviews.Content: This is the 25th time we've stayed at this hotel and they keep getting better! The only "fly" in the ointment was the man at the front desk to check us in. He was kind of snobby, but when I asked to speak to the manager, he arrived back with our "comp." upgrade (we are SPG gold members). As the club lounge was undergoing renos. we were given comp. breakfasts in the main restaurant for 3 mornings until the Club opened. Nice touch! We were most impressed with the wonderful renos. with the rooms...beautiful! All new carpets, furniture, bedding, bathroom. A new computer centre has been set up on the first floor beside the bar. All guests are given 45 mins. of free internet service per day...great! The Friday that we were there a large water pipe burst and flooded several of the upper floors. Luckily, the water missed our room on the 35th floor. We "evacuated" the room and went to dinner only to find firemen and most of the hotel staff standing guard in the lobby. I was most impressed with how efficient and caring everyone was in the midst of this chaos. They put out food and drink in the main lobby for all the people re-located due to the flood. The GM of the hotel even personally offered me free food and drink. Everyone was wonderful. When I requested a late check out, the front desk lady said we could take as much time as we wanted and gave us 2 free drink tickets for the bar in case we couldn't get back our room (the elevators were not working and had to be checked). Everyone was so helpful and friendly. This experience only re-emphasized why we continue to stay at this hotel year after year. Great location and staff! These people really do care about the guests. That's why Le Centre Sheraton is my only choice of hotel when visiting Montreal. Kudos to all!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Bluenose113
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights. The check in was very quick. The rooms were a little small but very comfortable. The fitness room was a little small for the size of the hotel. It got crowded in the morning. The location was great for us. It was close to everything we wanted to see and do in Montreal. There was free internet in the lobby but not in the rooms. Parking was $23 a day or $30 if you wanted the hotel to park your car. The doormen were the grumpiest bunch of guys I have ever seen. We were there for four days and never had a hint of a greeting at the door or any help offered with bags. My wife and I had a bet to see if one of them would crack a smile at us by the end of the trip. I won. No smile.

Reviews.Title: “As always, Sheraton was great”
Reviews.Author: cornmanz
Reviews.Content: Three of us drove from Toronto and arrived Friday and departed Monday. The hotel is as good as it gets for a four star. We stayed using the 'Pay Your Birthday' program. They overcharged us by $10 (10 years) for nights two and three, but front desk quickly fixed the problem. We took advantage of the green program and did not use house keeping - and received some Starwood points instead. Love that idea. Underground parking is classicly cramped, dark feeling and intimidating. Underground elevator entrance to parking is tight and cramped and hard to negotiate with luggage. Automated doors would be nice. No other negative things to mention....it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Rupkg
Reviews.Content: This was one of the few times I chose to stay in downtown rather than old Montreal. The hotel is fine, the lobby area is quite nice, the standard room was updated, clean and big enough for 2 people. The pool and hot tub were the best part of the stay! Overall a nice stay in downtown, convenient to all the shopping and restaurants but clearly downtown lacks the charm of old montreal. This is not the hotel's fault just a personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed, well designed, efficient!”
Reviews.Author: Wootten00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the Thursday before the Grand Prix in June. The airport was packed as was the hotel. Check-in was efficient despite the hairiness of the lobby; the Ferrari team was strutting through the lobby in their racing jumpsuits. Room service was at your door in 30 minutes; the food was terrific. The hotel room looked fresh and new. It was well laid out with a big flat screen that swivelled so I could eat and work while keeping an eye on the box. Right across the street from the Bell Centre, the hotel is well positioned to take in the energy of downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay At the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: cwgg
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Stay at the Sheraton. Service was on top notch. Everyone was very helpful. There was a slight confusion when checking in and the night manger quickly corrected the issue above and beyond what I was expecting. Hotel is very clean and up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: maylatur
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is excellent and the hotel is very clean and my room was very spacious. I don't drink coffee that I thought that to have a little Starbucks machine was a nice. We were leaving Montreal around 1 pm so we left the room early and left our bags downstairs and I was surprised when the bell man told me that was $4 a bag. I am always traveling and I have never heard that a hotel charges to hold the bags. That was the only thing that I did not like it. I thought was very cheesy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: TravSFam
Reviews.Content: If all of the Sheraton hotels are like this, I will never stay at any other hotel! Most comfortable beds I have ever slept on. Superior rooms and excellant staff. Everything was PERFECT. Plus a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property, Ideal Location!”
Reviews.Author: SoloAdventurer39
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying at Sheraton Properties, and this location was no exception. Situated just a few minutes walk from bustling Ste. Catherine, it is close enough to the action but distant enough so that guests are not subject to constant noise from street activity. It was so easy to walk from the hotel to the Old Port, and the rest of downtown Montreal. Service was excellent; upon check-in, Rico informed me that the travel agent had sent my hotel info twice, meaning I would likely get charged double. He followed up with my travel agent in Toronto and cleared everything up, ensured I was not over-billed. Rico and the rest of the staff were also friendly and helpful. And the room was large, clean and comfy. I would definitely stay at this property again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel, however front desk staff could improve”
Reviews.Author: Traveller27270
Reviews.Content: * Room service was excelent * Gym was excelent * Room was very good * Location is excelent * Front desk could be more polite and accomodating * Restraunt meals (ie food) should not appear on the Invoice as a Bar bill * The price that accomodation is booked for over the internet should be honoured, particularly when the client has proof of quoted price.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience was good”
Reviews.Author: gscougar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Centre for a weekend with family and two children. We had two rooms, including a request for a crib as well. However, given the demand this past weekend, the hotel was temporarily out of cribs but made sure to place an extra mattress in the room. The Manager promptly called prior to our arrival and while we traveled to Montreal to inform us of the change. Overall, the staff and the hotel accommodations were great. We parked next door at the private garage on Stanley which is a little less expensive than the hotel. Pool and gym were good too. I understand there's a charge for hi-speed internet but the lobby has free terminals for guest use. Lastly, I believe that the hotel it is pet friendly as I saw several dogs with their owners. Would recommend and would gladly return!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: CBCGirl
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to many cities where small rooms are the norm (including Venice, New York, Paris), but the room I stayed at in this hotel really took the cake. I booked through hotwire and after this experience, I will never use their service again. I had booked a room for two, and at a 4 star hotel, I was expecting either a king sized bed or two double beds but this one came with only one double bed. When I asked for a cot, furniture had to be removed from the room for the cot to fit. When we arrived in the room, strangely the bed was in the middle of the room. My husband and I were not able to move it to it's proper place. We called front desk to move it and a gentleman arrived in our room promptly. However, that was not the only issue. None of lights were plugged in, the telephone was not plugged in, the cord for the clock radio was too short to reach the outlet. The room was unacceptable, but the hotel told us that they are fully booked so we were stuck with the room. I have booked with this chain in the past and at other locations the beds are quite comfortable. Not this one. My little niece opened the door into the bathroom and her first comment was "Tres petite!" Wireless access is only free from the lobby but it's a hassle to connect to. There is also free coffee from the room. Service was quite friendly other than the gentleman at reception. I also enjoyed using their pool. The water was warm and comfortable. Would I come back? Definitely not - ignoring all the minor issues, a half decent bed is a must for me and this hotel didn't cut it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Plano_TexasCruiser
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to several attractions. Short cab from Port. Walked to Train. Walked to Hop on Hop Off for good overview tour. Walked to dinner. Excellent property - felt safe. Fantistic view from room.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and rude service”
Reviews.Author: tinahilmi
Reviews.Content: Oh where do i begin. . . I attended the 2010 Rotary International Conference in Montreal June 19 - 26th. Our district booked a block of rooms. There were many more Rotarians staying at this property. Based on the room rate and approx. number of Rotarians I would estimate that our organization pumped $100,000 per day into this hotel. I have traveled all over the world and never have we had such an awful experience as we did here. To charge $16 per day for the internet in the room is robbery on top of the "special" rate of $199 per night. When I made the reservation I requested a later checkout so that we would not have to leave for the airport so early. Flight back was at 6:30 pm. I was told no problem with my request. The morning of checkout I went to the registration desk and was told that unfortunately they could not honor their promise. I took a luggage cart back up with me and we hurried to pack. We got down to the lobby with the cart at 11:00 am sharp. I asked the hotel staff if they could put the luggage in the back room to hold and we would walk several blocks away to get some lunch and last minute gifts. The gentleman said that there was a $10 charge to put the luggage in the holding room. Funny that wasn't mentioned during check-in when they did the VERY SAME THING so that we could go eat with our District delegation in their bar/restaurant. We paid almost $1,800 for the honor of staying at this hotel and they want to charge $10 to store the luggage AFTER saying we could have a later checkout. I guess another sucker was coming in . . . Speaking of said bar/restaurant. My wife, son and I ordered 1 cheeseburger each and 1 appetizer to share as a family (6 cheesesticks I believe) and 3 sodas. The cost for this dinner was $95. Unacceptable. The service was awful. The waiter said that he was called in early because the hotel mgmt. did not anticipate being that busy. He was enjoying a BBQ at his house and rushed in to help. He NEVER came back by to see if we need anything at all. Simply handed the bills out. My son asked why we only got about 6 oz''s of coke with the meal. What a miserable experience. Positives - Housekeeping was wonderful. Cons: The room keys literally didn't work half the time. I can not recommend strongly enough - DO NOT STAY AT THIS PROPERTY.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrific guy Ben (at the Primary Lounge) is....”
Reviews.Author: HejanArgutie
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting the MontrÃ©al Sheraton Le Centre for many years now but we never felt more at home than during our last stay. At the Primary Lounge, every morning, BEN was always there to greet us in a familiar but very polite way with always something nice to mark the day. His discretion and attention to details, his willingness to avoid disturbing us during our conversation and his way of letting us feel part of the family was what made a "working-vacation" stay so relaxing. Ben should be rewarded as employee of the year for all his services to clients so early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly professional service”
Reviews.Author: Stan48
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, however for what we paid per night I would have expected the newspaper to at lest be complimentary. The charge for having my car parked for my four day stay was $115 (full price). I would have thought that it would be somewhat less for persons staying at the hotel!! (I was not impressed!) The real cost, with parking and taxes added in, for staying here was more than $260/night which is a bit too rich for what we got. Charging $14.95 for a few minutes of internet service was also rather cheezy. I have stayed at hotels much less expensive and had free wireless service.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: spmarque
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Le Centre Montreal Hotel is an excellent hotel, the rate ($) very acceptable, location excellent, very clean. Definetely I'll back to La centre Montreal. Free internet in the lobby!! Free starbucks coffee in the room!!

Reviews.Title: “Platinum members should not expect to be treated as platinum”
Reviews.Author: Daniel3282
Reviews.Content: My title says it all, 3 times I was there and complained about the location of the room. I simply ask for clean/quiet rooms...I travel enough to know not to be next to elevators & Ice machines. Every time they had to change me rooms, but always in a smaller one. For once I would have liked to have gotten my key and not have had to change. Each time the manager told me it would not occur again, and it did. On the 3rd time, I stayed only 1 of my 2 nights and checked out earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Still charging for inroom internet.”
Reviews.Author: DCDcflyer
Reviews.Content: Hey, the hotel is fine. Well located, typical Sheraton product. Comfortable bed, fair-sized bathroom. Charging for in-room internet, though, is insulting, especially when the even the typical Holiday Inn Express extends the privilege for free.

Reviews.Title: “Worry-free staying at this hotel, except for my VISA bill.”
Reviews.Author: parttimemodel
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the staff at the front desk were very professional and rapid in the transaction. I think the only barrier to feeling at ease was that I did not speak any French at all. This was not at all important for the interaction but perhaps kept both parties formal. Whenever we called the desk for towels, supplies, etc, they were sent within 5-10 minutes. Likewise, the hotel bartender, the wait staff for all catered lectures, the maid service, were all attentive+ and professional+. The room was generally very good. The lighting left some to be desired, it was hard to have one light on that was enough to read if the other 3 were sleeping. Since I went to bed later, I just ended up using the bathroom to hang out. The internet was not free from the room which was a pain to go down to the lobby business centre. We used the iron, safe, the desk with various convenient outlets for each cell phone, PDA, computer, etc. The closet and dresser storage was in sufficient for 4 people on conference but perhaps enough for 2/3 people. The quality of the complimentary shampoo was mediocre to poor, just warning in case your hair is like mine, but not a reason to complain. The location was the best feature, being close to everything. For our time outside of the conference, we could easily access shopping on St. Catherine, the metro, the Underground mall, touristy-hipster scene at Crescent st. We liked to walk, and got to Mont-Royale, McGill campus, great bring-your-own-wine restaurants, Old Montreal... but these are more features of the city rather than the hotel. Taxis are waiting for you at the back door of the lobby where the concierge and bell-hop are. You can easily do nights-on-the-town in your skyline shoes with a driver always there! I can't really complain about anything during this stay, but I had a great time on "business." For when the room service / restaurant / bar are closed, there are vending machines on every other floor - but no gingerale. And the 7th floor has a snack machine, also just chips and chocolate. The only reason I will not consider the Sheraton for future visits is the price. Also having to accommodate 4 people was not comfortable and they were not offering suites. The pool was on the small end, and closed at 10 pm which felt early for a night owl like me. There was a hot tub, and small sauna as well.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bustravel15
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff are soooo bad. I am recommending my company to never stay there again! They screwed up every bill and it took days to fix. My last stay, the idot, actually credited my whole bill when all he had to do was fix my rate. Internet is not free and you have to log in everyday...how annoying! Will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: mtn-ldy
Reviews.Content: Nice decor, and exceptionally comfortable beds and linens. I attended a conference in this hotel, and the facilities and food were excellent-- much better than other comparable venues. The concierge was helpful and polite. The only minor negative was a slight smell of smoke in my room, even though I'm quite sure this is a non-smoking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed it/much improved over years ago”
Reviews.Author: mrchillybeans
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night, in a junior suite. Club access was included in the rate which was a nice perk. Room Wifi is not included, even in the club which seemed a bit chintzy, and it seemed high at $15 CAD plus tax. The hors d'oeuvres in the evening and the breakfast were good and fresh , with lots of yummy choices. Likes: Good central location (close to St. Catherine's St, which has gotten kind of skeevy over the years, all chain stores/cheesy souvenir stores/strip clubs-skip it and go straight to Old Montreal ) Beds are very comfortable, rooms super clean. Valet Parking was a reasonable $30 (much higher than that where I live) Friendly and efficient staff (props to Maria the concierge!) Jr. suite was actually two rooms connected, with two bathrooms/closets etc Nice pool and jacuzzi Huge improvement from when I stayed in the 90s-lot of work was put into the renovation and it's clearly paid off.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced for value receved”
Reviews.Author: mildred32
Reviews.Content: Why can other, more moderately priced hotels, provide free internet service while you do not? There was something demeaning about the $5 voucher offered if we chose not to have our room made up. Food was over-priced for its qualaity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: AdrianoRome
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be better, right in the heart of the city center. Spacious rooms, always very clean, fast internet access and a magnificent plasma TV set! They are all very kind and available for any problem or questions. Everything is just excellent! Recommended for sure! The swimming pool is a bit small and when I went there it was crowded of kids. Unfortunately they accept pets so for one evening there was a small dog left in the room next to mine barking and barking but at the end they found the owner and they rebuked her, at the end I can say they managed the situation in a very polite and professional way. Aside this small incident, I think it's really an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Fun2Travel22
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were glad that there was underground parking as opposed to street parking. The staff at the front desk were not really friendly, but we were happy with the "look" of the hotel. Our room was really nice and clean with flat screen TV and nice view. We were also happy about the location. It is close enough to the old port (which is gorgeous). The food and drinks are extremely expensive. All in all, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location...Will consider for next stay”
Reviews.Author: trip_maker2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton for Labor day and everything was great...location, service, indoor pool (kids had lots of fun) etc..View from the room was perfect. Only negatives: if you have an SUV, underground parking is limited, also there are no refrigerators or microwaves...so plan accordingly. Internet is charged, but depends what offer you get and it can be free. Call in for free internet :-)

Reviews.Title: “RIP OFF! Find another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CoronaBoy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with my SPG points at 10,000 points per night. The hotel is average at its best. I found the staff unhelpful and the cleaning service very poor. To make matters worst, I noticed a $200 charge on my credit card for allegedly smoking in the room. We don't even smoke and no one smoked in the room. I guess the cleaning staff were upset at the fact that we left them no tip (well, that's what you get for poor service). The food in the hotel was not that great either and way too overpriced. We had breakfast at the Fairmount hotel instead close by and it was fabulous. Valet parking and self parking is available. The self parking is $20/day which is not so bad. On the bright side, the hotel is conveniently located close to shopping and Bell Center. I will not be staying at this hotel again as I found the managements billing practices unethical and will be filing a complaint with TICO and my credit card company for unauthorized charges.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dime you, room stunk like smoke”
Reviews.Author: brently55
Reviews.Content: I found this Sheraton to charge for too much....it just gets boring really. Parking, internet, local phone calls, breakfast, etc. When we arrived they didnt have a room with a king bed as we had booked. And the room they gave us absolutely stunk of stale cigarette smoke. The next day we asked to move to a room that was clean and had a king bed. we were told no, they were oversold and could come and spray Febreze? er, no. So we escalated, and magically a king room was available. Pool/gym was nice, but nothing else would entice me to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not the same”
Reviews.Author: Travel100percent15
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to stand in line for a long time to check in. Staff is very quick to brush you off when you ask them questions. Rooms are ok but small. They never tried to upgrade me even though I am platinum member. The thing that really bother me was that they only allowed you to get 3 $5 or 500 points deals when you forgoe to have your room cleaned for "green purposes". I stayed at the Westin in Toronto for 3 months and I received one every day...way to screw us over sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “The best value in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: relavance
Reviews.Content: My safety deposit box did not work.Room 1626. Only 3 of the elevators went up to the lounge at 37th floor. I figured out that the best way to get up there was to take any elevator to 36th and change there to 37th. Great lounge and fitness room with a nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location to night life, restaurants, and Bell Centre”
Reviews.Author: MKKC
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay within walking distance of the Bell Centre, restaurants, and patios its a great choice. Safe choice to go with. Very clean, parking was good, staff was nice. Didnt visit the bar restaurant but seemed very nice. My stay was mostly outside the hotel. The best part was the room. Bathrooms were very spacious and nice decor. The bed was like sleeping on clouds. We took down the info on the pillows covers everything. I want my home bed to be like this. Sad to leave that bed. Never once heard a noise come from outside our room. You will sleep sound.

Reviews.Title: “Very Outgoing!”
Reviews.Author: bryceconley
Reviews.Content: The tay was short but sweet , from the Valet to the Chambermaids everyone was so helpful and please to serve. The room and veiw were outstanding! Amazing experience all around...

Reviews.Title: “Well designed ADA suite”
Reviews.Author: CBDC1
Reviews.Content: (I'm writing this review for people with disabilities although much of what I say would apply for anyone. The reason for my focus is that I use a wheelchair and often try to read between the lines on Tripadvisor to see how accessible the venue is. Others may have similar concerns.) The whole hotel has recently been refurbished. I had my doubts, but it's true. The ADA rooms are truly wheelchair accessible with wide doorways, roll in shower, and plenty of outlets in accessible locations. The only difficulties I had was the bathroom sink and counter was too high (it should be at 30" and the sink and counter are 36 or higher). The pool is toasty warm, and if you can catch it without kids (better apparently weekdays than weekends) allows for a good swim. There is no lift to get in and out, but it's manageable. Hotel management is very responsive to any concerns or problems. It's a big hotel and there are no keycards required to get to the floors. But generally it's safe, well-run, clean, and comfortable. And the staff could not be nicer, friendlier or more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “definitely my pIace in MTL”
Reviews.Author: margoloves2travel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here MANY times over the years (fabulous **LOCATION, **SWEET SLEEPER beds), and was very pleasantly surprised to discover that the hotel has been completely renovated! Room decor is contemporary, beds are still fabulous, as is the shower (immediate temperature & water pressure, even on upper floors!). Spa is a reasonably good value for very good service. Lobby bar is good but $$. Internet access: rates are comparable (psst: check out free access in lobby Link@Sheraton). Breakfast is $$ so how delighted was I to discover CHEZ CORA, just around the corner on Drummond. $6.78 got me 2 poached eggs, a massive plate of FRESH fruit (not grocery store packaged) + coffee! We had a lovely dinner at BIS (Italian) 1 block over on rue de la Montagne. A trip to Montreal is not complete without UPSTAIRS jazz on Mackay, about 3 blocks over. The CENTRE BELL is just across from the hotel -- even if you can't get to a game or event, it's worth walking over to check out Canadiens jerseys etc. With Ste. Catherine's one block up (SHOPPING!!!) there's no need to rent a car -- everything is within walking distance (safe, even if alone) from Le Centre Sheraton, or a short cab ride away. If you have the time, walk down to OLD MONTREAL (rather than cab/metro) for great restaurants, shopping, people watching, Cirque du Soleil.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: BJMNanooseBay_Canada
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Most comfortable bed I have ever slept in when traveling. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room rates are higher than what one would expect to pay for this level of accommodation. Over and above the room rate they charged an outrageous daily rate for high speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “I'm surprised it "only" had 4 stars.”
Reviews.Author: SachaZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well appointed and in an excellent location, being as it is one block from the train station (lovely stroll after a lengthy journey) and literally one street from Rue Crescent containing a vast array of restaurants and bars. All staff were not just polite and knowledgable but genuinely seemed to want to help. My room was excellent, very spacious with a fabulous view, a compact but well designed bathroom and the toiletries provided were absolutely top notch. Linen and towels were both excellent quality. Great TV and a really comprehensive selection of channels too. And that bed! Oh my word, I fell asleep with no effort at all, in fact it practically makes you fall asleep by itself. The only slight issue I had was a noisy "neighbour" - in fact a room of squaking girls who kept me awake until 3am. A little more soundproofing would have been good. I must say that the staff were prepared to assist and I did report it, however I saw the culprits myself and asked them to keep the noise down. Either they acquiessed or the bed worked it's magic because I didn't hear then again. Overall the hotel is fantastic and I would definitely recommend you to others. The only thing "missing" was a mini bar, however as I am not a fan of $8 chocolate bars it wasn't a problem for me. Good job.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Edber
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels that are not at the same level as the Sheraton, and have never been charged an additional fee to use the Internet connection. I mean really at $135/night, the hotel wants an additional $16+tax /day to use the Internet in my room!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: gerrynl
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the Le Centre Sheraton in Montreal from Apr.2/10-Apr.8/10.This is a newly renovated hotel in the center of downtown Montreal.The amenities and services were excellent.The concierge service was great especially Maria B. who was very knowledgeable and was eager to assist you with any inquiries.If you want to stay in hotel in downtown Montreal with exceptional service and amenities then I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: letsgorangers25
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for anybody who is visiting Montreal. It is in a great location, less than a mile from the Bell Centre and St. Catherine Street(where many fun things are). The employees were friendly and spoke English very well, for those like me who don't know that much French. An overall great hotel with a fair price!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TrailMixy
Reviews.Content: We planned a last minute trip to Montreal over Easter Weekend and stayed at the Sheraton. It was a clean, comfortable stay at a really nice hotel. The service was friendly and helpful. A pleasant stay. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Montreal's Best Concierge”
Reviews.Author: MCTravelGuyNYC
Reviews.Content: Ask for "Maria" the Concierge. She will definately point you in the right direction. She is the best. I'm looking forward to my next trip and her spectacular recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: yogadocmom
Reviews.Content: I was not offered nor received any Starwood Gold member benefits. Kind of a rushed check-in although no one in line. I stay here with my family for the pool. Windows do not open, no ventilation.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: TonyGrice
Reviews.Content: One night stay,everything was ok.I had to ask to have the internet charge removed.

Reviews.Title: “great spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: POODLE18
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay. Very clean and modern, close to Bell Centre, and Ste Catherine St shopping. We stayed for two nights with no problems, quiet in hallways and at night. Very private and easy access. Great spot if you're going to habs game or concert

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice pool, renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: smbbeb
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this place got such bad reviews. it's in a great location - right between renee levesque and st. catharines (sorry for the spelling!). we walked to both the top of mount royal and into old montreal from the hotel. we only took the metro to get to the biodome and the metro was so close - otherwise everywhere is very walkable. my suggestion - sign up for an spg account (their loyalty program) before you go - they have a few "SPG only" floors which are higher with lovely views of mount royal and you get a few little perks like free bottled water and robes - it's free to sign up. our room had a king sized bed and pull out couch, nice big flat screen tv and view of mt. royal - on the 33rd floor. the beds are very comfy - nice sheets and amazing pillows!! the pool is GREAT!! there are not a lot of hotels in montreal with indoor pools - and if you have kids and this is important to you then the pool here is lovely - very big and warm - and the hot tub, sauna and gym are all in the same location and very nice. there's also a fridge with free bottled water in the gym/pool area (it's on the 6th floor so if you leave your room in your swimsuit you don't have to walk through the lobby or anything..). the spa is also there (for massage etc. - it looked very nice). everything was very clean and modern. we booked into the omni because we got a really cheap deal and checked out once we saw how outdated it was and checked in here. i actually like the location better too as it's closer to st. catharine st. wifi is expensive ($14.95/day) BUT there is a big computer pool in the lobby with big flat screen macs - about 8 of them - for you to use for free if you are a guest - including a printer. as i only had my one laptop and my 2 kids with me we chose to go down to the lobby to use the internet - i brought my laptop and got free wifi down there and the kids used the comptuers there. it was very nice and the lobby is great - there serve starbucks products too with very reasonable prices for coffee/sandwiches - plus right outside (literally) there are tons of food options. the room also has a coffee maker with starbucks coffee and fresh cream so that's nice in the morning. chez cora is across the street of the hotel for breakfast which is amazing and eggspectations is a 5 minute walk (another breakfast place - really great and a montreal 'icon'). overall i would definately stay there again. modern, clean, nice, great location and very reasonable prices - eps. if you get a good deal on the website or somewhere like travelzoo.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, room issues, desolate neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: Pensylvanian4
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to be there for four nights but I checked out without refund. The rooms are tiny but clean. Getting help at night for the burned out lights and the phone that didn't work was impossible. One person manned the desk at night (in a huge hotel) so there was always a line, It was even tough to buy drink at the bar. The neighborhood was a vast area of parking lots without services. Everything in the hotel was overpriced. I had just come from the Lord Elgin in Ottawa so I was used to being treated well and charged less. That hotel felt like home away from home on Parliament Hill. The Sheridan was a huge hotel that could use some better management.

Reviews.Title: “.”
Reviews.Author: FredrickB
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay, very central, near to the Metro of interest for me.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay and pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: uconn_cappy
Reviews.Content: My husband, miniature dachshund and I stayed here and found the rooms to be comfortable and clean. The beds in particular were quite comfortable. The hotel is very convenient to the "club" part of downtown. If you'd rather be close to the historic part of Montreal, the water, or the convention center this may not be the place for you. We found ourselves walking between 15-30 minutes each way to get to those named locations. The hotel and its patrons were very good to our pooch; there was no extra charge for her to stay with us. We had to walk a few blocks to find a park for our dog. If you need/want to stay in this area with a dog, you may want to try the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth - there was a park right next to the inn.

Reviews.Title: “Ventilation system noisy”
Reviews.Author: Travellinggirl2010
Reviews.Content: Good location, but rooms are small although the hotel was renovated in 2009. The main problem is the ventilation system. I was put on the 35th floor. There was a consistent humming noise. After about 1 hour of not being able to sleep I called the front desk and told them. I heard nothing for about 1 hour and then I called again. I was told that the security guard went to investigate but could find no reason for the noise. Eventually they changed my room to the 36th floor and when I arrived (1am) it was even worse. They then gave me a room on the 7th floor, which was much better. Although I like Sheraton Hotels, I won't stay at this one again because of these reasons. Parking is $20.00 per day, restaurant was good. Internet is $15.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Le Centre Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Vaskar
Reviews.Content: Truly outstanding hotel located in the heart of the downtown Montral. My experience is amaizing. This is a truly 5 star hotel which leave you almost nothing to complain.
